description: COHENDavid 10 years today Beloved husband of the late Rose. Devoted father of the late Sylvia Mintzer and Mildred Matin. Dear grandfather of Lewis Freya and Stephon. You are always in our hearts. We miss you.

title: Weak Demand Leaves Fiber Industry in Summer Lull
description: The fiber industry is going through a summer malaise, a study of the supplydemand and price situation has indicated. For some types of manmade fibers, demand is weak, with prices eroded to a point where they hardly cover production costs.

title: Bridge:
description: As they have repeatedly shown in world championship competition, the Australians maintain high standards of bridge performance although they are far from the major bridge centers of North America and Europe. They recently invited a worldfamous team to tour their continent, and a Lancia team, composed of Benito Garozzo, Giorgio Belladonna, Pietro Forquet and Omar Sharif, performed impressively in a series of exhibition matches.

title: Helping New York
description: ???ose Cannelli went into the Village Community Problem Center at 80 Thompson Street in the South Village the other day and announced that she had a legitimate complaint to make.

title: Royal Tradition Veils the Real Elizabeth
description: LONDON, July 5Walter Bagehot, the 19thcentury political scientist, said in his remarkable study of the English Constitution that one of the better uses of the monarchy was that it was intelligible. A queen could be understood, he wrote, and the nice and pretty events in which she participated could be appreciated, whereas the subtleties of Parliament and the Cabinet were and always would be murky and vaguely irritating.

title: Bicentennial Spirit Lingers in New York
description: The morning after, the euphoria was still there.

title: Gromyko, Not Brezhnev, At U.S. Embassy Party
description: MOSCOW, July 5 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko was the only toplevel Soviet official to attend an American Embassy reception in Moscow tonight marking the Bicentennial.

title: Soccer Head ReElected
description: VALLEY FORGE, Pa., July 5 (UPI)Gene Edwards of Milwaukee was reelected president of the United States Soccer Federation today at the organization's annual meeting.

title: Opening the Mail With Billy Martin
description: With the ease of a majorleague manager whose team has a ninegame lead, Billy Martin chuckled as he opened letters from fans telling him how to manage better. And now, with curiosity, he opened a cardboard package. Inside was a small framed poster.

title: Space Cut is Feared If Viking Doesn't Discover Life on Mars
description: PASADENA. Calf., July 5 (AP)A biologist on the team directing the Viking spacecraft to Mars says he fears that, if life is not found there, funds will be cut from the nation's spare exploration effort.

title: Banks, Markets Closed
description: Banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut were closed yesterday for the Independence Day holiday. All securities markets and commodities exchanges were also closed.

title: FOUR BILLS SIGNED BY GOVERNOR CAREY
description: ALBANY, July 5 (UPI)Goyernor Carey has signed fourl bills dealing with the rights of the blind, prison release and furlough programs, and nursing home ownership, it was announced today.

title: Carter Describes Muskie As Qualified for Ticket
description: PLAINS, Ga., July 5Jimmy Carter said today after a discussion with Senator Edmund S. Muskie, that the Maine Senator was well qualified to be his VicePresidential running mate but that his decision would not be made until next week after he met with four or more other prospects.

title: Seaport Museum Closes And Crowd Turns Angry
description: The South Street Seaport Museum had to close early in the afternoon yesterday, barely three hours after it had opened, because of the crush of people who wanted to visit the tall ships tied up at the seaport for the Bicentennial celebration.

title: Bicentennial Spirit Lingers in New York
description: The morning after, the euphoria was still there.

title: Israeli Navy Men Here Showered With Kisses
description: Hundreds of New Yorkers yesterday climbed aboard the two Israeli gunboats visiting the city for the Bicentennial to congratulate the young sailors on Israel's raid this weekend on the Entebbe airport in Uganda.

title: Port Authority Paradox
description: Pushed along by the Goveri nors of the two states and their chairman, the policymaking commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey have agreed to finance extensive new rail transit projects. Yet the authority, longresistant to masstransit ventures, has actually paid more than Si million to help its bondholders bring suit to prevent such rail projects.

title: The Puzzle Of Crime By Kids
description: When a 41yearold man was stabbed to death this summer in Greenwich Village, no one was really surprised when police arrested a 14yearold youth and charged him with the killing. Juvenile crime clearly has been increasing.

title: Virginia Beach Revelers Fight Police
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, July 5 (AP)Hundreds of youthful Fourth of July celebrants clashed with the police in this resort city early today before being dispersed by tear gas and canine units, the police said.

title: The Heart of the Law is the Heart of the Lawyer
description: In the concern over the ills of legal education, let me suggest another malady. I believe that in prizing intelligence, law teachers have become too inattentive toindeed, rejecting ofmatters of the heart.

title: Visitors Make Themselves At Home on Visit to Ship
description: The Gloria is a Colombian bark whose three tall masts rise with towering dignity from a burnished hull. Yesterday the vessel looked more like the centerpiece in a grand carnival.

title: BANKS WEAKENED, NADER STUDY SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The nation's banking system has been significantly weakened by the expansion of banks into other fields, the Public Interest Research Group, a Ralph Nader organization, said in a detailed analysis made Publie today.

title: Aspin Says Data Show Navy is Gaining
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Still secret Navy projections show that the adverse naval trends of the last decade have been reversed and that by 1980 the United States will once again have a bigger surface fleet than the Soviet Union, Representative Les Aspin said today.

title: Giants Top Cards As Murcer Stars
description: Bobby Murcer collected three hits, scored two runs and knocked in one to wind up as the hero of San Francisco Giants 64 victory over the Cardinals in St. Louis last night.

title: Big Party Goes On Today With a Broadway Parade
description: It's not over yet. The salute to the nation's 200th birthday  which began on Saturday when the gray Navy ships plowed up the Hudson and which burst into a glorious Fourth of July with tall ships, land and sea parties, fireworks and floodlights that bathed the Statue of Liberty in a haze of smoke and lightwill stretch on.

title: Business Group Asks Federal System Of Welfare Instead of Fund Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The Committee for Economic Development an organization of business leaders who study and issue reports on national problems, recommends that general revenue sharing funds be cut off and that the money be used to pay the full cost of welfare nroerams.

title: GRGA ZLATOPER, 65, OF VOICE OF AMERICA
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Grga Zlatoper, former chief of the. Voice of America's Yugoslav service, died yesterday at, George Washington University Hospital here after a long illness. He was 65 years old.

title: Neighborhoods Turn to SelfHelp For Preserving and Improving
description: Mader Shepherd and his neighbors in the shadow of the ruins of the PruittIgo housing project in St. Louis are doing something no one else will do for them: They are reclaiming) their houses and trying to hold their neighborhood together.

title: CITY SEEKS SAVINGS IN ELECTRICITY PLAN
description: New York City hopes to save $16 million in the fiscal year that started last Thursday by buying electricity from the Power Authority of the State of New York in negotiations still under way, according to John T. Carroll, Municipal Service Administrator.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Federal mediators met with officers of voluntary hospitals yesterday, but no progress was reported toward averting a strike of 40,000 hospital workers in New York City set for 6 A.M. tomorrow. The hospitals say they have no money to pay the raises sought by District 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees. The union deferred until Saturday at 6 A.M. a strike deadline that had also been set for some 14 nursing homes associated with the hospitals. Meanwhile, Governor Carey named Matthew Nimetz a 37yearold former White House aide to assist in resuming negotiations in the dispute.

title: Spain's New Prime Minister
description: MADRID, July 5With the appointment of 43yearold Adolfo Surez Gonzlez, who was sworn in today as Prime Minister, the silent generation assumes command in Spain when the civil war ended in 1939, beginning 36 years of dictatorial rule by Generalissimo Francisco Franco, Mr. Surez was not yet 7 years old and King Juan Carlos I, who appointed him Saturday, was just over a year old.

title: West Germany, Iran Sign Pacts on Atomic Plant
description: TEHERAN, Iran, July 5 (UPI) West Germany and Iran have signed two atomic pacts, one of which officially approved completion of multibillion dollar twin reactors that have been under construction for nearly a year.

title: MADRID LIBERALS BOYCOTT CABINET
description: MADRID, July 5  The Cabinet minister who was in charge of Spain's only legal political party was sworn in as Prime Minister today, and a number of leading advocates of political change refused to serve in his Government.

title: Mount Vernon Marks Holiday With Nod to John Peter Zenger
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., July 5  it could have been any American small town as neatly dressed men and women settled on folding chairs in front of buntingdraped speaker's platform set up on the village green.

title: Woman Deckhand Drowns
description: WASHINGTON. July 5 (AP) A woman deckhand aboard a tour boat anchored in the Potpmac River for the Fourth of July fireworks display here last night plunged over the site of the boat and drowned, the police said. The death of Sarah Warren, 20 years old, is under investigation but is believed to be accidental, detectives said. Miss Warren, a student at George Washington University from Old Lyme, Conn., was one of four deckhands aboard the Spirit of 76 tour boat.

title: That Dream Taxi
description: Why are all those people crying at the Museum of Modern Art? They are New Yorkers, weeping bitter tears at the taxi show, dreaming the impossible dream of comfortable, clean, safe, attractive cabs.

title: Bizarre Twist to Olympic Horse Dispute
description: With the start of the Olympic Games in Montreal almost two weeks away, a bizarre controversy has broken out between the American Horse Shows Association and the rider of one of the country's leading horses.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Idi Amin of Uganda said yesterday that Uganda reserved the right to retaliate in whatever way it could to redress what he called the aggression against it in the Israeli raid on Entebbe airport. In the first full account from Uganda of what happened at Entebbe Saturday night, President Amin indicated that he became involved with the hijackers only at the moment they requested landing permission last week. He also charged that Kenya and other neighboring states had collaborated with Israel in the raid that freed the hostages. Much of black Africa reacted to the raid with public condemnation, but considerable private admiration for the Israeli commandos. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: Pound. Reverses Losses; Gold is Steady at $123.15
description: LONDON, July 5 (Reuters)The pound closed around 50 cent higher against the dollar, reversing its moderate losses Friday after news of lower British monetary reserves in June.

title: Credit Markets Optimistic Rates Will Remain Stable
description: The credit markets do not expect any fireworks in July, but they are optimistic that rates will at least remain stable and perhaps even decline somewhat. Moneysupply growth has been brought under control, and the volume of financing to be done this month will be much lighter than it was in June, many moneymarket economists emphasized just before the threeday Bicentennial weekend.

title: Brazil is Seeking to Double Its Yearly Steel Production by 1980
description: RIO DE JANEIROBrazil has embarked on one of the most ambitious steel expansion programs in the developing world.

title: DR. WERTHAMER, 51, CANCER RESEARCHER
description: Dr. Seymour Werthamer, director of clinical laboratories at. Methodist Hospital in Brooklyn, died Saturday of cancer at the age of 51. He had also been a professor of pathology at Downstate Medical Center.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Operas Sing Praises of Nathan's
description: The problem for the creative team at Martin Landey, Arlow Advertising after getting the Nathan's Famous account was setting the 58unit operation apart from the Multitude of other fastfood chains in the New York market.

title: Kansas City Taken Over By Shriners Convention
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., July 5 (UPI)Arab sheiks swished in flowing robes, Keystone Kops cavorted on tricyclesized motor scooters, the cavalry chased the Indians, trumpeters tooted, horses pranced and motorcycles chuggedcraziness prevailed on the downtown streets today.

title: U.S. CONCERNS ASK WORLD BRIBE PACT
description: PARIS, July 5With pressure building for Congress to enact legislation compelling disclosure of bribery payments to foreign government officials, Americanbased multinational corporations are trying to get similar rules accepted for other international corporations.

title: EDWARD A. BLAIR
description: Edward A. Blair, an organizational director for the Southern department of Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America for many years, died in his sleep Sunday while visiting his daughter, Mrs. Paul Gresham in Marietta, Ga. He was 59 years old and lived in Aberdeen. Miss.

title: Spain's New Prime Minister
description: MADRID, July 5With the appointment of 43yearold Adolfo Surez Gonzlez, who was sworn in today as Prime Minister, the silent genera:tion assumes command in Spain. When the civil war ended in 1939, beginning 36 years of dictatorial rule by Generalissimc Francisco Franco, Mr. Surez was not yet 7 years old and King Juan Carlos I, who appointed him Saturday, was just over a year old.

title: Astros Trounce Mets, 7 to
description: HOUSTON. July 5  Six consecutive hits, including a home run, triple, double and three singles, gave the Houston Astros a sixrun fourth inning tonight as they defeated the New York Mets, 73, at the Astrodome.

title: U.S. Mercenary's Lawyer Hopes for a Commutation
description: WASHINGTON. July 5 (AP) The lawyer for an American mercenary sentenced to die in Angola said today that he was hopeful that President Agostinho Neto would respond to humanitarian appeals for commutation of the death penalty.

title: Pair of Bishops Can't Grant A Free Passport to Victory
description: Nowadays the theme of playing for the bishoppair is heavily overworked. It is one thing to possess the bishops in a wide  open position where they are monstrously powerful, and quite another to have them in a semiclosed position where the pawn structure denies them useful diagonals.

title: FRED GURLEY, 87; HEADED RAILROAD
description: Fred G. Gurley, who rose from clerk on the Burlington Railroad to president and chairman of the Atcheson, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway, died Sunray of a kidney ailment at his home in Chicago. He was 87 Years old.

title: New Envoy for Vietnam
description: LONDON, July 5 (Reuters)Britain has recognized the unified Vietnam, a Foreign Office spokesman said today. The spokesman said that Robert Tesh, who has been Britain's Ambassador to North Vietnam, is now the ambassador in Hanoi to the whole country.

title: Royal Tradition Veils the Real Elizabeth
description: LONDON, July 5Walter Bagehot, the 19thcentury political scientist, said in his remarkable study of the English Constitution that one of the better uses of the monarchy was that it was intelligible. A queen could be understood, he wrote, and the nice and pretty events in which she participated could be appreciated, whereas the subtleties of Parliament and the Cabinet were and always would be murky and vaguely irritating.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: TRUSTEESHIP COUNCIL Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Elinor Krieger is Bride
description: Elinor K. Krieger, widow of Maurice Krieger, who was a corporate tax authority, was married yeterday to Edmund Grasheim, an insurance executive and horticulturist. The ceremony was performed in the Blitzer Chapel of the Central Synagogue by Rabbi Sheldon Zimmerman. Mr. Grasheim is a supervisor of the Blutstein Agency of Connecticut Mutual Life. His first wife died.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1976, by Triangle Publications, The. (The Daily Racing Form) Monday, July 5. Sixth day. Weather clear, track fast

title: Foolish Pleasure Beats Forego by Nose at Aqueduct
description: Forego may be a better horse than Foolish Pleasure but not quite nine pounds better.

title: MICHAEL A. SMITH
description: Michael A. Smith, a Republican member of the New Hampshire House of Representatives from 1974 to 1976, died of a heart attack Friday at his home in Hampton, N. H. He was 40 years old.

title: Israelis Believe Extension of Deadline by the Hijackers Was Crucial to Raid's Success
description: JERUSALEM, July 5 The 72hour deadline extension won from the Air France hijackers at noon last Thursday proved crucial element in the success of the Israeli rescue of the 103 hostages and crew members Saturday night.

title: New York Families Lagging in Purchasing Power
description: New York City as been undergoing a slower decline in population  but suffering a greater decline in family purchasing power  than other major cities, according to new analyses of Census Bureau data.

title: Liberty Bloody Good for Sailors on Town
description: Bloody good, the Australian sailors shouted, tossing their white caps onto the bar. They were talking about the 35cent beers they had discovered at Smith's Bar on Eighth Avenue near 44th Streeta better deal than the twodollar beers being offered to sailors in a few other bars around Times Square.

title: Tying One On for New York City Fashionably
description: There's a new fashion label in town. It's Stern & Wagner, in old English lettering, and it appears discreetly on the inside of an $8.10 navy necktie embossed with tiny gold seals of the City of New York.

title: NO NEED TO DIG UP PIPELINE. AIDES SAY
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, July 5 (AP)Officials of the consortium building the transAlaska oil pipeline say that questionable welds on the 800mile project can be checked without unearthing the more than 300 miles of buried pipe.

title: Jersey Assembly Slates Debate on Tax Issue Again
description: TRENTON, July 5The State Assembly reconvenes tomorrow to try once again to pass an income tax measure that would balance the school budget and reopen the state's public schools, which were shut last Thursday under orders of the New Jersey Supreme Court.

title: There's Heresy Afoot Among Tomato Growers
description: Should you pinch the suckers? Before anyone gets the idea that this is a story about arresting fools or playing the Marquis de Sade to fish cephalopods, let it be explained that the subject is tomatoes.

title: Swedes Give Statuette Of Poseidon to Beame
description: Vice Admiral Bengt Lundvall, chief of Naval Operatio]ns for the Royal Swedish Navy, presented a statuette of Poseidon to First Deputy Mayor John E. Zuccotti in a brief ceremony in City Hall's Blue Room yesterday afternoon amid a fanfare of bugles.

title: Riding Squad Selected
description: UNIONVILLE, Pa., July 5Headed by Bruce Davidson the world champion, the five members of the United States Equestrian Team's threeday squad for the Olympic Games were selected today.

title: Rudel is Rejuvenated By the Magic of Mozart
description: PARIS, July 5 As he walked out the artist's entrance of the Paris Opera, Julius Rudel wiped the damp from his face. He had just conducted The Abduction From the Seraglio in heavy tails, complete with vest and cummerbund, though the orchestra had won the extraordinary right to play in shirtsleeves in this summer of torrid torture.

title: EZRA SHINE
description: Ezra Shine, a certified public accountant whose clients included prominent figures in the theater, died Sunday at his home. 37 West 12th Street. He was 64 years old.

title: Pilot Says Africans Didn't Stand in for Gunmen
description: PARIS, July 5  The French commander of the Air France plane hijacked to Uganda said today that the hostages had constantly been under the surveillance of their abductors and that Uganda soldiers had not been substituted for the hijackers as guards.

title: Major Offense Unit Of Bronx D.A. Put On Exemplary List
description: Citing its 96 percent conviction rate for major offenders, the Federal Law Enforcement Assistance Administration has named the Bronx District Attorney's major offense bureau to its list of exemplary projects.

title: Carter Describes Muskie As Qualified for Ticket
description: PLAINS. Ga., July 5Jimmy Carter said today after a discussion with Senator Edmund S. Niuskie that the Maine Senator was well qualified to be his VicePresidential running mate but that his decision would not be made until next week after he met with four or more other prospects.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: TV: Networks 4th of July Coverage is Impressive
description: Unlike a little learning, always a dangerous thing, a little television is not only benign but also advisable on a major national holiday drenched in the kind of weather that is almost perfectly suited to outdoor traditions. The three commercial networks did, for a change provide the mils; audience with some real choices for the Fourth of Juiy Bicentennial.

title: Amin Letter to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS July 5 (Reuters)President Idi Amin of Uganda called, in a letter delivered tonight to United Nations headquarters, for Israel to be condemned in the strongest possible terms, but did not specifically request a meeting of the Security Council.

title: Israeli Official Seeks Broader Airline Security
description: TEL AVIV, July 5Transport Minister Gad Jacobi said today that he wanted legal power to make the tight security measlures already enforced by Israeli (carriers also applicable to forleign airlines serving Israel.

title: Hospital for Joint Diseases Plans Orthopedic Institute
description: The Hospital for Joint Diseases and Medical Center announced yesterday that it would build a 17story Orthopedic Institute in downtown Manhattan next to the Beth Israel Medical Center.

title: Hall, Burrell and Farlow 'String Along at Festival
description: The Newport Jazz Festival program devoted to the electric guitar was a quiet, almost sleepy affair, and that in itself was noteworthy. For several years now, the art of jazzguitar playing as it was traditionally known has been in eclipse, while a new breed of very loud jazz/rock guitarists, most of them influenced by John McLaughlin, has captured the imagination of the recordbuying and concertgoing public. Newport's guitaristsJim Hall, Kenny Burrell and Tal Farlowwere a more ??? lot.

title: Snacker at Coney Island Paralyzed by Wild Bullet
description: While having a snack with his wife at an outdoor stand in Coney Island yesterday, a 24yearold Brooklyn man was hit in the shoulder by a wild bullet.

title: Datsuns Win Twice
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., July 5 Elliot ForbesRobinson of La Crescenda, Calif., substituted for ailing Bob Sharp today and won two races. He took the C Production and B Sedan events at the Sports Car Club of America Kendall Cup national races at Lime Rock Park.

title: JERSEY TO DEBATE TAX ISSUE AGAIN
description: TRENTON, July 5The State Assembly reconvenes tomorrow to try once again to pass an income tax measure that would balance the school budget and reopen the state's public schools, which were shut last Thursday under orders of the New Jersey Supreme Court.

title: MEASURE SOUGHT ON ERIE RAIL USE
description: State Transportation Commissioner Raymond T. Schuler is asking Congress to approve legislation allowing a solvent, privately owned railroad such as the Santa Fe to buy Conrail's former Erie Lackawanna Railway trackage across New York State.

title: Stockpiling Plans Spark a Rise in Copper
description: The Government's apparent intention to rebuild the national stockpiles of copper and other metals has helped spark a sharp rise in copper prices recently, despite record worldwide supplies.

title: Car Plunge Kills 8 Indians
description: BROWNING, Mont., July 5 (AP)A car carrying 11 Indians plunged off a highway into a lake today, killing eight members of a family and injuring the other three persons, the Montana Highway Patrol said. The accident occurred at 12:10 A.M. on the Blackfeet Indian Reservation.

title: Upstate Weather Perils Apple Crop Production
description: WALLKILL, N. Y.At a time when tree limbs should be bending to the ground under the weight of fruit here in Ulster County and in Columbia County farther north, most of the McIntosh apple trees are burgeoning with leaves but carrying very little fruit.

title: LUCY CARTER BEACH
description: Lucy Carter Beach, the widow of John Parsons Beach, who was considered one of the first American composers of modernist music, died Saturday at her home on Route 22 in Bedford. N. Y., at the age of 101. For many years, she had lived with her husband in Asolo, Italy, where they put on productions there in an ancient theater, which was later taken to and reconstructed on the grounds of the Ringling Museum of Art in Sarasota, Fla. She is survived by two sons, John W. and Peter M.: six grandchildren, and two greatgrandchildren.

title: 52d Street Jazz Fair Has Full House
description: I used to like a jazz musician once, a woman in the crowd at yesterday's 52d Street Jazz Fair commented to her companion. Let's see, it was Chet Baker. Mr. Baker was not in evidence, but 14 groups, ranging in size from small combos to big bands and in style from Dixieland to avantgarde, did perform in midtown between 11 A.M. and 4 P.M. There were two stages on 52d Street between the Avenue of the Americas and Fifth Avenue, and a third around the corner on 51st Street, in front of the Greenwich Savings Bank, and the music was continuous.

title: Census Statistics Sum Up 200 Years of U.S. Change
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Probably no statistics better sum up what has become of the American people in two centuries than these: in 1790, when the first census was taken, half of all American households consisted of six or more people; only a tenth had one or two persons living alone. By 1970, the latest census, the large household had become a rarity, only one in 10, and nearly half of all Americans were either living alone or with just one other person.

title: Village Center Offers Neighborly Solutions
description: Rose Cannelli went into the Village Community Problem Center at 80 Thompson Street in the South Village the other day and announced that she had a legitimate complaint to make.

title: GOVERNORS PANEL ASKS U.S.REFORMS IN WELFARE RULES
description: HERSHEY, Pa., July 5The nation's governors were told today that state and local governments could be spared millions of dollars in welfare costs if the Federal Government would consolidate its public assistance programs, establish a national minimum welfare payment and require most welfare recipients to resister for work.

title: Ford Warns New Citizens of Conformity; Says Diversity Has Made Nation Great
description: MONTICELLO, Va.. July 5 President Ford addressing a group of newly naturalized citizens at Thomas Jefferson's beautiful and serene home, warned today of a growing danger to this country in conformity of thought and taste and behavior.

title: VOTING ABROAD KEY TO LOCKHEED DATA
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (UPI) Facts about $25 million in payoffs that the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation allegedly made to government officials in 15 countries will not be made public until after fall elections in Japan and West Germany, it was reported today.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: (For Week ending July 2, 1976)

title: ROSA MONDAVI, 86, HEAD OF A WINERY
description: Rosa Mondavi, president of the Charles Krug winery in St. Helena, Calif., died at her home ton the winery grounds Sunday. She was 86 years old.

title: Accord is Ignored
description: GENEVA, July 5The International Committee of the Red Cross said today that its convoy had been organized with Ithe accord of all sides but that it came under heavy fire despite assurances that a ceasefire would be observed to allow it through the lines.

title: Bettors Are Not Turned Off by Power Failure at Goshen
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., July 5The fiveday 138th Grand Circuit meeting at Historic Track started on an electric note today. A power failure that struck this bucolic Orange County village and nearby communities just befor the start of the harness racing program caused a 30minute delay.

title: Million in Two States Left in Dark on Fourth
description: SALT LAKE CITY, July 5 (AP)A power failure that lasted as long as six hours darkened the Fourth of July for about one million residents in most of Utah and parts of western Wyoming.

title: Many Black Democratic Leaders Voice Doubt. Fear and Distrust About Carter
description: CHICAGO. July 5Shirley Chisholm referred to him derisively as blueeyed Jimmy. Julian Bond called him a dragon and liar. Other black leaders still mix such epithets as cracker and redneck in their conversation about him.

title: Beirut Battle Stops Red Cross Convoy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 5 (AP)Renewed fighting around a besieged Palestinian camp today prevented an International Red Cross convoy from evacuating 300 wounded.

title: State Urged to Spur Use of Waste Steam to Produce Electricity
description: PRINCETON, July 5  A Princeton University study for the New Jersey Cabinet Energy Committee recommends that the state reverse a decadeslong trend by fostering industrial use of wasted steam to produce electricity.

title: Build your bridge
description: Bridge players can sharpen their game with the bridge columns of the weekday New York Times and the Sunday Times Arts and Leisure Section.

title: Statement by Waldheim
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 5 (UPI)Secretary General Kurt Waldheim said today that the Israeli raid on the Entebbe airport was a violation of Uganda's sovereignty but he expressed satisfaction that the raid had saved lives.

title: Dapcevic, Tito Foe Seized in 75, Gets 20 Years in Yugoslav Trial
description: BELGRADE. Yugoslavia, July 5An alleged Soviet agent preslimed to have fallen into a trap laid by Yugoslays in Rumania last summer was sentenced today to 20 years imprisonment.

title: Western Aid Group is Critical of Swiss
description: PARIS, July 5A body that Coordinates Western aid to developing countries has taken the unusual step of publicly criticizing one of its own members  Switzerland  for the relatively low level of its foreign aid.

title: Women on the Pipeline: Good Pay in a Man's World
description: ANCHORAGE, AlaskaYesterday I was at a filling station and this woman ran screaming from her car Dyed blond hair, diamonds dripping from her fingers, she starts shouting at me, calling me a slut, telling me that I slept with her husband all day long in the cab of the truck. I just ignored her, pretended I didn't even hear. I'm just tired of the verbal abuse.

title: O, Say, Can How Does it Go Again?
description: O, say, can you sing The StarSpangled Banner? On the Bicentennial weekend, as never before, its words should have been on millions of American lips. Instead, there seemed to be a lot of humming.

title: FranceSoir, Major Paper Of 50's. Sold for $11 Million
description: PARIS, July 5 (Reuters)FranceSoir, the bestselling French daily some years ago, was sold for $11.2 million today to Paul Winkler, an independent Paris publisher, by the Hachette newspaper and magazine group.

title: Germans Seeking to Shift Homes to Water Heating
description: BONNWest German energy officials believe that by the end of this century it should be possible to reduce German oil and gas imports substantially by heating homes with hot water from power plants and other industries that generate much waste heat.

title: A Memory of Rope
description: Twentyfive years ago, when capital punishment was still a commonplace of American penology, part of a police reporter's routine included bearing witness to the official dispatch of condemned felons. In Maryland, where I was then spending nights jollying policemen, reporting knife fights and standing around accident wards listening to people die, these executions occurred frequently enough to assure every new reporter a chance to see a performance fairly early in his career.

title: Belgian Yachtsman 14th Into Newport
description: NEWPORT, R. 1., July 5 (AP)  Gustav Versluys of Belgium, captain of the Tyfoon V, a Jester class yacht, became the 14th finisher in the singlehanded Transatlantic race from Plymouth, England, to Newport when he crossed the finish line at approximately 3 A.M. today.

title: The Cast
description: SHOWBOAT, music by Jerome Kern book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein 2d, based on the novel Showboat by Edna Ferber. Director, John Fearnley; choreographer, Robert Pagent; setting by John W. Keck; costumes by Winn Morton; lighting by Richard Neison; musical director, Jay Blackton; entire production under supervision of Arnold Spector; production stage manager, Mortimer Halpern. Presented by Guy Lombardo. At the Jones Beach Theater, Wantagh, L. I.

title: Illicit Drink Kills 84 in India
description: NEW DELHI, India, July 5 (UPI)  A bootlegged, poisonous alcoholic brew has taken 84 lives in 48 hours in the southern metropolis of Madras, officials said today. They said nearly 100 more people brought into hospitals since yesterday might die and many might not regain their sight. Madras is the capital of Tamil Nadu, a dry state.

title: Martin Beats Munoz at Swedish Net
description: BASTAAD. Sweden, July 5 (UPI)Billy Martin of Palos Verdes, Calif., a former United States junior champion, defeated Antonio Mulioz of Spain, 64, 60, today in the opening round of a $100,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament. Martin is seeded 10th.

title: Leo E. Sabatine, Partner In Law Firm, Dies at 49
description: Leo E. Sabatine, a partner in the law firm of Wood, Dawson, Love & Sabatine, public bond specialists, died, apparently of la heart attack, yesterday at his home, 261 Henry Street, Brooklyn. He was 49 years old.

title: Seaplane Sinks on L.I. Alter Striking a Boat
description: A small singleengine seaplane taking off from an East River marina yesterday afternoon struck a 33foot boat moored there, causing slight injuries to two of the 10 persons aboard the boat, the Police reported.

title: Unbeaten Revidere Monmouth Victor
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., July 5 William Haggin Perry's undefeated Revidere rallied today to win the $55,750 Monmouth Bicentennial Oaks by a head at Monmouth Park.

title: Port Authority Paradox
description: Pushed along by the Governors of the two states and their chairman, the policymaking commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey have agreed to finance extensive new rail transit projects. Yet the authority, longresistant to masstransit yentures has actually paid more than $1 million to help its bondholders bring suit to prevent such rail projects.

title: Market Place
description: There is a jarring note for shareholders of ForemostMcKesson Inc. In the registration statement filed by the Sharon Steel Corporation in its proposed takeover of the wholesale distributor of liquor and drugs.

title: Britons Applaud Israelis, But Officials Are Wary
description: LONDON. July 5There are moments when a dramatic gesture by one nation can proyoke deep and revealing emotions in another, just as a piece of theater often says as much, about the audience as it does about the actors.

title: Antonio Slonimski, Polish Poet, Dies at 81 After Car Accident
description: Antoni Slonimski, Poland's bestknown poet and an outspoken civil libertarian, died Sunday night of shock suffered in an automobile accident, officials announced yesterday in Warsaw. He was 81 Years old A liberal Roman Catholic of Jewish ancestry, Mr. Slonimski returned to Poland from wartime exile in London and chose to coexist with the Communist regime, but he opposed censorship and encouraged liberalization to the end. As recently as last January, he signed an appeal criticizing a draft constitution and urging its revision to include a bill of rights.

title: Brooklyn Museum Gets Huge Canvas
description: With a trade of 11 pictures from its permanent collection, plus a reported $200,000 in cash, the Brooklyn Museum has acquired a monumental landscape by the oncepopular, then neglected 19thcentury American painter, Albert Bierstadt.

title: UNIONS PROTEST LISBON'S POLICIES
description: LISBON, July 5Portuguese, unions today challenged the Government's new austerity measures, which are intended to alleviate the balance of payments deficit and curb the consumption of electric power.

title: Advertising
description: Wild 5th for a fabulous 4th read the timely headline n the ad for Austin, Nichols's Wild Turkey Iliourbon that was part of an unusual exhibition of advertising art held last week at the David Findlay Gallery.

title: Why Basic Research?
description: Senator Kennedy demanded during the recent Senate Health Subcommittee hearings that the National Institutes of Health be more responsive to the needs of the taxpayer. Senator Kennedy expressed the view that what the public wants from its investment in medical research is the conquest of diseases. He characterized N.I.H. research priorities as waiting for lightning strike. Others echoed these criticisms. In effect, the message to the N.I.H. was: Stop wasting your time with basic research; get busy curing cancer, diabetes, heart disease etc.

title: Harrises Judge Called Tireless and Thorough
description: LOS ANGELES. July 5With tury selection entering its ninth day tomorrow, Judge Mark Brandler of Superior Court has taken a firm hand in pushing attorneys to expedite the selection of the 12 jurors who will decide the state's case against William and Emily Harris.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Idi Amin of Uganda said yesterday that Uganda reserved the right to retaliate in whatever way it could to redress what he called the aggression against it in the Israeli raid on Entebbe airport. In the first full account from Uganda of what happened at Entebbe Saturday night, President Amin indicated that he became involved with the hijackers only at the moment they requested landing permission last week. He also charged that Kenya and other neighboring states had collaborated with Israel in the raid that freed the hostages. Much of black Africa reacted to the raid with public condemnation, but considerable private admiration for the Israeli commandos. [Page 1, Column 4.1

title: FOREMOST ADMITS DUBIOUS PAYMENTS
description: Foremost  McKesson Inc., which came under investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission in March, has admitted foreign and domestic dealings that could be in violation of Federal securities laws.

title: Columbia Youth Program Clicks
description: An unusual tennisteaching program for youngsters is run by the Columbia University Tennis Center.

title: Books of The Times
description: There are any number of reasons to recommend George W. Ball's Diplomacy for a Crowded World: An American Foreign Policy. it certainly makes for lively reading, at least as long as Mr. Ball is pounding away at the NixonKissinger foreign policy by grandstand play and hasn't yet slipped into the rhetoric of recommendation (We must America ought . Our foreign policy should ) into which this sort of prescriptive study inevitably declines. What's more, despite the playful wit of the language with which Mr. Ball thumps away at Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, his critique of the lone cowboy and his policy of unilateralism adds up to a sobering assessment of the trouble our diplomacy of the last eight years has gotten us into. For, at least as far as Mr. Ball is concerned, none of the NixonKissinger spectaculars not dtente (A French word for what?), not our extrication from Vietnam (too late and at too much cost), and not our resumption of relations with China (an overblown episode that lacked either careful followup or a conceptual positioning within a coherent body of policy) has contributed anything of substance to evolving American foreign policy. Indeed, given every golden opportunity to take positive steps, the NixonFordKissinger ??? have left our vital foreign relations in disarray.

title: GOVERNORS PANEL ASKS U.S. REFORMS IN WELFARE RILES
description: HERSHEY, Pa., July 5The nation's governors were told today that state and local governments could be spared millions of dollars in welfare costs if the Federal Government would consolidate its public assistance programs, establish a national minimum welfare payment and require most welfare recipients to register for work.

description: West led the club nine.

title: Frank Weyenberg, 94, Dies
description: MILWAUKEE, July 5 (AP)Frank Weyenberg, founder of the Weyenberg Shoe Manufacturing Company, died yesterday at his suburban estate of an apparent heart attack. He was 94 years old. Services were scheduled here Thursday.

title: DAVID RESNICK
description: David Resnick, a former reporter for The St. Louis PostDispatch and a public relations consultant, died Sunday night of a heart attack. He was 73 years old and lived at 65 Central Park West. His clients had included the National Federation of Temple Sisterhoods, the Neighborhood Playhouse School for the Theater and the American Joint Committee, an affiliate of United Jewish Appeal. Surviving are his widow. Isobel, a daughter, Mrs. Wallace Chu, and three grandchildren.

title: Killanin Warns on Taiwan Ban

Many of the works have not been shown in several years; quite a few have undergone recent cleaning and treatment.

Its robust characters, homespun humor and familiar mellifluous tunes are a natural for Jones Beach with its amphitheater on the water, cooling airs from the bay and long slow dusks.

The bill died in committee.

July 6 (Reuters)The Indonesian Government has closed an independent Jakarta daily, Waktu. accusing it of carrying articles likely to provoke social unrest, an Information Ministry spokesman said today. The spokesman said the closure order was issued yesterday, withdrawing, the daily's publication and distribution rights.

title: Mondale to Visit Carter Over No. 2 Spot

Mr. Weiner, who owns his own political consultant firm in California and who has managed 172 political campaigns, will officially assume his post on July 15.

She has worked on Broadway and been a familiar face on television, but lately she has been aiming her career in an altogether different direction. Her current material is in a gospelinfluenced pop vein; she seems to be hoping to reach the sort of mass audience that buys millions of records by groups like Gladys Knight and the Pips.

Her ceremonial appearances included one at Independence Hall where the Declaration of Independence from her ancestor's rule was signed in 1776. Philadelphians gave her an enthusiastic reception. A report by Manhattan Councilmanatlarge Robert F. Wagner Jr. suggests that unconscionable amounts over $150 million annually are spent for unnecessarily leased office space.

Brown Jr. of California, top the convention delegates list of possible VicePresidential candidates, according to the continuing Associated Press survey iof delegates.

Judge Marvin E. Frankel, who sentenced the nursinghome operator, declined to discuss the matter.

title: Boe Calls Nets N. B. A. Asset
description: Though there are the usual hassles over player contracts and the usual worries about cash flow and the balance sheet the president of the New York Nets is confident ahout his team's place in the National Basketball Association in the fall.

title: About New York
description: A Doberman pinscher, ears laid back, teeth bared, stalked through Tompkins Square Park one morning last week.

title: What School Crisis?
description: TRENTON, July 6Democratic leaders in the State Assembly had counted heavily on the long holiday weekend. It would, they calculatedwrongIv it turned outconfront Assembly members with angry constituencies demanding that they vote some kind of tax legislation hat would reopen the state's public schools, which were closed last Thursday by the New Jersey Supreme Court, because they were not constitutionally financed.

title: BLACKS WIN ISSUE THAT TOUCHED OFF SOUTH AFRICA RIOT
description: JOHANNESBURG. July 6The language dispute that touched off rioting in which 176 people died last month was resolved today when the Government bowed to demands for an end to the compulsory use of Afrikaans as a teaching medium in black schools.

title: Muskie Says Reagan May Defeat Ford
description: BANGOR, Me., July 6Senaor Edmund S. Muskie said here today that he believed Jimmy Carter tended to regard Ronald Reagan as a tougher campaigner than President Ford.

title: Radar Check Finds No Problem With Viking l's 2d Landing Site
description: PASADENA, Calif., July 6 (AP)A radar dish in Arecibo, P. R., aimed at the spot chosen for Viking l's landing on Mars, has so far failed to turn up anything that might reverse the decision.

title: 2HELD AND 2 SOUGHT IN BOMBINGS IN EAST
description: TOPSFIELD, Mass., July 61 (UPI)Two men believed to bel connected to a rash of dynamite bombings in New England were ordered held on $800,000 bail today as the police searched fnr twn alirged comrades.

title: Dismissal is Won By One Defendant In HomeStake Case
description: TULSA, Okla., July 6One of six defendants in the HomeStake Production Company Fraud trial won dismissal of a charge of conspiracy Tuesday in United States District Court here. The six faced charges of swindling more than $50 million from Homestake investors.

title: Radio
description: 7:30. 8:55 A. M., WNYCFM. Overture to The Merry Wives of Windsor, Nicolai; Concerto for Two Harpsichords in C minor, Bach; Variations and Scherzo, Mendelssohn; Piano Sonata in D, Mozart; Quartet for Saxophones. Glazounov; French Military March, SaintSaens.

title: Four Paper Mills Struck
description: BOISE, Idaho, July 6 (UPI)Four Boise Cascade Corporation pulp and paper mills on the West Coast have been struck by the Association of Western Ruin and Paper Workers, company officials said today. They said that the mills, struck Friday, were at Wallula and Vancouver, Wash., and St. 1Helens and Salem, Ore.

title: Horror Movie At Cinerama II With 'Bobbie Jo'
description: It's apparent that someone connected with "They Came From Within" has an impertinent sense of humor even though the film is so tackily written and directed, so darkly photographed and the sound so dimly recorded, that it's difficult to stay with it.The movie is now playing at the Cinerama II and other theaters on a double bill with "Bobbie Jo and the Outlaw," another terrible film about young people on a crime spree in Texas and environs. This one stars Marjoe Gortner, the former child evangelist who is now too weathered to play a young person with much pictorial conviction."They Came From Within," which was made in Canada, is about a mysterious parasite that attacks the residents of a middle-class apartment complex "12 minutes from downtown Montreal." The parasite looks like a piece of self-propelled calves liver as it slithers about the premises, wantonly attacking young and old and turning its host-victims into sex-mad sybarites for whom the conventional Wednesday night "socials" never end.

title: Libyan Hijacks Plane, Surrenders
description: PALMA, Majorca, July 6 (UPI)A 20yearold Libyan brandishing what turned out to be two toy pistols hijacked a Libyan airliner on a domestic flight today but surrendered to the police after landing on this Mediterranean island of Spain.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Queen Elizabeth II, greatgreatgreatgreatgranddaughter of King George III stepped ashore from the royal yacht Britannia at Penn's Landing, Philadelphia, to join the celebration of the independence of the former British colonies. Her ceremonial appearances included one at Independence Hall where the Declaration of Independence from her ancestor's rule was signed in 1776. Philadelphians gave her an enthusiastic reception. [Page 1, Columns 14.]

title: ANGOLA ATTENDING SOVIETRLOC PARLEY
description: EAST BERLIN, July 6 (ReuterslAn Angolan delegation arrived here today for the Soviet bloc's annual economic meeting.

title: Suicide's Plunge Crushes Auto, Killing Passenger on 23d Street
description: A 25yearold man killed himself and a passenger in a car yesterday when he leaped from the 22d floor of a Manhattan hotel and landed on the passing automobile, crushing the roof.

title: Earthquake Hits California
description: OROVILLE, Calif., July 6 (UPI) A light earthquake rumbled through this northern California community last night but no damage was reported.

title: Canada Signs Pact to Establish Links With the Common Market
description: OTTAWA. July 6  Canada and the Common Market signed an agreement today that is expected here to bring this country closer to the European Community and lessen the dominance of the United State in Canada's foreign relation. ships.

title: BANGOR PLANNING LONE STAR STAKE
description: The Bangor Punta Corporation, a diversified company based in Greenwich, Conn., announced yesterday that it was considering buying a 10 percent interest in Lone Star Industries, the nation's largest cement manufacturer and a distributor of building materials. Bangor Punta is proposing to buy as an investment 1.1 million shares of Lone Star belonging to James F. Stewart, Lone Star's chairman and vicechairman of Bangor Punta.

title: SYMPATHY STRIKES BACKED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)Federal judges may not prevent union workers with nostrike contracts from walking off the job in sympathy with another union, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: Wellman Chamberlin Dies at 68; Geographic Unit's Map Expert
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Wellman Chamberlin, retired chief cartographer of the National Geographic. Society, died at his home in Waterford, Va., on Sunday of a circulatory ailment lie was 68 years old.

title: The New Moralism
description: The highly publicized sexual revolution of the 1960's was supposed to have turned the United States into swinging oasis of broadmindedness. Gone were the Puritan pruderies that had for so long set strict standards of behavior, or at least of appearance, for public personalities. Even politicians were no longer being banished for disclosures of infidelity.

title: People and Business
description: Michele Sindona, the Italian financier whose holdings at one time included a substantial interest in the defunct Franklin National Bank, yesterday lost a civil court battle in Rome involving Banco di Roma.

title: Three More Yachts Finish Atlantic Race
description: Three more yachts yesterday finished the singlehanded transAtlantic race at Newport, RI., the 3,000mile race that began last June 5 at Plymouth, England, with 125 starters. The three, Pawn, Nova and Ackel France were the 16th, 17th and 18th to complete the voyage, which was hazardous because of a severe gale in the North Atlantic during the second week of June.

title: Dreyfus Leads Ike Tourney on 66 at Wykagyl1
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., July 6John Dreyfus tied a tournament record and missed a course record by one shot today as he scored 30, 3666, or six under par, at Wykagyl in the first round of the 24th annual Ike amateur tourney.

title: ORVILLE B. RENDAHL
description: Orville Byron Rendahl, vice president for the international, department of the carbon products division of the Union Carbide Corporation, died yesterclay at the Norwalk (Corn.) Community Hospital. He lived in Greenwich, Conn., and was 66 years old.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 6About 5,000 teachers and 9,000 other public school workers. including bus drivers and cafeteria employees, have applied for unemployment benefits since the state's public schools were shut by the New Jersey Supreme Court last Thursday.

title: Israelis Hail Slain Officer as LatterDay Jonathan
description: JERUSALEM, July 6 (AP)Israelis, paying homage to the Americanborn paratroop commander killed on the rescue raid into Uganda, hailed him today as a latterday Jonathan, the biblical warrior. His father, a Cornell University professor, said the prayer for the dead.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: One of the favorite arguments of the LatinAmerican left is that the development of the Southern Hemisphere is impossible because of the stifling incubus of North American power.

title: 29 Democratic Governors Vote to Support. Carter
description: HERSHEY. Pa., July 6Setting aside old antagonisms in the interest of party unity, 29 of the nation's 36 Democratic governors endorsed Jimmy Carter for President this morning.

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
description: ???, J. Manguid 2, Mackanin 2. PCincinnati ?. LOBCincinnati 13, Montreal 8. ?BG. Foster, Driessen, Frias, Plummer, Jorgensen, Morgan. 30Geronimo, Foote. HRParrish 13). SEastwick. SFFl inn, Driessen.

title: Musics Impressive Soloists in Mozart
description: Concertos for two or more soloists are being featured in the Mostly Mozart Festival concerts at Alice Tully Hall this week. Jaime Laredo, who usually devotes himself to playing the violin or viola, has now added conducting to his activities and is leading the Festival Orchestra.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Tuesday London: Morning fixing $123. O5, unavallable; afternoon fixing $123. 30, unavallable.

title: Car Crash Fatal to Infant
description: HAMILTON TOWNSHIP, N. J., July 6 (AP)A 3monthold boy died today of head injuries received when a car driven by his father smashed into a utility pole here, the police said. The child, James Pak of Hamilton Township, was pronounced dead 45 minutes after the crash at St. Francis Medical Center in Trenton. The police said his parents, Hinu Pak, 30 years old, and Dukhwa Sue, 24, were treated for injuries at the hospital and released.

title: Cedeno Week's Best
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 6 (AP)  Cesar Cedeno, who had 15 hits in 35 times at bat for a. 429 average, was named today as National League player of the week.

title: Jude Takes Title At Catamount Show
description: SUFFERN, N. Y., July 11 Carol'DeGuiseppe's Jude, a smartstepping fox chaser, won one championship and finished as reserve in another today at  the Catamount Hunt Horse Show.

title: Carey Names Press Aide
description: ALBANY, July 6Governor Carey announced today the appointment of Carol Brownell as deputy press secretary, with responsibility for the Governor's New York City office and the Emergency Financial Control Board. Miss Brownell leaves her post as public information officer for the State Department of Social Services to take the new job.

title: Events Today
description: LE MAGNIFIQUE, a French film directed by Philip de Brod. starr. no JeanPaul Belmondo and Jacqueline Bisset, at the Fine Arts Theater.

title: Multinational Code
description: The free flow across borders of capital investment along with international trade in the three decades after World War II helped spark the most phenomenal growth that the global economy has ever recorded.

title: Brooklyn Residents Storm Drug Center After Addicts Hurl Debris Into Street
description: Hundreds of residents in the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn, frustrated by years of protests in vain against the behavior of drug addicts in a stateoperated center, became infuriated early yesteriay morning by the patients latest outburst and tried to break into the building, at 55 Hanson Place.

title: Amaya, Reid Win At Swedish Net
description: BAASTAD, Sweden. July (AP)Vic Amaya and Raz Reid of the United States moved into the second round of the $100,000 Swedish international tennis tournament today.

title: French Revelers In Village Concert Dispersed by Police
description: A musical thank you to New York City by some young French visitors proved so popular in Greenwich Village last night that the police had to break it up as a crowd of several hundred listeners spilled into the streets.

title: Chu Teh, Chinese Army's Chief Who Led Reds to Victory, Dies
description: HONG KONG. July 6Chu feh one of China's greatest military leaders and the chairman of the National People's Congress, died today in Peking. He was 90 years old.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Two bills that would make it possible for individual consumers to sue for triple damages if they were defrauded have passed the United States Senate, but may die in the House of Representatives this year.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: It was incorrectly reported in The Times last Friday that the New York State Legislature had passed a bill to require pharmacists to provide cheaper generic drugs to customers whose prescriptions indicate that a substitution for the more expensive brandname drug is permissible. The bill died in committee.

title: Bellino II, French Entry, Made 85 Favorite in International
description: Pierre Allaire, who parlayed a successful betting career into one of the richest stables in Europe, went back to his old profession yesterday and offered his betting line for Saturday night's $200,000 International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Court Reverses the Conviction Of Lee Myles on Stolen Goods
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Broo lyn has reversed the conviction of Lee Myles Transmissions and its president, Charles George, Ion charges of possession of 96 stolen automobile engines.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: SECOND59,000, ci., 3Y0, IM (chute).

title: MARY B. BEHREND
description: Mary Brownell Behrend of Greenwich, Conn., and Watch Hill, R. I., widow of Brnest R. Behrend founder and president of the Hammermill Paper Company, Erie, Pa., died Monday in Westerly (R. I.) Hospital. She was 96 years old.

title: Army Finds Bodies Of 26 Wild Horses At Utah Waterhole
description: DUGWAY, Uta??, July 6 (UPI)More than two dozen wild horses nave been found dead at a waterhole on the Dugway Proving Grounds in the Cedar Mountains range of western Utah, the Army reported today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 6 (UN)A grand jury decided today against indicting for aggravated assault a man who allegedly threw a bottle at an official during a National Football League playoff game between the Minnesota Viking and Dallas Cowboys last year.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Governors Urge Single Welfare Plan With National Minimum and Job Rider
description: HERSHEY, Pa., July 6The nation's governors urged the Ford Administration and Congress today to establish a single, simplified program of federally assisted welfare payments.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Hnueilings
description: HA ITKINHarry. A moinumani in the memory of the late Harry Hafkin of Lauderhill, Florida, formerly ill & rooklyn, Now York, will be ??? at Both David Cemelacy, Elmont, Long Island on Sunday July 11th at 11:31 A. M.

title: Basie and AllStar Group Close Jazz Festival With Real Dance
description: The best thing about the Newport Jazz Festival's Farewell Dance, which was held at Roseland Dance City on Monday, was that it was a dance. The music, which was provided by an allstar group and by the Count Basie band, gathered a momentum that it would probably not have attained in the more comfortable but less informal confines of a concert hall. When it built up a rhythmic tension that demanded expression in movement, the means of expression was at hand.

title: Fake Police Fence Nets 2d Big Haul In National Capital
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)For the second time this year. District of Columbia police and Federal Bureau of Investigation agents have created a fake fencing operation to seize sellers of stolen merchandise.

title: Stelco Delays Rise In Price for Bars But May Act Later
description: The Steel Company of Canada acknowledged yesterday that it had delayed a price increase averaging $18 a ton on a wide variety of bar products that had been scheduled to go into effect on June 28. J. Peter Gordon, chairman of Canada's largest steelmaker, insisted, however, that Stelco had not made a decision to back off on the increase.

title: Division of City University Budget
description: Following are the budgets for individual colleges and other programs in the City University announced by Chancellor Robert J. Kibbee, as compared with the school year just ended (last 000's omitted).

title: Toyo Kogyo Sale Of Rotary Engines To Soviet is Set
description: TOKYO, July 6The Soviet Union has purchased rotary engines in large quantities from Toyo Kogyo, Japan's third largest automaker, as part of its research effort to develop a massproduced rotary engine of its own. Shipment is due to begin this week.

title: Tide Turns: Paris Warmly Greets an Exhibition of Early Symbolists
description: PARIS  The success of Symbolism in Europe, a mammoth exhibition at the Grand Palais, through July 19, would seem to indicate that another socalled historical injustice is currently being righted. Less than 10 years ago the 250 works painted by 87 artists from 15 countries between 1880 and 1900 would have been as welcome as a glass of milk on an alcoholic's dinner table. Today, a public disgusted with our consumer society and yearning for spiritual values looks with sympathy upon a generation of artists who, in the thick of 19thcentury materialism, dared to vindicate what their most intelligent apologist, Albert Aurier, called the right to dream.

title: FELLOWSHIPS GIVEN TO 24 JOURNALISTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) Twentyfour fellowships for professional journalists were announced today by the NaItional Endowment for the Humanities, which finances them.

title: Tonight's Roosevelt Entries
description: Horses listed in order of Post Positions Letter designates OTB

title: New York to Be Host To Queen on Friday
description: Queen Elizabeth II of Britain who arrived in Philadelphia yesterday, will visit New York Friday. She will be proclaimed an honoary citizen of the city by Mayor Beame, be honored at a luncheon in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, tour the MorrisJumel Mansion in upper Manhattan and inspect another local landmark. Bloominedale's.

title: The Rev. W. C. Gianera. 86; ExHead of Santa Clara U.
description: SANTA CLARA, July 6 (UPI) The Rev. William C. Gianera, 56 years old, former president of Santa Clara University, died Saturday. He entered the Jesuit order of the Roman Catholic Church in 1907 and was ordained in Spain in 1922.

title: Bomb Explodes in Bolivia
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 6 (AP)  A dynamite bomb exploded in front of a Cabinet minister's house in La Paz but caused no injuries, a police spokesman said today. The bombing occurred last night at the home of Gen. Juan Lecnin, Minister of Coordination, and damaged the iron fence in front of the building, the spokesman said.

title: Vermont Air Crash Kills Two
description: PLAINFIELD, Vt., July (AP)  Two central Vermont men were killed yesterday in the crash of their private twoseat aircraft here. The men were identified as Joseph Edwards, 47 years old, of Chelsea, and Paul Buinicky, 27, of Barre.

title: Yardley's Fragrances Moving to Marschalk
description: Yardley of London is switching its fragrances and cosmetics from Altman, Stoller, Weiss to Marschalk, which has already had its soap business. David R. Altman, chairman of the losing agency, said he had resigned the business because of disagreements on marketing. W. D. Hunt, Yardley's president, said the move had been under serious consideration for months and that he was won over by Marschalk's superior performance.

title: About Education
description: A proposal that all new teacners in New York State be licensed in the same manner as physicians, lawyers and members of other professions has been made by a special Task Force on Teacher Education and Certification appointed by Ewald B. Nyquist, the State Education Commissioner.

title: TV: Two New Daytime Game Programs on NBC!
description: Silliness can be pleasant, perhaps almost cathartic. Witness the Fourth of July festivities and their seemingly endless parade of offkey singers, outofstep marchers, mediocre entertainers and nonstop clichs. The point, of course, is simply wellintentioned celebration. To expect decorum, to demand profundity, is to fall victim to oneupmanship in silliness.

title: African Nations Bid U. N Council Meet on Israeli Raid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 6African members of the United Nations asked today for an urgent meeting of the Security Council to consider the wanton act of egression carried out by Israel in its raid to free hostages at Entebbe Airfort in Ueanda last weekend.

title: A Traveler to Beirut Finds Syrian Troops Well Dug In
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, July 6A taxi drive from Damascus to ??? provides some evidence that Syrian troops are prepared to stay in Lebanon for a long time.

title: When Rights Collide
description: The omnipresence of television cameras in American life has led to a new set of legal problems in the area of access and trespass that could hardly have been foreseen in the centuriesold evolution of the common law. Aggressive producers and cameramen at times view their activities as above any other constitutional rights, such as the right to privacy, in the pursuit of their pictures.

title: OKLAHOMA LOSES ON DEATH PENALTY
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI) After its landmark ruling last week, the Supreme Court struck down today Oklahoma's capital punishment law, accepted another case from Florida and disposed of dozens of appeals that had been pending for many) weeks.

title: 5 Are Held in Extortion Of Bicentennial Vendors
description: Posing as vendors, undercover police officers arrested five men on charges of extorting lincense fees from hawkers of Bicentennial souvenirs near the South Street Seaport Museum.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: United Press International

title: Dodgers 5Run Spurt Beats Phils, 51
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers have had a great deal of trouble in their own division, the West, against the world champion Cincinnati Reds. But they don't seem to have the same problem with base ball's top team, the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (API  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: PRICES UP ON AMEX BUT OFF ON OTC
description: After a strong opening, stock prices weakend yesterday on the American Stock Exchange. However the market value index closed at 105. 26, up 0. 09. In the overthecounter market, the NASDAQ industrial index showed a slight loss for the day at 96. 74, off 0. 18.

title: Big Board is Closing Profitable Loophole
description: The New York Stock Ex change acting on a complaint from the Chicago Board Options Exchange, has closed a highly profitable loophole that enabled a handful of stockbrokers with good contacts on the Big Board trading floor to make substantial profits in International Business Machines Corporation stock, Wall Street sources disclosed yesterday.

title: Christine Weidinger, Met Soprano, Bride
description: Christine Weidinger, a soprano with the Metropolitan Opera for the last four years, was married last night in Phoenix, Ariz., to Kenneth Smith, assistant house manager at the Metropolitan.

title: President Vetoes Jobs Bill; Describes it as Giveaway
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 President Ford vetoed today a S3. 95 billion public works jobs bill that he said epitomized the empty promises and giveaway programs of the Democratic majority in Congress.

title: Week's Steel Output Lowest Since April
description: The nation's steel production fell in the week ended July 3: to its lowest level since the week ended April 3, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The trade as I sociation placed weekly output at 2. 66 million tons, with the production capablility index at R7.7 nercent.

title: Balanced or Too Slow?
description: The United States economy, having completed the first phase of its recovery from the worst recession of the postwar period, has settled into moderate rate of growth. From the standpoint o the Ford Admin istration, the ex pansion is jus about rightwel balanced is tht favorite term. From the stand point of the Democrats, hoping to take over the White HOUSE in part on the economic issue the rate of growth is too slow the level of unemployment toc high and the rate of inflation too great.

title: WINE TALK
description: Every year a trade newsletter called Impact pulls together from commercial and government sources some of the pertinent data about wine drinking in the United States. Here are some of the things that Impact has come up with regarding wine in America in 1975.

title: Chu Teh Remebered for Three Crucial Campaigns
description: For as long as war continues to be regarded by men as an adventure as well as a tragedy. and as long as battles continue to be identified with the names of their victorious commanders rather than with their casualties, Chu Teh will be remembered as one of the most extraordinary soldiers in history.

title: TEAMSTERS GIVEN PENSION REPRIEVE
description: The Internal Revenue Service which two weeks ago revoked the taxexempt status of the Central States Pension Fund, of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, has now told the fund that it is postponing part of its action until Aug. 31.

title: Carter And His Partner
description: WASHINGTON, July 6  Almost everybody in this town is now trying to figure out what makes Jimmy Carter tick, and they are watching his choice of a VicePresidential partner for the answer. Maybe his choice of a running mate, they think, will tell them more about his character than all his moral lectures of the past year.

title: Sudanese Break Libyan T. ies, Charge Role in Coup Attempt
description: CAIRO. July 6  President Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan, who has charged that Libya masterminded last week's unsuccessful coup against him. broke diplomatic relations with Libya today and took other steps to curtail Libyan influence. tack had been by mercenaries recruited and armed by Colonel Qaddafi from nonArab nations Ethiopia, Mali, Chad and Tanzania, as well as Libya and sent across the Libyan border into the Sudan.

title: AfroBeat, New Music With Message
description: LAGOS, NigeriaIt is I All in Surulere, the sprawling mainland slum of Lagos. On Western Avenue a crowd of several hundred waits outside a barbedwire compound. The door swings open and out steps a figure in white, draped with juju charms.

title: Court Upholds Ban On Red No. 2 Dye By Federal Agency
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals upheld today the Federal Lan on Red No. 2 dye, which until last year was the nation's most widely used artificial coloring for foods, drugs and cosmetics.

title: Market Place
description: Ever since May DayMay 1, 1975stockbrokers have been required under Securities and Exchange Commission rules to negotiate commission charges with individual customers.

title: HOSPITALS GIRDING FOR STRIKE TODAY
description: Hospital, union and government officials prepared last night for a strike at 6 A. M. today as negotiations remained at a standstill between most of the city's voluntary hospitals and 40,000 members of District 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Em ployees.

title: Excerpts From the Interview With Carter on His Concepts in Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Following are excerpts from the transcript of an interview with Jimmy Carter on June 24, conducted in Washington and aboard a plane on flight from Washington to Americus, Ga.

title: Queen Calls 1776 a Lesson That Aided Britain
description: PHILADELPHIA. July 6Queen Elizabeth II, beginning a sixday Bicentennial visit, came here today to ??? sent a Bicentennial hell as a gift from the British heoots to the United States. Following is the text of her spee.

title: Cadets and Other Sailors Join in Parade and a Party
description: New York city put on a glorious climax for its Bicentennial party yesterday with an enthusiastically cheered march up Broadway by contingents from the big ships that line the waterfront.

title: Pitchers Selected By N. L.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 6 (AP)Randy Jones of San Diego, the top winning pitcher in the major leagues. heads an eightman National League staff named today for the AllStar Game against the American League.

title: Five Die as Planes Collide
description: COLUMBUS, Ind., July 6 (UPI) Two singleengine planes flying in formation got their wings entangled yesterday and crashed, killing all five occuIpants. The victims, all from Indiana, were identified as Neva Nash, 19 years old, of Fishers; Donna Dalton, 27, of Westfield; Bonnie Newby, 24, of Indianapolis: and Arnold Jackson, 38, and William Roe, 43, both of New Castle.

title: Alampi's 20 Years in Post Sets State Cabinet Record
description: Phillip Alampi left his big 18thcentury farmhouse 12 miles north of Trenton before dawn the other day.

title: Christen Elected President Of the Board of Education
description: Dr. Robert J. Christen was elected yesterday to a oneyear term as president of the Board of Education by his fellow board members. He succeeds Isaiah Robinson Jr.

title: JUSTICES REDUCE POWER OF COURTS OVER CONVICTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6In a major ruling on the final day of its year, the Supreme Court sharply reduced today the power of Federal courts to set aside state court convictions that relied on illegally obtained evidence.

title: Lawyer Weds Kyoko Ito
description: Kyoko Ito, assistant manager of the New York office of the Kinokuniya Book Store Company Ltd. of Tokyo, was married here yesterday afternoon to Frederick Schwartzman, a New York lawyer. The ceremony was performed by Civil Court Judge Stanley P. Danzig in his chambers. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Saburo Ito of Tokyo. Her previous marriage ended in divorce. Mr. Schwartzman's parents are Mrs. Harry Schwartzman of the Bronx and the late Mr. Schwartz.

title: Blacks in South Africa: Turmoil Turns Moderates Into Radicals
description: JOHANNESBURG, July 6 When the mayor of Soweto emerged from talks with Government officials here last week and flashed a black power salute. The Rand Daily Mail.

title: INQUIRY ALLEGED ON GIFTS TO BEAME
description: A defense lawyer for a builder who contributed to Mayor Beame's campaign charged in court papers yesterday that the Manhattan District Attorney was investigating whether special favors were given by city officials in exchange for contributions.

title: School Closings in Jersey Jeopardize Handicapped
description: TRENTON. July 6Joshua Edelson of Ridgewood, 9 years old, has not been able to go to his special education class since last Thursday because of the courtordered shutdown of the public school system. His parents fear the progress he has made is in jeopardy.

title: U. S. Judge Orders F. B. I. Chief To Testify at Trial of 2 Indians
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa, July 6A Federal judge today ordered the Federal Bureau of Investigation's director. Clarence M. Kelley to appear in court tomorrow under threat of contempt.

title: American Power and Foreign Policy
description: The great debate on foreign policy this election year has focused almost entirely on the SovietAmerican military balance. Yet Americans will increasingly face a new type of foreign policy issue: National security can be endangered by events outside the traditional military sphere.

title: Carter's Foreign Views Fit Liberal Democratic Mold
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Jimmy Carter says that he expects foreign policy to be a major issue in the Presidential campaign, and he seems ready to run with a program that decidedly places him in the liberal wing of the Democratic Party.

title: Christians in Northern Lebanon Report Repulse of Leftist Attack
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 6 (AP)Heavy fighting was reported in northern Lebanon today, with Lebanese Christians asserting that they had beaten back an assault by Lebanese leftists and their Palestinian allies into Christianheld areas.

title: Taiwan Set To Compete Despite Ban
description: TAIPEI. Taiwan, July 6 (UPI)  Taiwanese athletes still plan to compete in the Olympic Games in Montreal under the name of the Republic of China, despite Canada's demand that the name be changed to Taiwan, a sports official said today.

title: Olympian Politics
description: Politics and the Olympic games have been all too frequently intertwined for many years, and each time the cause of sports has suffered. This is true whether one recalls Hitler's shameful attitude toward black athletes when the Olympic Games were played in Nazi Germany in the mid1930's or, more recently, the disgraceful decision of the International Olympic Committee acting under Soviet pressureearly this year to ban Radio Free Europe reporters from the winter Olympics.

title: Credit Markets Off in Dull Trading
description: The credit markets advance that got started early last week continued early yesterday, and then it seemed to run out of steam for no apparent reason. Trading was inactive all day. and traders could cite no reason for either the market's early use or its later setback. The interest rate on Federal funds dipped to 5, or 5 5/ 16 percent, slightly below the 5 percent level at which it stayed so much of the time recently, and the decline in this key interest rate may have helped the general rise in prices throughout the credit markets.

description: ST. LOUIS, July 6 (AP)With a warrant, the Government has a right to enter surreptitiously a place of business and install electronic surveillance equipment, a Federal appeals panel ruled today.

description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., July 6 (AP)The water supply for 180,000 residents of Fort Lauderdale and five neighboring communities was, declared unsafe today after it was comtaminated by diesel fuel, officials said. Dr. Paul Hughes, director of the Broward County Health Department, Warned residents not to drink the ???? until tests determined it Was free of pollutants.

description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)Federal officials have decided that public schools may no longer sponsor fatherson or motherdaughter events because they violate new rules against sex discrimination.

title: Jersey Schools Still Shut As Assembly Fails to Act
