description: Here are some helpful New York City telephone numbers and addresses for those in search of information assistance.

title: RHODESIA REBELS BAR CONCESSIONS
description: JOHANNESBURG, July 8Rhodesian guerrilla leaders in Mozambique have told a visiting member of the United States Congress that they will reject any proposals for a negotiated settlement of the Rhodesian conflict that do not provide, for an immediate and unconditional transfer of power Iby the ruling white minority.

title: SOYBEANS SOAR ON SALE RUMORS
description: After a day's respite, soybeans once again moved sharply higher amid a spate of rumors about possible new sales to the Soviet Union and elsewhere, such as China. The nearby July delivery closed at $7. 20 a bushel, up from $7. 07.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York State Court of Appeals yesterday rejected a suit challenging the noise level of New York City's subways, ruling that the city's failure to adopt standards required by a fouryearold antinoise code stopped short of illegality. A majority memorandum in the 5to1 decision by the state's highest court said that despite the city's failure to comply with its own code, there are no specific illegal acts or omissions for which judicial correction may be sought.  The suit was filed by Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx, State Senator Carol Bellamy, DemocratLiberal of Brooklyn; City Councilman Theodore Weiss, Democrat of Manhattan and two citizens groups.

title: For Mercedes Customers, Prestige Hinges on Waiting
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, July 7  Customers around the world who want to buy a new MercedesBenz whether they are movie stars, Arab princes or ordinary businessmen  may have to wait well over a year for delivery of the prestigious West German car.

title: In the Nation's Service
description: Higher education, paralyzed by budget deficits, seems to be in the throes of an identity crisis over its diminished national role. Recognizing the implications, Ernest L. Boyer, chancellor of the State University of New York, has called for a new public partnership between the campus and the nonacademic world. Instead of making the legally required issuance of a 1976 Master Plan for SUNY merely another routine projection of statistics, Dr. Boyer has chosen to outline a course designed to put SUNYor for that matter any major universityback into the center of public affairs.

title: Dubious Payments Disclosed by Marcor
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Marcor Inc., recently merged into the Mobil Corporation, made questionable foreign payments of $635,000 during the five years ended last January, a document made available today at the Securities and Exchange Commission disclosed.

title: Edwin M. Lavino is Dead at 90; Was Philadelphia Industrialist
description: Edwin M. Lavino, a Philadelphia industrialist and longtime president of the board of trustees of the Lawrenceville (N. J.) School of which he was a principal benefactor, died yesterday at the University of Pennsylvania,. Hospital. He was 90 years old and lived at 1820 Rittenhouse Square.

title: OUTLOOK ON PEACE IN LEBANON IS DIM, ARAB ENVOY SAYS
description: CAIRO, July 8The head of, the Arab League's mediation mission in Lebanon returned here today from a fruitless round of talks and said the Arab peacekeeping force in the Beirut area was powerless to act.

title: Louis Ginsberg, 80, Dies; Read Poems With Son
description: Louis Ginsberg, a muchanthologized poet and father of Allen Ginsberg, died yesterday morning at his home, 480 Park Avenbe, Paterson, N. J., after an illness of six months. He was 80 years old.

title: Business Trends
description: Priced out of the market for new and bigger homes, people are taking the job of providing housing into their own hands.

title: Peace Corps Man Dies
description: BASSETERRE, St. Kitts, July 8 (Reuters) A United States Peace Corps volunteer, Stephen Malone, died here last night after he was reported to have fallen from a locomotive hauling cane to a sugar factory. Mr. Malone, 27 years old, came from Russell, N.Y., near the Canadian border.

title: How They Voted
description: TRENTON, July 8 (UPI)Here is the rollcall vote in the State Senate on the income tax bill tonight.

title: Pro Transactions
description: PHOENIX (NBA)Signed Ron Lee, guard, firstround draft choice to multiyear contract.

title: What to See on and Off Broadway
description: Delegates who could shift their attention from politics to theater had an opportunity to buy tickets in advance to A Chorus Line, California Suite and other popular shows for convention week. The convention's Citizens Committee, in cooperation with the League of New York Theaters, set aside 100 seats to every show for every performance from July 1016, and a total of more than 20,000 tickets were available for purchase by delegates.

title: Restaurants: Abundance of Riches, an Infinity of Dishes
description: With all of the great and famous restaurants New York has to offer, the problem of too much choice can be almost as frustrating as having no choice at all. Wanting to waste neither time nor money, a convention visitor might well give up in despair and fall into the nearest'hotel coffee shop or fast food outlet, thereby missing some of the best atmosphere and most interesting food in the country.

title: FrenchGerman Steel Discord Growing
description: PARIS, July 8  Major changes are taking place in the politics and structure of the European steel industry with serious implications for the Common Market and the concept of FrenchWest German cooperation in coal and steel, which brought the Europeans together in the early 1950's.

title: A Festive Welcome for the Delegates
description: Like a hostess eager to see to the needs and wants of her guests, New York City has primed itself to care for, perhaps even pamper, the visiting delegates to the Democratic National Convention who begin arriving here this weekend.

title: A Guide To the City's Melting Pot
description: New York as a place of many tongues and of diverse customs, is carrying on a tradition that began when the first settlers, a polyglot assortment of Walloons and Flemings, came ashore and were the bulk of the Dutch town's original population.

title: Indonesia Now Puts Quake Toll at 9,000 In West New Guinea,
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, July 8  The Government said today that the death toll from an earthquake and subsequent landslides on the Indonesian part of the island of New Guinea had surpassed 9,000 and could go higher.

title: Strike Out the Negative
description: The last time the Democrats invaded New York to nominate a Presidential candidate, H. L. Mencken paused around the 100th ballot and knocked off a late night lead to The Baltimore Sun.

title: British Envoy Tries to Trace Missing Uganda Hostage
description: NAIROBI. Kenya, July 8 (Reuters)The British High Commissioner in Uganda, James Hennessy returned to his post today and began trying to trace Dora Bloch an elderly hostage who was left behind in a hospital after the Israeli rescue mission at Entebbe airport.

title: Broadway
description: ZOE CALDWELL will direct An Almost Perfect Person when Burry Fredrik brings it to Broadway in the fall. The play, a comedy by Judith Ross. about the aftermath of a political campaign by a woman politician on the Upper West Side. She is a liberal, who has run for Congress and lost. Miss Caldwell is the distinguished actress whose last appearance here was in the Long Day's Journey Into Night in which Jason Robards made his debut as a director last winter at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. Now A liss Caldwell will do the same with An Almost Perfect Person.

title: TV's Use of Fiber Transmission Begins
description: A. glass fiber as thin as a human hair, carrying pulses of light from a fixed source, was activated yesterday to carry television pictures in place of a standard threequarter inch coaxial cable, marking the first working use in cable television of the new lightwave communications technology.

title: Alfred Williams is Dead at 77; Electronics Pioneer and Inventor
description: Alfred L. W. Williams, an inventor with more than 701 patents to his name in mechanical engineering, electronic and acoustic devices, died Wednesday at University Hospital in Cleveland. He was 771 years old and lived in Cleveland.

title: Trucks Use Sidewalk To Pass Parked Van
description: A delivery van parked dead center in narrow West 40th Street for 20 minutes yesterday afternoon provided an example of continuing traffic tieups in the garment district despite the yearold program of the city to spend vehicular movement in the area.

title: Las Vegas East?
description: New Jersey forged ahead last week in a race that no citizen with the interests of his state at heart could want that state to wina race to establish the first eastern rival to Las Vegas as a haven for casino gambling. The Legislature in Trenton has completed action on a constitutional amendment that would allow casino gambling by local option in Atlantic City if approved by the voters in the general election this fall.

title: Books of The Times
description: New York has long been the cynosure and testingground of literary ambitions in this country. From its inception as a bustling port city devoted to commerce, it took, almost as an afterthought, from Boston the role of packager, merchandiser and celebrator of the national literatureand served as the origin or catalyst of much of it as well.

title: NEW JERSEY VOTES STATE INCOME TAX; BYRNE SIGNS BILL
description: TRENTON, July 8After more than a decade of intense resistance by the Legislature, New Jersey became tonight the 43d state in the nation to get an income tax when the Senate approved a measure pasied late last night by the Assembly.

title: Title to Miss Newfield
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 8  Betty Newfield turned back Stacy Bowman, 16, 61, 62, to win the 18's title in the Eastern (closed) junior girls tennis championships today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy. Sandy Fleischman won the 16's crown by downing Kathy Dalton, 60, 62.

title: Investigator Says Seepage Caused Idaho Dam Break
description: BOISE, Idaho, July 8 (AP)The Teton Dam in eastern Idaho collapsed June 5 because water seeped into its embankment and eroded it, but pinpointing how it happened will be difficult because much of the evidence was washed away, the chairman of an investigating committee has reported.

title: MEXICAN EDITOR OUSTED BY REBELS
description: MEXICO CITY, July 8  The editor and senior staff members of Mexico's most liberal and independent newspaper, Excelsior, were tonight ousted by a group of conservative employees apparently supported and encouraged by the Government.

title: Consumer Tips For Visitors
description: Most visitors know enough to shun a man who offers to sell the Brooklyn Bridge for $5, but what about a transistor radio for $3, a genuine jade necklace for $30 or tickets to A Chorus Line for $50?

title: CHRYSLER OUTPUT CUT BY A STRIKE
description: DETROIT, July 8The Chrysler Corporation announced today curtailment of production at five of its car and truck assembly plants, which employ 18,000 workers, because of a strike at an engine plant in suburban Trenton.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Mahmoud Riad, the head of the Arab League's mediation effort in Lebanon, returned to Cairo yesterday from a fruitless talk and said the Arab peacekeeping force in the Beirut area was powerless to act. He and the two other members of the mission, the foreign ministers of Tunisia and Bahrain, will attend a meeting of the 20 Arab League countries on Monday to consider further steps in the mediation attempt. in Beirut it was believed that the situation was too heated and bitter for effective mediation now, and the pessianism was increased by a report from Yasir Arafat, head of the Palestine Liberation Organization, that Syrian troops were about to attack Beirut. [Page A1, Column 1.]

title: Antiques
description: TIPPECANOE and Tyler too.  I croak for the Webster wagon.  Don't change horses in the middle of the stream.  A chicken in every pot.  Life, libery and Landon.  All the way with LBJ For more than a century, such slogans have added zest to political campaigns. They have also produced brisk business for manufacturers of the sort of buttons and broadsides on view in a colorful and timely exhibition at Bonwit Teller, Fifth Avenue at 56th Street, and in specialty. antiques shops everywhere.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Chicago White Sox, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 8 P. M. (TelevisionChannel 11.8 P.M.) (Radio WMCA, 7:55 P. M.)

title: AUGUSTASTEVENSON, CHILDREN'S AUTHOR
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 8 (UPI) Augusta Stevenson, internah tionally famous author of children's books died here yesterday. She was 105 years old.

title: Carter Confers With Mondale and Glenn
description: PLAINS, Ga., July 8Jimmy Carter dismissed as unfounded today suggestions that Senator Walter F. Mondale of Minnesota was too liberal to be a compatible VicePresidential running mate.

title: Joan Bowlus, 86, the Oldest Of Ziegfeld Follies Girls,
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (AP) Joan Bowlus, the oldest of the Ziegfeld Follies girls, died last Friday at the age of 86.

title: LowPriced Issues Set Market Pace
description: Lowerprice stocks continued to attract buying interest yesterday as basicindustry issues took a back seat on Wall Street. The Dow Jones industrial average rose only slightly although volume picked up substantially.

title: Two Aides to F. B. I. Chief Reportedly Under Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, July 8  A growing number of past and present executives of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, including two aides close to its director, Clarence M. Kelley, have fallen under the scrutiny of the Justice Department's inquiry into alleged criminal misconduct within the bureau, according to sources close to the inquiry.

title: Interest Level Dips to 5. 31 From 5. 37 Weekly Average
description: Interest rates declined yesterdaysharply in some cases as the credit markets became largely convinced that the Federal Reserve over the last three days had moved to ease monetary conditions slightly in the wake of June's slow moneysupply growth.

title: Conrail Executive Named As Metropolitan Manager
description: Kenneth E. Smith, general, manager of Conrail's Western region, has been appointed general manager of the metropolitan region, which takes in the Hudson, Harlem and New Haven commuter lines operating out of Grand Central Terminal.

title: Jerusalem's Mayor Gives 15 Trees to Battery Park
description: With just a touch of poetic license and no end of red tape, Jerusalem wood did come to Battery Park yesterday.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: BRONX

title: Tibetan GodKings Ancient Castle Is at Once Magnificent and Dead
description: LHASA, Tibet  What the Acropolis was to oid Athens the Potala is to Lhasa. if it stood on flat grcund the Potala would still be assertive, even dominating, but in fact it rears up from a great hill of sharp rock that stands almost sheer from the plain.

title: Dining Out Well On a Modest Budget
description: While finding expensive restaurants requires no special talent, finding those with reasonable prices, decent food and pleasant settings takes a good deal more searching. New York abounds in such places, fortunately, and a few personal favorites are included here. The guideline, in addition to respectable standards of cooking, cleanliness and atmosphere, was a $7 ceiling price for a complete dinner, that included at least two and usually three courses. Tips and drinks are additional.

title: U. S. Juniors Beat Germans in Track
description: LUEDENSCHEID, West Germany, July 8 (AP)Spurred by a world junior record of 3 minutes 4.8 seconds in the 1,600meter relay, the United States junior men's track and field team defeated West Germany, 13686 today in a twoday meet.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: 1976, by Triangle Publication, Inc.(The Daily Racing Form) Thursday, July 8. Eighth day. Weather clear, track good.

title: Advertising
description: A small but mighty group of ad agency brass was at a luncheon given yesterday in the Four Seasons by the Newspaper Advertising Bureau, and you could almost hear the listeners breathing quicken when Mack Morris, the bureau's vice president for national advertising, said, Advertisers can get ready to sell to the greatest mass luxury market in history.

title: Jacksonville Mayor, Who Heads The League of Cities, is Indicted
description: JACKONSVILLE, Fla., July 8 The Duval County grand jury today indicted Mayor Hans fanzler Jr. of Jacksonville, president of the National League of Cities, on one count of perjury before a notary public and two counts of failure to report contributions or gifts.

title: ISRAELIS STAGED RAID REHEARSAL
description: JERUSALEM, July 8  The Israeli Army units that rescued the hijacked hostages and crew at Entebbe Airport in Uganda last weekend carried out a fulldress rehearsal of the operation the night before in Israel.

title: FORD PICKS UP 12 IN NORTH DAKOTA
description: FARGO, N. D., July 8  The forces of Ronald Reagan backed away today from a floor fight with supporters of President Ford and settled for four of the 18 delegates North Dakota will send to the Republican National Convention in Kansas City.

title: Puerto Rican Five Bows
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 8 (AP)Rudy White's 20 points sparked the Houston Rockets of the National Basketball Association to an 8482 victory over the Puerto Rican Olympic team last night.

title: Reserve Report
description: Latest Prev. Year Woek Week Me

title: Erie County ExLegislator Indicted on Fraud Charges
description: BUFFALO, July 8 (UPI)A Federal grand jury has indicted a former member of the Erie County Legislature and 13 other persons in connection with an 18month investigation of alleged automobile insurance fraud.

title: Lead Prices Are Raised By St. Joe,
description: The leadprice increase announced on Wednesday by Asarco Inc. spread yesterday within the industry. The St.

title: FIGHTING UNCLEAR IN NORTH LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 8 (AP) Both sides claimed victories today in continued heavy fighting in northern Lebanon, but there were indications that the Lebanese leftists and their Palestinian allies remained on the defensive.

title: TELEVISION TODAY
description: Morning

title: Judge Bars Evidence Found In Apartment in Saxe Case
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP)Guns and ammunition found in a Boston apartment allegedly used by Susan Saxe may not be used against her in her bank robbery and murder trial this fall, the chief justice of the state's superior courts has ruled.

title: FORD'S PROSPECTS RAISED BY SHIFTS OF UNCOMMITTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 8President Ford's prospects of winning the Republican Presidential nomination have improved significantly in recent days.

title: British Liberals Chief
description: LONDON, July 8His style is cool and lowkeyed, his voice quiet. " I do not believe in approaching every problem with a completely open mouth, says 38  year  old David Steel. As the new leader of the troubled Liberal Party, Mr. Steel is, by all accounts, a detached and selfeffacing figure, a Member of Parliament whose easy style seems to mask layers of toughness and calculation and persistence.

title: A Cheer, of Sorts, For the Queen
description: BOURNE, Mass. It's not that Queen Elizabeth II has brought republicanism into disrepute, but over the years she has certainly taken the spice out of antimonarchism.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: AURORA STEWART BULL
description: Aurora Stewart Bull, a coloratura soprano who sang on radio in the 1920's and was voice teacher, died Tuesday in Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N. J. She was 80 ??? old and lived in Upper Montclair.

title: Market Place
description: If the Bangor Punta Corporation goes through with its tentative plans to acquire 10 percent of Lone Star Industries stock from James E. Stewart, who is Lone Star's chairman and Bangor Punta's vice chairman, Mr. Stewart would receive a premium on at least 150,000 of the Lone Star shares.

title: Patients More or Less Content Despite Suffolk Hospital Strike
description: BAY SHORE, LT., July 8At Southside Hospital here today, the picketers protested and the physicians and administrators worried, but the patients hardly seemed to have any complaints.

title: Jeweler and Wife Bound And Robbed in Sea Gate
description: An elderly jeweler and his wife were tied up yesterday by three masked burglars armed with a knife and handgun after they were awakened in their twostory residence at 3817 Poplar Avenue in the Sea Gate section of Brooklyn, where a private police force is maintained.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor New York City built great parks, which are now everywhere in decay. Bryant Park: An Oasis Plagued by Crime (news story June 26). Central Park, vulgarized, each Sunday marijuana sold openly and crowds of hustlers gambling at the Bethesda Fountain; the worldrenowned Terrace in near ruins. Why is City Hall asleep?

title: Neighbors Said to Like A Nuclear Power Plant
description: WATERFORD, Conn., July 6 (AP)Residents of Waterford, the site of a nuclear power plant, would vote in favor of building the plant if they had to do it over, a poll found.

title: CITY U. ATTACKED ON LAYOFF PLAN
description: The prospect that some tenused faculty members would be laid off while some nontenured ones kept their jobs sparked new controversy at, Queens College yesterday in the growing turmoil involving cutting the budgets of the City University's colleges.

title: 20 W. F. L. Refugees Seek Giant Jobs
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y. July 8The New York Giants opened their training camp today with 73 candidates, 20 of whom are refugees from the World Football League, which went out of business last November. Fifteen of these 20, including Larry Csonka, played for the Memphis Southmen, who have also contributed two assistant coaches to Bill Arnspargees staff, John McVey and Jay Fry.

title: Beame Fund Case May Mention Boomis
description: Christopher Boomis, the real estate developer, is believed to be a major figure in the newly revealed investigation by the Manhattan District Attorney into certain contributions to Mayor Beame's 1973 election campaign, accordirg to sources familiar with the case.

title: FOSTER SON HELD IN HOFFA INQUIRY
description: DETROIT, July 8Charles O'Brien, the foster con of James R. Hoffa, a key target of a grand jury investigation of Mr. lioffa's disappearance, has, been arrested on an indictment charging that he accepted gilts from a Detroit automobile dealership.

title: Draft Resister, Back as a Democratic Delegate, Faces Charge
description: Fritz Efaw, an indicted draftresister who was elected by American Democrats abroad as an alternate delegate to the Democratic National Convention, returned home yesterday after seven years of exile.

title: GENERAL ELECTRIC LIFTS PROFIT 39% AS ECONOMY GAINS
description: The General Electric Company increased its earnings 39.5 percent in the second quarter and 55 percent in the first six months of 1976 from the depressed yearearlier periods, the giant electricalequipment manufacturer said yesterday.

title: 8 Birdies in a Row for Zoeller
description: MOLINE, July 8 (AP) Fuzz.), Zoeller shot a courserecord 63, including a tour record 63, including a tourto take a onestroke lead over George Archer after the first round of the 5100,000 Quad Cities open golf tournament today.

title: Public Utility Board Approves 3. 9% Natural Gas Rate Rise
description: NEWARK, July 8The State Board of Public Utility Commissioners approved today a 3. 9 percent rate increase by the New Jersey Natural Gas Company that is expected to provide $2.7 million in new revenue.

title: Crime Figure Sentenced
description: BOSTON, July 8 (UPI)An alleged underworld figure, James Martorano, 34 years old, of Quincy, was sentenced in United States District Court yesterday to 10 years in prison and a $10,000 fine for loansharking.

title: Toy Maker to Cut Size of Package Containers
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (OPT) A New York to maker accused of deceiving buyers by marketing toys in containers, up to three times larger than necessary, has agreed to reduce the package size when the current suooly runs out.

title: Dentsply to Make AD International Bid
description: Dentsply International Inc. of York, Penn., announced yesterday that it would again make a $32 million tender offer for AD International of London. Dentsply is a manufacturer of dental supplies and equipment and AD International is a distributor of such products.

title: New York Hospital Union Plans to Extend Walkout
description: Nursing homes began moving the first of 1,600 patients to other places yesterday in expectation of a widening of the strike to include 14 homes tomorrow, when 10 municipal hospitals are also scheduled to be struck.

title: A Family's Campaign Is Parallel to Carter's
description: ROGERS, Ark., July 8If Jimmy Carter thinks he has gone to a lot of trouble getting to New York this year, he should talk to the Eugene T. Kelley family.

title: ExU. S. Attorney and 8 Others Indicted in Alaska Prostitution
description: SAN FRANCISCO. July 8Richard L. McVeigh, former United States Attorney for Alaska, and eight other persons were indicted by a Federal grand jury here today. They were accused of conspiring to set up a largescale prostitution and gambling operation for Alaskan pipeline workers.

title: At the Movies
description: TEN OR 11 years ago. Eleanor Perry, who was then doing some film reviewing as well as writing screenplays, delivered a fierce judgment on The Sandpiper.  it starred Elizabeth Taylor and was produced by Martin Ransohoff.

title: Federal Funds Rate Declines; Narrow Money Supply is Down
description: The nation's money supply, and currency, declined by $300 million during the week ended June 30, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday. on a broader definition, including consumertype time deposits, money supply rose $1. 4billion.

title: Bridge:
description: The worldwide trend in bidding systems in the last six years must be very entertaining to the ghost of Harold Vanderbilt, the inventor of contract bridge.

title: Ballesteros, 19, of Spain Leads British Open by 2 Shots at 138
description: SOUTHPORT, England, July 8Severiano Ballesteros is not yet a household name in professional golf because all this Spaniard has done so far is to lead the first two rounds of the 105th British Open, and lead the 1975 Continental Order of Merit. And, after all, it was only in April that he reached his 19th birthday.

title: Tavern on the Green A Creation to Appeal to All the Senses
description: A restaurant is a fantasy a kind of living theater in which diners are the most important members of the Cast, said Warner LeRoy, the creator and guiding light behind Maxwell's Plum and the soontobereopened Tavern on the Green in Central Park.

title: RADIO
description: 7:30  8:55 A. M., WNYC  FM: Mornings with Music. Concerto Grosso in G minor, Corelli; Second Rhapsody, Bartok; Les Faster de la Grande et Ancienne, Couperin; Ballade for Piano, Faure; Sonata for Viola D'Amore and Guitar, Hracek; Bourrle Fantasque, Chabrier.

title: About Real Estate
description: WHITE PLAINSA lowrise condominium development that the Robert Martin Company is building here offers further evidence of the growing popularity of such housine.

title: U. S. Aide Arrives in Zambia To Start African Briefings
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, July 8 (Reuters)William Schaufele, the leading African affairs official in the State Departmnt, arrived here today for talks with President Kenneth Kaunda on Ameican efforts to help find a peaceful solution to the problems of southern Africa.

title: Clark Urges Law to Cut Bribery By U. S. Corporations Abroad
description: Ramsey Clark yesterday urged the enactment of a Federal law to bar bribery by American corporations, charging that the practice had strained American relations with friendly nations, undermined the free market system land corrupted domestic policymaking.

title: Mrs. Nixon Seriously Ill After a Stroke
description: LONG BEACH, Calif. July 8  Patricia Nixon, wife of former President Richard M. Nixon, was in serious condition at the Long Beach Memorial Hospital tonight as a result of a stroke suffered yesterday.

title: An Intricate Dispute
description: This is not an ordinary, labor management dispute, Leon J. Davis, the president of District. 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees said on Wednesday just after 30,000 of his members walked out of 33 private, nonprofit hospitals. Whatever sharp disagreements there may Ibe in the dispute, there is no argument over Mr. Davis's statement. on the surface, of course, the dispute is not ordinary because it involves people's lives, and no one wants to be accused of causing agony or deathamong innocent) patients.

title: Mr. HiDeHo Steals the Show At Big Benefit
description: Sammy Davis Jr. was the star attraction at Wednesday's benefit concert for the HarlemDowling Children's Service, and he drew a guttering. array of his fellow performers to the event, at Carnegie Hall. One of them, Cab Calloway, opened the show and simply walked away with it.

title: Soviet Tall Ships Leave on Orders, Homeward Bound
description: The two Soviet sailing ships visitiing New York Harbor anchor and set said for home yesterday, canceling port calls in Boston and Baltimore and further participation in Operation Sail.

title: Where to Get Tickets
description: Following are some recommended shows that press time had some seats available.

title: Taiwan Athletes Confident In Departing for Montreal
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 8 (AP)  Twenty members of Taiwan's Olympic team left for Los Angeles today en route to Montreal. They expressed confidence that the International Olympic Committee would permit the team to compete in the Summer Games, which start July 17.

title: Donald Hardenbrook, 80, ExHead of N. A. M., Dead
description: Donald J. Hardenbrook, former president of the National Association of Manufacturers and a retired investment broker, banker and member of the New York Stock Exchange, died Monday in Nantucket, Mass., where he had lived since 1971. He was SO years old and previously had lived in New York.

title: New York Court Disbars Nixon for Watergate Acts
description: Richard M. Nixon was disbarred by a New York court yesterday, marking the first time the former President has been found guilty by an official body of charges relating to Watergate.

title: Indonesia Now Puts Quake Toll at 9,000 In West New Guinea
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, July 8  The Government said today that the death toll from an earthquake and subsequent landslides on the Indonesian part of the island of New Guinea had surpassed 9,000 and could go higher.

description: Pe Stk. of Pal, rlod. Rate. Record able

title: SOUTH KOREA FREES 18 CHRISTIAN CLERGY
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 8 The South Korean police have quietly released the 18 Christian clergymen they arrested last month on suspicion of proCommunist activities.

title: Probate Judge Defers Decision In Struggle Over Hughes Estate
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8,A probate judge deferred decision today on motions that could change the lineup of contestants who seek control of the billiondollar estate of the late Howard R. Hughes.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Visit New York City? If you must.

title: Harvey Realigns Top Executives
description: James Neal Harvey, who has been running his own ad agency for the last decade, is bringing in an eager beaver from the outside and planting him in a top executive job. He is Robert Rees, 38yearold vice president and management supervisor at Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, who will become president and chief operating officer, of James Neal Harvey Inc.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: New York not only has sights for sore eyes but also boasts sites for sore feet, as convention delegates and other visitors to New York in the busy week that starts this weekend will learn to their pleasure and profit. in midtown, people sit on steps and are not thought the worse for it. But there are steps and steps. Classiest stepsitting: New York Public Library, at Fifth Avenue and 42d Street, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Fifth Avenue and 83d Street; also, more exclusive with limited seating, St. Thomas Protestant Episcopal Church, Fifth Avenue and 53d Street. Two excellent private vestpocket parks: Paley Park, 3 East 53d Street, and Greenacre Park, north side of 51st Street, between Second and Third Avenues. Both have coollooking waterfalls and refreshments. Admission free.

title: India to Get $80 Million Loan
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) The World Bank announced today that India would receive, an $80 million loan to help finance expansion of the country's telecommunications system. A. twoyear project will include the installation of 274,000 local telephone lines and the connection of about 220,000 direct exchange lines, a bank spokesman said.

title: OUTLOOK ON PEACE IN LEBANON IS DIM, ARAB ENVOY SAYS
description: CAIRO. July 8The head of the Arab League's mediation mission in Lebanon returned here today from a fruitless round of talks and said the Arab peacekeeping force in the Beirut area was powerless to act.

title: MANY POSTAL RATES GOING UP ON JULY 18.
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) The Postal Service's rates for, special delivery mail, money orders and registered mail are going up July 18.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The state police in Trenton reported that the crime rate in New Jersey increased by 7 percent in 1975 over the previous year. The figures showed 376,139 serious crimes last year and 5,060 victims for every 100,000 permanent residents of the state.

title: Amer. Soccer League
description: WEDNESDAY NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Pat Stewart in Final
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., July 8Louise Cilia defeated Bonnie Aliaczo, 57, 75, 62; and Pat Stewart beat Ann Murphy. 6. 4, 75, in the semifinals of the New York State women's 35er tennis championships today.

title: Malaysian Life is Disrupted by Drive on Red Insurgents
description: IPOH, Malaysia  Malaysia, a quiet, orderly country with a thriving ecenomy and a strong sense of identity, has been gripped by fear of a fledgling Communist insurgency.

title: Jones Notches 16th Triumph As Padres Down Cubs, 63
description: I think 16 wins is enough work for half a season, said Randy Jones yesterday after scattering seven singles on the way to a 63 triumph over the Cubs in Chicago. The San Diego Padres lefthander hurled his 15th complete game in 21 starts and won for the 16th time in 19 decisions.

title: NEW JERSEY VOTES STATE INCOME TAX; BYRNE SIGNS BILL
description: TRENTON, July 8After more than a decade of intense resistance by the Legislature, New Jersey became tonight the 43d state in the nation to get an income tax when the Senate approved a measure passed late last night by the Assembly.

title: Wisconsin Town Uses Its Waste to Helo Grow Crops, Creating a Model for the State
description: JANESVILLE, WIS.  The grass around this city's 545million sewage treatment plant is as green as a billiard table and the corn growing on 45 acres of city land, which should be kneehigh by the Fourth of July, was already midthigh by the first.

title: Dance Offers Bipartisan Appeal
description: Something to write home about is an evening at the ballet in New Yorkespecially if you catch a performance this weekend by Mikhail Baryshnikov, the sensational Russian dancer who defected two years ago and who is now appearing at the New York State Theater with American Ballet Theater.

title: Vengeance Suggested as Motive In Slaying of Arizona Reporter
description: PHOENIX. July 8In a deposition made public today, Neal Roberts, a former Assistant Arizona Attorney General, asserted that a close associate of a prominent Arizona landowner spoke of oldstyle Western justice before the slaying of Don Bolles, a reporter for The Arizona Republic.

title: SELECTION OF JURY FOR HARRISES ENDS
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8Selection of the 12member jury that will decide the state's case against William and Emily Harris, accused with Patricia Hearst of assault, robbery and kidnapping, was completed today, nine days after jury selection began, and after 76 prospects had been questioned.

title: New York Court Disbars Nixon for Watergate Acts
description: Richard M. Nixon was disbarred by a New York court yesterday, marking the first time the former President has been found guilty by an official body of charges relating to Watergate.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 4.7 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 215.6 from 210.9 last week.

title: Jersey Income Tax Plan Will Yield School Money
description: TRENTON, July 8The income tax package passed by the Legislature is designed to generate enough revenue to reopen the state's public schools, provide each homeowner with a $190 reduction in his local property tax bill and even give New York a $22 million annual windfall.

title: Notes on People
description: Six paintings valued at $385. 000 were stolen from the home of Harvard President Derek C. Bak early yesterday, apparently while he was asleep.

title: City's Cabarets Sparkle With Music Nostalgia and Satire
description: As the Democrats begin their convention at Madison Square Garden, political satirists have zeroed in on New York for a convention of their own. Mort Sahl, the scourge of the 50s, is back in town smacking a newspaper on his knee at the Bird Cage in Michael's Pub. Mark Russell has come up from his permanent roost at the Shoreham in Washington to spread his expertise at the Rainbow Grill. A gathering of improvisationists has moved into the Bottom Line where, billed simply as The Convention, they will give their interpretations of events at the other convention night by night. And local comics, who keep trying out material at the Improvisation and Catch a Rising Star, are riffling through their files of politician bits.

title: Holtzman Stops White Sox, 60
description: The Yankees and Ken Holtzman took just 1 hour 50 minutes of the Chicago White Sox's time last night to record a 60 victory at the Stadium.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, July 8, 1976 (In bushels, 000 omitted) Open

title: Vietnam Aids Palestinians
description: HANOI, Vietnam, July 8 (Agence FrancePresse)Vietnam has handed over a gift of medical and food supplies to the Palestinians, according to press reports here. At the same time, it was learned that Prime Minister Pham Van Dong met yesterday with the Hanoi representative of the Palestine Liberation Oreanisation, Ali Fayad, to discuss the situation in Lebanon.

title: Dutch Trace Route Forefathers Sailed Along the Hudson
description: KINGSTON, N.Y., July 8Harry Rigby, the city historian, led 42 Dutch sailors along the narrow sidew & alk here and pointed with pride to the 300yearold Senate House.

title: Sanitation Areas Picked For Test Coop Program
description: Forest Hills, Queens, and the Borough Park section of Brooklyn have been proposed as the two sanitation districts to be combined this fall in the radical experiment of creating a workerowned cooperative to take over municipal garbage collections and street cleaning.

title: 5 Reds To Start For N. L.
description: Joe Morgan, last season's most valuable player, heads a list of five players from the world champion Cincinnati Reds in the starting lineup of the National League in the 47th Allstar game at Philadelphia next Tuesday night.

title: U. S. Soccer Coach Named
description: The United States Soccer Federation yesterday named Walter Chyzowych national coach. Chyzowych, who coached Philadelphia Textile to 128 victories, 37 losses and 13 ties since 1964, will be responsible for recruiting, training and coaching the World Cup Team, the Olympic team and the junior World Cup Team.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: A wellknown party game is reversed as the host, jimmy Carter

title: Carter Confers With Mondale and Glenn
description: PLAINS, Ga., July 8Jimmy Carter dismissed as unfounded today suggestions that Senator Walter F. Mondale of Minnesota was too liberal to be a compatible VicePresidential running mate.

title: FORD'S PROSPECTS RAISED BY SHIFTS OF UNCOMMITTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 8President Ford's prospects of winning the Republican Presidential nomination have improved significantly in recent, days.

title: Airline Chief is 7th Held By Japan in Payoff Case
description: TOKYO. July 8Japanese ruthorities investigating the Lockheed payoff scandal made their seventh arrest today, taking into custody the head of Japan's largest airline, and more arrests were expected later.

title: In Pine Barrens, a Salute to a Fallen Eagle
description: TABERNACLE, N. 3. In a remote clearing cut into the stunted underbrush seven miles southeast of this tiny Pine Barrens hamlet, the 48th anniversary of the death of Emilio Carranza will be observed tomorrow by Mexico's diplomatic corps and the American Legion in nearby Mount Holly.

title: News Strike in Italy
description: ROME, July 8 (Reuters)Italians underwent a total news blackout today with no newspapers on sale and no news bulletins on radio or television. The blackout was the result of a national 24hour strike by journalists and print wo. ???rs.

title: Exotica: Specialties for the Rarest Tastes
description: If you live in the sort of community where no special effort is required on any given day to come up with an Indian sari, a photograph of James Cagney pushing grapefruit in Mae Clark's face, a wine press, a centuryold Navajo rug, a copy of The Jerusalem Post, next week's bestselling novel at half price, a bottle of rare claret, a kosher pickle out of a barrel, a campaign hat, a Tshirt decorated with Mickey and Minnie Mouse exchanging compliments in Japanese, a ship's wheel, a wallet for darts, a ceremonial rattle, a 20inch piece of wooden type, the cologne reputedly used by George Washington, a pinch of Rupture Wort, a pound of caviar and a snack of Scotch salmon, then don't bother to read the rest of this.

title: Art People
description: SoHo has liveinartists, lowrise buildings and ground floor or walkup galleries. The art is not only easier to see (in fact, around any corner, you may meet artists lugging sculptures or canvases to their dealers), the area itself is fun to walk in, presenting an intriguing mix of studios, residences, small factories, restaurants, bars and boutiques, many of them inhabiting 19thcentury buildings with elegant castiron fronts.

title: Voluntary Hospitals Affected by the Strike
description: Following is the list of voluntary hospitals that have been struck since Wednesday morning.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: On the eve of the Democratic convention, the television schedule is understandably heavy with politics interviews with former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia, the Democrats most likely nominee, speculation on his choice for Vice President, a nostalgic look at past conventions and previews of this week's activities. Elsewhere, the programming assortment runs to a typical mix of sports, specials and reruns.

title: Unionists Back Metzenbauml
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, July 8 (UPI) The executive board of the Ohio American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations yesterday endorsed Howard Metzenbaum of Cleveland in his bid to unseat Senator Robert Taft Jr., Republican of Ohio, in the November general election.

title: Carter Asking Written Reports From Prospects for No. 2 Spot
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 Possible VicePresidential nominees being screened by Jimmy Carter and a close Carter aide have been asked to answer a list of written questions about their financial and medical records, Congressional sources said today.

title: Federal Reserve Statement
description: (millions of dollars) Daily Averages for the weeks ended:(July 7, 1976) (June 30, 1976) (July 9. 1975)

title: Keenan is Opposed to Sharing. Power With District Attorneys
description: John F. Keenan, the new special state anticorruption prosecutor, said yesterday that he was opposed to sharing jurisdiction with the city's five District Attorneys in cases involving corrupt acts in the criminaljustice system.

title: Two Aides to F. B. I. Chief Reportedly Under Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 A growing number of past and present executives of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, including two aides close to its director, Clarence M. Kelley, have fallen under the scrutiny of the Justice Department's inquiry into alleged criminal misconduct within the bureau, according to sources close to the inquiry.

title: People and Business
description: The American Motors Corporation announced yesterday the formation of an office of the president, which would be manned by three of its senior executives. Roy D. Chapin Jr., 60, continues as chairman and chief executive officer, a position he has held since January 1967.

title: A New Olympian Psyching Up
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y., July 8Four years ago, when Kathy McMillan was in eighth grade in Raeford, N. C., she was the star of the physical education class. She was long jumping 12 or 13 feet and as she recalled today.

title: Elderly Being Relocated Often Feel Dislocated
description: That peculiar mental fragility that comes with old age was being overtaxed in 14 nursing homes around the city yesterday as nearly 1,600 patients were being moved in preparation for a strike at the institutions on Saturday by members of District 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees.

title: Amex Index Gains 0. 59 As OTC Adds 0. 18 Points
description: Stocks advanced yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter markets.

title: To Many, an Income Tax Was Just a Matter of Time
description: TRENTON, July 8Despite a string of legislative defeats that spanned three administrations and six Legislatures, political leaders from both parties had predicted that, sooner or later, New Jersey would get a state income News tax, that it was Analysis only a question of time. The time was tonight. But even tonight, despite predictions that the votes in the Senate were finally there, Democratic legislative leaders approached the historic session with trepidation. Something, they feared, would pop up to turn the votes against them.

title: 7 Artists View New York
description: The spirit of New York, contemporary art capital of the world, is often best expressed by the internationally known artists who live here. To these artists, inevitably, New York is a source of inspiration, and for this corrventiongoerst issue of Weekend, The New York Times asked seven artists to convey their special relationship with local people and places. The drawings on these pages are the results. They have been done by Christo, Red Grooms, Robert Indiana, David Levine, Philip Pearlstein, Larry Rivers and James Rosenquist.

title: New York Hospital Union Plans to Extend Walkout
description: An evacuation of 1,600 elderly patients from nursing homes in New York City began yesIterday as striking nonprofessional hospital workers threatiened to extend their walkout tomorrow to 10 municipal hospitals and 14 nursing homes.

title: The Labor Scene
description: LONDONLabormanagement relations, long regarded as the Achilles heel of Britain's battered economy, are proving a key source of strength in the budding British recovery.

title: Two Pairs Share Medal On 66's in Anderson Golf
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., July 8  Richard Siderowf, the British Amateur champion, and his partner, Howard Kaskel, both of Doral, were among the favorites as the Anderson Memorial fourball invitation golf tournament opened today.

title: Jersey Girl, 16, is Slain In Park Near Her Home
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., July 8 (UPI)  A North Bergen, N. J., girl was found stabbed to death today in a park five blocks from her home, the police reported.

title: Choosing Number Two
description: Governor Carter's choice of a running mate, whoever he turns out to be, will have been made with far more care, deliberation and advice than generally go into the selection of a VicePresidential candidate. Partly this is a consequence of the undisputed claim on the nomination that the former Georgia Governor was able to secure a month or so before the Democratic convention, which opens next week. But it is to his credit that he has taken advantage of the interval to give full attention to a problem that rarely receives the serious consideration it demands.

title: AMEX UNIT VOTES TO RESCIND RULES ON DUAL TRADING
description: The board of governors of the American Stock Exchange voted yesterday to rescind a 65yearold rule prohibiting dual trading of issues on the Amex and the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Arts and Sciences Academy To Build New Headquarters
description: BOSTON, July 8The American Academy of Arts and Sciences, which now operates from a 19thcentury house in suburban Brookline, announced today that it would build a permanent national headquarters at Science Park, a stateowned tract of land on a dam across the Charles River, between Boston and Cambridge.

title: Jersey Income Tax Plan Will Yield School Money
description: TRENTON, July 8The income tax package passed by the Legislature is designed to generate enough revenue to reopen the states public schools, provide each homeowner with a $190 reduction in his local property tax bill and even give New York a $22 million annual windfall.

title: City Council Ethics Committee Weighs Action on Troy Today
description: The New York Council's Committee on Standards and Ethics will hold a closed meeting today to consider whether any action should be taken concerning the Finance Committee chairman, Matthew J. Troy Jr., who pleaded guilty a week ago to Federal charges of incometax evasion.

title: Management
description: In 1970, after Wall Street's paperwork crisis had capsized scores of brokerage houses, the head of a rival firm grudgingly paid a compliment to Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc. They are a decade ahead of us in management techniques, he said.

title: Mrs. Nixon Has Stroke
description: Patricia Nixon, wife of former President Richard M. Nixon, was in serious condition in a Long Beach, Calif., hospital after suffering a stroke. Page A28.

title: HANOI ASKS FOOD AID FROM SOVIET BLOC
description: EAST BERLIN, July 8 (Reuters)Vietnam appealed today to the Soviet bloc for urgent supplies of food and other commodities because of shortages.

title: Queen Turns the Tables and Entertains Hundreds in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Qu. een Elizabeth II, whn has been entertained by her hosts for the last few days, returned the compliment tonight with dinner for 84 and a reception for 1,600 at the British Embassy.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world sold prices Thursday. London: Morning fixing $123. 10, down $0.20: afternoon fixing $123. 10, down $0. 20. Paris: Afternoon market Quotation 1124. 49, down $0. 28.

title: Stores: A Shopper's Dream in the Fashion Center of the World
description: Shopping is one of the joys of visits to any great city, even if the primary purpose is business, sightseecing or conventioneering. There's the need to bring a trinket or two to the folks back home, the desire to have a personal memento of the visit, plus the sheer pleasure of acquisition. New York, which is generally as well set up as Rome, Paris or London to satisfy these needs, is making a special effort to serve convention visitors. A number of stores are easing credit regulations, planning sameday deliveries to hotels and setting up lounges where delegates can use the phones, rest their feet and have a drink.

title: A Strong Gov. Carey Will Greet Convention
description: When Hugh L. Carey weltimes the Democratic National Convention delegates to New York on Monday night, it will Up sjmply as Governor of the least state and not as the naponal contender he had once expected himself to be.

title: Ford Denlores Disnute
description: WASHINGTON, July 9President Ford said today it was tragic that Taiwan's Olympic team had become emmeshect in a diplomatic dispute with Canada.

title: Stay Healthy, Strikers Advise the Democrats
description: Striking hospital workers have prepared a leaflet advising delegates arriving here for the opening of the Democratic National Convention on Monday to stay healthy.

title: Stroke Experts Cite Stress on Mrs. Nixon
description: Although Pat Nixon had no medical history of high blood pressure, the leading cause of stroke, experts said yesterday that, given her age and the recent stressful events in her life, she could easily have developed high blood pressure in the 18 months or so since, according to her doctors, she last underwent a medical examination.

title: Journalist Edits Black 'Who's Whet Largest of Its Kind
description: Who's Who Among Black Americans, a new 772page book that lists 10,000 living blacks in education, business, science, law, sports, music, dance, painting and film, is the largest biographical reference about blacks ever compiled.

title: Home Observes Couple's 72d Anniversary
description: In the eighth decade of their marriage and the 10th decade of their lives, Sam and Gussie Teller may be pardoned for occasional lapses of memory, but both were certain of their good years yesterday as they celebrated their 72d wedding anniversary.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LONG PLAYING This is the 59th season for the Guggenheim free park concerts by the Goldman Band, led by Richard Franko Goldman, son of the band's founder. Edwin Franko Goldman.

title: Woman Abducted And Raped in Park; 2 Suspects Seized
description: A 23yearold woman was forced into an automobile at knifepoint in the West 40's yesterday morning and, during the next four hours, was raped by her abductors, the New York City police reported. Two suspects were arrested.

title: White House Hails Shift of a Delegate In Brooklyn to Ford
description: The competition for the votes of Republican National Convention delegates has become so intense that the White House press office informed newsmen yesterday of the switch of one delegate in Brooklyn to President Ford.

title: Books of The Times
description: Samuel Kaplan's The Dream Deferred: People, Politics and Planning in Suburbia Is a splendid examination of Americas emerging majority, the suburban populationa population that, in the last 15 years, has accounted for 75 percent of the nations growth. As Mr. Kaplan, a former.

title: Bettors Uncertain About Trot Picks
description: Nick Armelino said he would bet on Snegem Flight because he read a convincing statement by the owner that the Canadian horse would win. Ray Bayson liked Bellino II, the French horse, but would give Delfo, the Italian horse, 20on the morning line, a careful look. Armelino and Bayson At the Race Tracks were in the Offtrack Betting pallor at Broadway and 43d Street yesterday studying the form sheets for tonight's $200,000 International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway. Others in the parlor said they would bet Savior and Meadow Bright because they understood the form charts on the American horses, but didn't relate to tracks in France, Sweden and Italy, where the European horses race.

title: For Hall, A 3d Try At Games
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y., July 9 Gary Hall, after a glorious career that saw him break world records in four events, retired from swimming in 1973. And 1974. Arkl 1975. After the Olympics later this month in Montreal, he will retire again.

title: Blanche Gilman, 90, led State Commission for Blind
description: Blanche Pearl Gilman, a former chairman of the State Commission for the Blind, died Thursday at her home at the age of 90. She lived at 575 Park Avenue.

title: This New York Times/July 10, 1976
description: This New York Times/July 10, 1976

title: Concorde Flights in U.S. Create One Unexpected Sonic Boom
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Government said today that the first full month of Concorde, supersonic airline flights here had shown that noise levels hewed to predictions, that there was one sonic boom, and that the boom had stirred no public complaints.

title: 2 Wars in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 9There are two wars being fought in Lebanon. One is between the Syrians and the Palestinians. The other is between news analays.

title: A New Trial Urged In Obscenity Case Involving Sex Films
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The Justice Department urged the Supreme Court today to order a new trial for theater operators convicted of showing Deep Throat in Newport, Ky., on the ground that the defendants were victims of a shift in court standards on obscenity.

title: Deadly Strike
description: How many lives must be endangered before the representatives of hospital workers and management sit down together to talk rationally and realistically about their common problemrestructuring health services in this city so that hospitals can provide adequate care for patients and fair pay for employees at prices the public can afford to support?

title: Bridge:
description: Experts seldom fail in executing the simpler varieties of squeeze. But defending against a potential squeeze is quite another matter, and they do not always rise to the occasion and find the appropriate countermeasure. A case in point is the diagramed deal from the Bicentennial match in Springfield, Mass., a week ago.

title: Tanzania Warns of Pullout
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, July 9 (UPI)Tanzania announced today it would not send a team to the Summer Olympic Games in Montreal if New Zealand were allowed to participate. The Games open next Saturday.

title: Now the Time to Party for Their Aid
description: Ramsey had George Grizzard and Tammy Grimes. Bella had Jane Fonda. But Bella got $50 at the door and Ramsey got only $25. With Jane Fonda, you can get $50, said one of Mrs. Abzug's aides.

title: 3 STORES OFFER  TO SETTLE SUITS
description: Three of the New York area's bestknown fashion stores, Saks Fifth Avenue, Bergdorf Goodman and Bonwit Teller, have offered about $5.2 million to settle seven classaction suits brought on pricefixing allegations by their credit customers.

title: BERGMAN JAILING IS PUT OFF AGAIN
description: I Bernard Bergman won another delay in his jail term for nursinghome fraud when his lawyer insisted yesterday that he yet might withdraw his I guilty plea.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Friday.

title: S.L.A. Members Sentenced In Attack on Sheriff's Aide
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., July 9 (UPI)Two members of the socalled Symbionese Liberation Army, Russell Little and Joseph Remiro, were sentenced today to terms of five years to life for assault in an attempt to escape from the Alameda County fail in Oakland.

title: FEDERATED NEAR RICH'S TAKEOVER
description: Rich's Inc. in Atlanta announced yesterday an agreement in principle to be acquired by Federated Department Stores, the nation's largest department store chain.

title: French Oil Company Joins the Majors',
description: PARIS, July 9A new inter national oil company, a second major oil enterprise of French nationality, went into operation today, as stockholders approved the merger of the 100 percent stateowned ElfErap Company with the 54 percent stateowned Societe Nationale des Petroles d'Aquitaine.

title: Issues in Hospital Strike
description: PARTIESDistrict 1199, National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees representing 30,000 workers, most of whom are nonprofessionals. Thirty.three hospitals, 27 belonging to the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes of New York. The union has also threatened to strike 10 municipal hospitals and 14 nursing homes today.

title: Economic Progress Sparks Stock Rally
description: The stock market produced a sharp rally yesterday based on favorably Interpreted developments in two worrisome areas: the inflation rate and the course of monetary policy.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 9The income tax bill signed by Governor Byrne last night will not be effective until a companion bill providing for more state aid to cities clears the Legislature.

title: Ashe Bows To Orantes By 64. 64
description: MYRTLE BEACH. S.C., July 9 (UPI)Manuel Orantes of Spain defeated Arthur Ashe today, 64, 64, to claim the first victory of the $150,000 Grand Slam of Tennis. The triumph sent Orantes into Sunday's final against the winner of the Jimmy Connors Ill Nastase match, to be held tomorrow. The winner will receive a $75,000 first prize.

title: Skitch Henderson Is at Pub
description: Skitch Henderson, the bearded, avuncular pianist who used to conduct the Tonight show band, is making his first New York club appearance in several years at Michael's Pub this month. The scaleddown orchestra He is leading consists of a string quartet, which is made up of Juilliard graduate students; a bassist, a drummer, his own piano and vocals by Harold Dumont.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: PRESIDENT GAINS 3 COLORADO VOTES
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., July 9President Ford's renomination campaign picked up three delegates out of nine tonight in Colorado's last three Congressional district conventions.

title: Agnes de Mine Gala Features Three of Her Dances
description: This is a sort of love letter to Agnes de Millea quasiqueasy loveletter from a nervous lover. Quasi? Because if you really love someone that person's faults are as real to youand as unimportantas their virtuies.

title: All's well, etc., etc. Or, we told you so.
description: It couldn't be done, so they said. The Democrats couldn't have a convention in New York City, so they said. The government of New York City couldn't produceit was weighted down in its own problems and didn't have the capacity to deliver, so they said. The fact is, Mayor Beanie and his staff have been responsive in all respects. This citys government has done everything it committed itself to do, and more. Governor Carey and his staff, whenever called! upon, have fully and totally responded. The same is true for Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin and his office.

title: School Districts Awaiting Broad Effects of New Aid
description: TRENTON, July 9  The enactment of the state income tax will soon enable school districts across New Jersey to reduce their local property taxes for school purposes. For the reductions to last, the school boards must hold the line on spending.

title: Queen Warmly Received On New York City Tour
description: Queen Elizabeth II came to New York yesterday to make speeches, shake hands, become an honorary citizen of the city, wave to thousands of New Yorkersand collect 279 years', worth of back rent.

title: SOYUZ CREW TESTS EFFECTS ON FISH
description: MOSCOW, July 9 (UPI)The two Soyuz 21 astronauts, adjusting well to weightlessness on what could be a record stay in space, began a, series of biological experiments with fish today in the roomy Salyut Soviet space laboratory.

title: Anderson Seeks Talks on Court Plan
description: ALBANY, July 9In a bid to seize the initiative from the Democrats, the Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson of Binghamton, called on Governor Carey and Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut today to join in new discussions to achieve a package on court reorganization, which eluded the Legislature in its closing days last week.

title: New York Style
description: The Old Custom House at Battery Park opened for the Bicentennial with a trumpet flourish and a cleaning statuary. The holiday crowds flanked Daniel Chester French's Four Continents and climbed the noble entrance stair to watch Op Sail; the evening fireworks gilded the freshly washed white marble facade. Inside, other richly colored marbles and mosaics glowed in halls of triumphal scale, also freshly cleaned; and the Rotunda soared to Reginald Marsh's newlylit murals of a ship entering New York harborimmortal W.P.A. vignettes of Moran tugs and a starlet shipboard interview. (Legend says it's Greta Garbo.)

title: Growing Together
description: The major industrial democracies have managed aehieve a relatively geed record of international economic cooperation in recent years.

title: Louisianan Slain; Had Role in Fight On RighttoWork
description: BATON ROUGE, La., July 9 (AP)James Leslie, a Shreveport public relations man who fashioned a successful television campaign for passage of the socalled righttowork law for Louisiana, was shot to death early today. The Police would not release details of the shooting.

title: Circuit Breaker Takes Working Hunter Title
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., July 9Mrs. Robert C. Brumder's Circuit Breaker failed to score in the final class but had piled enough points in early events and won the regular working hunter championship today at the Lake Placid Horse Show.

title: Notes on People
description: Kay Bailey, a 32yearold Houston lawyer, a Texas legislator since 1972, was sworn in yesterday as first vice chairman of the National Transportation Safety Board. President Ford was on hand for the ceremony in the Oval Office of the White House, and Miss Bailey was welcomed by the board chairman, Webster B. Todd Jr., a former commercial pilot from Princeton, N. J.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Navy Ends F14 Grounding
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The Navy said today that 200 F14 jet fighter planes, temporarily ;crowded while two fatal traming crashes were under investigation, had been returned to flight status. In training operations at the Mirimar Naval Air Station in California, one F714 crashed June 21 and another June 23. Each plane car??? two crewmen, and all four were killed.

title: Sales of Grain to Soviet at 4.5 Million Tons
description: Topping a week of rumors and confirmation of rumors about grain and soybean sales to the Soviet Union, Cook Industries late yesterday indentitied itself as a seller to the Russians of one million tons of soybeans, 300,000 tons of corn and 300,000 tons of wheat.

description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The Justice Department urged the Supreme Court today to order a new trial for theater operators convicted of showing Deep Throat in Newport, Ky., on the ground that the defendants were victims of a shift in court standards on obscenity.

title: COUNCIL TO DEFER DECISION ON TROY
description: The City Council's Committee on Standards and Ethics decided yesterday to defer consideration of whether the Council should take any action in the case of Matthew J. Troy Jr., the Queens Democratic Councilman who pleaded guilty last week to Federal charges filing a false income tax return for 1972.

title: Dierker NoHitter Downs Expos, 60
description: HOUSTON. July 9 (AP)Larry Dierker, a Houston righthander and a major leaguer for 12 years at the age of 29, pitched the first nohitter of the 1976 baseball season tonight, allowing four walks as the Astros whipped the Montreal Expos, 60.

title: Tom Yawkey, 73
description: BOSTON, July 9 (AP)Thomas A. Yawkey, 73 years old, owner of the Boston Red Sox since 1933, died today of leukemia.

title: General Cherevichenk, 80; Soviet Wartime Commander
description: MOSCOW, July 8 (UPI)Col. Gen. Yakov T. Cherevichenko, who commanded Soviet troops on three fronts during World War II, has died at the age of 80 after a long illness, the Soviet army newspaper Krasnaya Zvezda said today.

title: Kenya Restricts Uganda's Key Rail Link to the Sea
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 9 (UPI) Kenya has retaliated against President Idi Amin of Uganda by restricting his landlocked nation's railway access to the Indian Ocean.

title: The Sportsman Owner
description: Since he acquired the Boston Red Sox in 1933, it had been estimated that Tom Yawkey, one of the last of the paterInalistic, sportsman owners in the game, lost more than $10 million on the team. Fortunately, he had the money to loseand much more.

title: DRAFT RESISTER GETS A REPRIEVE
description: Fritz Efaw, an indicted draft resister, will take his seat with other delegates and alternates when the Democratic National Convention opens here on Monday.

title: Ashes of Chu Teh Placed in Temple In Forbidden City
description: PEKING, July 9 (Reuters)The ashes of Chu Teh, the most famous Chinese Communist military hero, were placed today in a temple in the Forbidden City.

title: Doctors Say Mrs. Nixon Is Showing Improvement
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., July 9 Pat Nixon showed slight improvement today in her struggle to recover from a stroke that has left her with partial paralysis of her left side and a slight slurring of her speech.

title: Business Briefs
description: The savings banks of New York State opened more than 130,000 checking accounts totaling $44.3 million during June, the first full month in which they could offer such service under a new state law.

title: Taiwanese Balkedby Canada
description: BOSTON, July 9 (UPI)Twentyfive members of the Taiwan Olympic team, unable to gain entry into Canada, arrived here today seeking a place to practice.

title: Pentagon Permits a Glimpse Of UltraSecretWar Room
description: WASHINGTON, July 9A few weeks ago the Secretary of Defense, the Deputy Secretary of Defense, the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and sundry flag officers and civilian officials assembled in a topsecret room at the Pentagon to supervise the evacuation of 116 Americans in Beirut.

title: Spain's King Calls for Support, Urges Cabinet to Act for Unity
description: MADRID, July 9King Juan Carlos appealed today for public support of Spain's new Government and urged it to act to unify the country and increase confidence in the monarchy.

title: Hospital Strike Gives Officers A Chance to Try Out Old Skills
description: Jerry Sloven was glowing like, an athlete at the peak of his game as he rushed to assist one a pacemaker operation.

title: Cotton Markets
description: Contract Nd, 2

title: DayCare Landlords Notified Of Plan to Renegotiate Leases,
description: The head of the Department of Real Estate has notified landlords of 17 directlease daycare centers that the city's fiscal crisis makes it impossible for it to continue occupying their facilities and strongly suggested that the owners consider renegotiating the leases.

title: Hearing for Carter Picketed
description: A dozen supporters of Rubin (Hurricane) Carter picketed outside the Passaic County Curthouse in Paterson yesterday, demanding that the pubiic be admitted to a closed bail hearing. The hearing, at the request of the County Prosecutor, is bein held to determine whether being Carter's $20,000 bail should be revoked or increased pending his retrial on triplemurder charges.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The New Jersey Public Interest Research Group, a nonprofit organization affiliated with Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, has released a study that shows that the elderly pay a disproportionately higher share of the cost of prescription medicines.

title: Market Place
description: Few investors appear to be aware of commission plans offered individuals by leading brokerage houses that permit them to buy and sell securities at substantial discounts.

title: Funeral Home. Chain to Make Refunds
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commission ordered the country's largest funeral home chain today to make refunds to persons who had been overcharged wherr they arranged burials and told it to stop forcing the purchase of coffins when the deceased was cremated.

title: GOLD
description: Selected world gold prices Friday. London: Morning fixing $122.60, down $0.50: afternoon fixing $122.50, down $0.60. Paris: Afternoon market quotation

title: Queen Warmly Received On New York City Tour
description: Queen Elizabeth H came to New York yesterday to make speeches, shake hands, become an honorary citizen of the city, wave to thousands of New Yorkersand collect 279 years worth of back rent.

title: Wholesale Prices In June Increased A Moderate 0.4%
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Wholesale Price Index rose moderately in June, with less inflation in the volatile agricultural sector of the economy but more in industrial prices, the Labor Department reported today.

title: F.P.C. Seeks to Ease Rate Case Backlog
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Federal Power Commission announced today that it was creating a task force to seek settlements of the large and growing backlog of unresolved electric power rate cases.

title: Sets Beaten, 3321, By Lobsters
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., July 9 The Boston Lobsters won four of the five contests to defeat the New York Sets, 332], in a World Tennis match before 2,396 at the Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: Queen Warmly Received On New York City Tour
description: Queen Elizabeth H came to New York yesterday to make speeches, shake hands, become an honorary citizen of the city, wave to thousands of New Yorkersand collect 279 years worth of back rent.

title: JERSEY MAN HELD IN ABDUCTON OF 4
description: Bankers Wife. 3 Children Kept in Car for 2 HoursAppeals for Aid Ignoreda New Jersey banker's wire and three young children wire abducted by a knife wielding man and held for about t ??? hours in a car yesterday afternoon before escaping when the man left them momentarily to collect a $75,000 ransom in Paterson, the Federal Bureau of Investigation disclosed last night.

title: Rev. Walter A. Scholten, 81, Pastor in Reformed Church
description: The Rev. Walter A. Scholten, a Reformed Church minister, died July 2 at his home in Greenwich, N. Y. He was 81 years old.

title: Mrs. Canner Leads Women's Open by 2
description: SPRINGFIELD, Pa., July 9 JoAnne Carner, the longball hitter with years of experience, took the lead at the halfway point of the 31st United States Women's Open golf championship today as Connie Chillemi, the longball hitter with hardly any experience, fell far back from her unexpected firstround lead.

title: AMEX VALUE INDEX INCREASES BY 0.68
description: Stock prices moved ahead ebulliently yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market in moderate volume. The Amex market value indicator closed at 106.57, up 0.68, while the NASDAQ industrial index closed at 97.80, up 0.73.

title: UGANDA BIDS U.N. CONDEMN ISRAEL FOR AIRPORT RAID
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 9Uganda demanded, in the Security Council tonight that the Council condemn Israel in the strongest terms for its raid on Entebbe airport last Saturday night to rescue hostages held by proPalestinian hiiackers.

title: The Shop Went From Plants to Planters and More
description: The faint, fresh, eucalyptuslike scent that floats through the air when one opens the door to Incorporated, a new crafts source, may be the effluvium of a lingering ghost. For the shop, which still has scattered about its premises large leafy things growing in straw baskets, started life as a plant store.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Tom Yawkey, the 73yearold owner of the Boston Red Sox, died yesterday of leukemia. Yawkey had been ill for several months. Page 26.

title: B. W. Smith Weds Marnie Cunningham
description: Margaret Riker Henry Cunningham was married yesterday afternoon in St. James's Episcopal Church to Bradley W. Smith, a stockbroker. The Rev. Ralph R. Warren Jr. performed the ceremony.

title: FORD NOW FINDS REAGAN QUALIFIED TO BE PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 President Ford said today that Ronald Reagan was qualified to serve in the White House and he appealed to his challenger to keep an open mind about the Republican nomination for Vice President.

title: Steel Advances Spreading To Other Metal Products
description: The advance in steel prices that began in March and continued through last month has spread to other metal products, such as lead, zinc, aluminum, copper and brass, with a number of companies following suit yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Rutgers University board of governors approved $175 tuition increase for the 197677 academic year for state undergraduates and proportional increases for graduate andoutofstate students. The increase, which is expected to realize $7 million, was included in the $81.4 million allocation to the university passed by the State Legislature last month. The board also accepted from American Express the title to its 17story office building in Newark. The university plans to move its Newark Law School there after renovating the structure at an estimated cost $2.25 million.

title: Port Authority Proposes A Lower Manhattan El
description: A citybacked proposal for a newfangled elevated transit line around lower Manhattan was unveiled at City Hall yeserday.

title: Hospital Strike Gives Officers A Chance to Try Out Old Skills
description: Jerry Sloven was glowing like, an athlete at the peak of his game as he rushed to assist one a pacemaker operation.

title: Environmentalists Fight Plan for Port In Connecticut's Great Salt Meadows
description: STRATFORD, Conn., July 9 Snowy egrets stalk the mudbanks of the Great Salt Meadows here muskrats rustle through the tall cord grass and small boys bunt the shallows for crabs in a hazy summer idyll that has remained substantially anchanged for hundred of years.

title: Wright Enters Race For Chisholm Seat
description: The long political feud between Representative Shirley Chisholm and. Councilman Samuel D. Wright came to a head yesterday when Mr. Wright announced his candidacy for her seat in Congress from Brooklyn's 12th District.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On June 19 and 20, The Times published two news articles about the growing problem of school closings and the unused buildings which result. Thousands of school buildings throughout the country have been abandoned due to decreasing enrollment, population shifts, consolidation and other reasons unrelated to the buildings structural condition. In Pennsylvania, 144 schools were closed between September 1974 and September 1975; 120 are to close this academic year. In New York State, over 200 schools were closed during the last academic year.

title: Norton Fights on TV Today
description: SAN DIEGO, July 9 (AP)Ken Norton will meet Larry Middleton tomorrow afternoon in a nationally televised boxing match that will serve as a tuneup for Norton's heavyweight title fight against Muhammad Ali, the champion on Sept. 28.

title: Dance: By Chuck Davis
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 9The Chuck Davis Dance Company presented on Tuesday evening at the American Dance Festival at Connecticut College, an evening of Africaninspired works that were shaped with one eye on European theater practice and the other on the less formal folk tradition. The combinanon is one that has become familiar through the format devised a decade ago by the first of the touring African companies that began to export some of their national artistic treasure to impressed Western audiences. It tries to preserve the flavor of the original, but to present it in readily comprehensible terms.

title: CHRISTIANS PRESS FIGHT IN LEBANON
