title: Fidrych vs. Jones Tonight: Unusual All Star Matchup
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 12With peace suddenly breaking out on the labor front. professional baseball heaved a sigh of relief tonight and prepared for its 47th AllStar Game.

title: NEW YORK SLOWS POPULATION LOSS, STATISTICS SHOW
description: WASHINGTON, July 12New figures compiled by the Census Bureau suggest strongly, that New York City's precipitous population losses of the last few years may be coming, to an end.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times on July 8 incorrectly identified the president of the Uptown Chamber of Commerce. His name is Lloyd E. Dickens.

title: People in Sports
description: On the golf course, decisions come easy to Judy Rankin.

title: Civil Suit Is Filed, Alleging Negligence In Riverdelt Death
description: The first civil suit growing out of the 13 unusual deaths at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell, N.J., a decade ago was filed yesterday against the hospital by the husband of a woman who died two days after giving birth.

title: G.M. in Radio Battle
description: The General Motors Corporation and many of its bigcity dealers are in a confrontation over whether G. M. or the dealer should supply radios for new cars. Page 49.

title: Robintech to Sell Shintech interest To ShinEtsu Co.
description: Robintech Inc. of Fort Worth announced yesterday that it had agreed to sell its 50 percent interest in Shintech Inc. to the ShinEtsu Chemical Company of Japan. its Danner in Shintech, for an unspecified figure. Robintech menufactures extruded and fabricated tubing.

title: Lewis Deschler, 71, Dies; ExHouse Parliamentarian
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) Lewis Deschler, retired parliamentarian who powerfully influenced the House of Representatives for 46 years, died today at Bethesda Naval Hospital after a series of strokes. He was 71 years old and resided in Bethesda. Md.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Western Division

title: Sports Today
description: AllStar game, at Philadelphia. (Television  Channel 7. 8 P.M.) (RadioW1VICA, 8 P.M.)

title: OHIO REPORT ASSAILS 68 RACERIOT STUDY
description: CINCINNATI, July 12 (UPI) A University of Cincinnati research team today disputed some key findings of the 1968 Kerner Commission study of racial rioting in American cities in the mid1960's

title: Dr. Brooks F. Ellis Is Dead at 78; Headed N.Y.U. Geology Faculty
description: Dr. Brooks F. Ellis, a professor of geology, who led extensive research into the petroleum resources of Long Island Sound, died Sunday at his home in St. Mary's W. Va. He was 73 years old.

title: Cyclist, 61, Killed While on a Trip Around the World
description: BATAVIA, N.Y. July 12 (UPI) William Marquardt set off two months ago on an aroundtheworld bicycle trip to show people a gentler form of travel, than the automobile. Sunday night, his bike was hit by a car and he died instantly.

title: Chess:
description: Nothing comes down with quite the awful crash that accompanies a hypermodern?? that mistires. When you yield the center to your opponent in the hope of crumbling it later, you have to have everything figured out perfectly, for if that center doesn't collapse, it will collapse you.

title: Trehton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 12The State Legislature may take away the $22 millionayear windfall New York is slated to get under New Jersey's income tax law.

title: Raymond W. Lapham, 73; ExHead of Boston Garden
description: SCARBOROUGH. Me., July 12 Raymond W. Lapham, sportsman, philanthropist and former president of the Boston Garden Sports Center, died in his home at Prout's Neck yesterday after a long illness. He was 73 years old.

title: Mrs. Bower, Mrs. Young Tie for TriCounty Medal
White Moderates Cling To Hopes for Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia In a sprawling whitebrick home in a southern suburb of Salisbury, a pregnant woman sat the other night at dinner idly picking over her food.

title: BADILLO BACKED IN REELECTION BID
description: Representative Herman Badillo yesterday won the endorsement of Gov. Rafael Hernandez Colon of Puerto Rico in his campaign for election to a third term from the 21st Congressional District in the Bronx.

title: HOSPITALS UNION WOOS DELEGATES
description: Thousands of striking hospital workers sought to attract help for their cause from Democratic National Convention delegates last night with a rally on 33d Street across from Madison Square Garden.

title: Pact Curbs Hertz, Avis and National
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Federal Trade Commission announced today an agreement with the nation's three biggest automobile rental companies prohibiting them from conspiring to monopolize the business or to fix prices anywhere in the United States.

title: MAURICE TROTTA, A LABOR PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Maurice Trotta, retired professor of industrial relations and business management at the College of Business and Public Administration of New York University, died Sunday in Newton (N.J.) Memorial Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 3 Rocky Terrace, Sparta. N.J.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TIME OUT Starting today in the business sector of lower Manhattan, visitors and office workers can look forward to a midday series of citysponsored entertainments, ranging from ethnic diversions to jazz, ballet and mime theater. The midweek events are scheduled for three sites in the area, with all performances starting at 12:30 P.M. The programs will end on Sept. 22.

title: Rep. Howe's Pleas Denied; Trial Cleared for Monday
description: SALT LAKE CITY, July 12 (AP)A City Court judge today denied defense motions that the sexsolicitation charge against Representive Allan T. Howe be dismissed on grounds of alleged entrapment and misconduct by the prosecution.

title: Mayors Back Carter, But a Woman Is Irked
description: The National Conference of Democratic Mayors lined up behind Jimmy Carter yesterday, but at a news conference stressing unity they forgot to include a woman mayor. And the mayor of La Habra, Calif., did not think much of that.

title: Flood Cleanup Help Asked
description: WALLINGFORD, Vt., July 12 (AP)  Declaring severe flooding in Rutland County an emergency situation, acting Gov. Brian Burns today ordered the Vermont National Guard to bring in troops and equipment to help cleanup operations. Mr. Burns, the Lieutenant Governor, was acting for Gov. Thomas P. Salmon. who was at the Democratic National Convention in New York City.

title: AMEX PRICES UP; OTC ALSO GAINS
description: In moderate trading, stocks moved up on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market. The Amex's market value index closed at 107.05, up 0.48, and the NASDAQ industrial index ended at 98.22, up 0.42.

title: Abbey Theater Joins Bicentennial Fete
description: After an absence of 38 years, the Abbey Theater, Ireland's national theater, will spend six weeks in the United States, beginning Nov. 8, to celebrate the Bicentennial.

title: 180.000 Disabled Veterans Get Insurance Premium Cut
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) About 180,000 disabled veterans, will have their Veterans Administration insurance premiums reduced Oct. 1, the V.A. announced today.

title: Carter Ends Interviews on Running Mate
description: Jinimy Carter completed his interviews with possible running mates yesterday and said he might reach a decision tonight.

title: Bridge:
description: In recent years the competitions of the Metropolitan Commercial Bridge League, open to all business teams, have been dominated in remarkable fashion by the teams of the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company. Earlier this year, the insurance company's competitors won the major title for the fifth time in six years, and their teams won two lesser titles.

title: BRITAIN IS CRITICAL OF ANGOLAN TRIAL
description: LONDON, July 12 (Reuters)  Britain said today that the recent trial of foreign mercenaries in Angola had not been fair and expressed shock and dismay at the execution of four of the convicted men on Saturday.

title: Giants List Available Season Tickets
description: A mail order sale of 12,000 season subscription seats for the Giants new football stadium in Hackensack Meadows was announced yesterday. All the available seats are in endzone locations. Tickets for the sevengame home schedule, which begins on Oct. 12 against the Dallas Cowboys, are priced at $63. Applicants are limited to four tickets.

title: Musical Audiences Differ, But All Listen Con Amore
A Tennis Coach Without a Court
description: DeWitt Willis is a tennis coach who doesn't use a court or balls to practice his profession. All he needs is a racquet, a mirror and a system he calls rhythmetonics. The idea is to learn to play at home, to learn smooth stroking before going out to the court.

title: Why Prices of Soybeans Are Soaring
description: An explosive mixture of unexpected demand, reduced supply and politics has fueled a 50 percent rise in soybean prices in recent weeks and the advance has not yet run its course, according to Middle West market specialists.

title: Service Held for Israelis
description: MONTREAL, July 12Canadian and international Jewry. joined by Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and many other leaders, held a solemn memorial service tonight for the 11 members of the 1972 Israeli Olympic team who were slain by terrorists in Munich four years ago.

title: Yippies Hold a SmokeIn
description: The Youth International Party, better known as the Yippies, held a smokein yesterday in the Central Park band shell, United Press International reported. Police officers scattered about the rim of the demonstration did not arrest anyone, the account said.

title: Adult Amusements: Cars, Carts and a Little Zoo
description: Grownups who are selfconscious about playing with children's toys need have no reservations about toying with the miniature wooden cars, tricycles, windmills, carts and animals that Nick Lecakes makes specifically for this purpose.

title: A10 Fuselage Crack Found
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) The Air Force said today that a small crack had been detected in stress testing of a section of fuselage for the new A10 close support airplane.

title: MRS. NIXON BEGINS EXERCISE THERAPY
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., July 12 (UPI)Pat Nixon has started rehabilitation exercises to help her damaged muscles and may achieve total recovery from her paralyzing stroke, but it will take a long time, her physician reported today.

title: Bill Rates Show Drop At Weekly U.S. Sale
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Seven Killed, Two Injured as Guhman Sprays Shots at College in California
description: LOS ANGELES, July 12 Seven persons were killed and two were seriously injured today when a 37yearold janitor entered the basement of a college library and, methodically going from room to room, opened fire with a 22caliber automatic rifle, the police said.

title: Hot Line Opening Provides Instant Quiz Show: What's My Tax?
description: TRENTON, July 12 New Jersey residents bombarded the Division of Taxation today with questions about the new state income tax and reductions in local property taxes.

title: NATIONAL STRIKE GRIPS AUSTRALIA
description: SYDNEY, Australia, July 12Some two million workers throughout Australia today joined in what was described as the first national strike in the country's history, bringing to a halt all public transport, closing most industrial plants and severely disrupting commercial life in the cities for 24 hours.

title: RESCUE BY ISRAEL ACCLAIMED BY U.S. AT DEBATE IN U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 12 William W. Scranton, the United States chief delegate, told the Security Council today that Israel's recent raid on Uganda to rescue the victims of proPalestinian hijackers was a combination of guts and brains that has seldom if ever been surpassed.

title: PARTY IS UNITED
description: The 37th Democratic National Convention opened last night in Madison Square Garden in a blare of upbeat music accompanied by thunderous attacks on the Republicans.

title: WALTER S. HILBORN, LAWYER, DIES AT 96
description: Walter S. Hilborn, a lawyer who helped establish the Jewish Institute of Religion here and later was active in establishing the Los Angeles campus of what is now the Hebrew Union CollegeJewish Institute of Religion, died Friday in Los Angeles, where he was still practicing law. He was 96 year: of age.

title: Abbott Says It May Sue F.D.A. on Cyclamates
description: Abbott Laboratories said it might sue the Food and Drug Administration if the agency failed to give an impartial hearing to the company's bid to resume marketing cyclamates. Cyclamates, an artificial sweetener used widely in diet beverages, were banned by the F.D.A. in 1969 on the basis of laboratory tests that showed they could cause cancer in test animals.

title: Compromise Reached on Women's Role
description: A negotiating team of leading Democratic feminists won from Jimmy Carter yesterday what they termed acceptable commitments concerning the future role of women in the Democratic Party and in a Carter administration.

title: Big A Race Analyst Has Winning Ways
description: Half an hour before the first race at Aqueduct, Chuck Berndt calmly tells his audience, I've got the race down to one horse.

title: Hanoi Establishes Ties With Manila; Thailand Talks Set
description: HONG KONG, July 12In a major move to improve relations with its Southeast Asian neighbors, newly reunified Vietnam has agreed to establish diplomatic ties with the Philippines and to receive a Thai delegation next month to discuss normalization of relations, it was announced today.

title: Wood, Field & Stream:, Striper Lures
description: MONTAUK, L.I.One of the most exciting ways to catch striped bass is with a surface swimming plug cast from shore or boat.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times on July 8 incorrectly identified the president of the Uptown Chamber of Commerce. His name is Lloyd E. Dickens.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Strong attacks were made on the Republians at the opening of the 37th Democratic National Convention at Madison Square Garden. Robert S. Strauss, the party's national chairman, called for an end to eight years of NixonFord, eight long years of Kissinger, Simon, Morton and Butz. The keynote speeches were delivered by Senator John Glenn of Ohio and Representative Barbara Jordan of Texas. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Schedule of Some Events of Interest for Delegates
description: The following is a tentative schedule of some of the events of interest to convention delecates:?? A.M.Breakfast for Jimmy Carter's mother; Versailles Room, Americana.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Two weaknesses stand out in Governor Carter's otherwise balanced address to the Foreign Policy Association and responses to subsequent questions.

title: Stockton Puts Fisher Out, 62, 62
description: CINCINNATI, July 12 (UPI) Fifthseeded Dick Stockton defeated Rick Fisher of Palo Alto, Calif., 62, 62, today in the opening round of the 89th annual Western tennis championships.

title: Mrs. Harris Testifies LastMinute Decision by Miss Hearst Saved Heiress From Death in Gun Battle
description: LOS ANGELES. July 12A lastminute decision by Patricia Hearst to go along for the ride with William amd Emily Harris on a shopping trip on May 16. 1974, saved her from being killed along with six revolutionaries in a gun battle with policemen 24 hours later, Mrs. Harris said today.

title: Jersey Man Fatally Shot
description: SOUTH AMBOY, N. J., July 12 (UPI) Michael Cavaliaro, 21 years old, of Sayreville died yesterday at South Amboy Memorial Hospital after being shot in the neck early Saturday outside the Edge Cocktail Lounge. The police said the assailant fled on a motorcycle.

title: AMERICAN MOTORS REPORTS A DEFICIT
description: DETROIT, July 12  The American Motors Corporation said today that because of declining small car sales it lost $3.9 million in the quarter ended June 30. It forecast it would also end its current fiscal year on Sept. 30, with a deficit.

title: James Thomas, Economist, Dead in Jacksonville at 97
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., July 12 (UPI)  Dr. James Shelby Thomas, onetime president of Clarkson College in Potsdam, N.Y., and Detroit's Chrysler Institute of Engineering, died at his home here over the weekend. He was 97 years old.

title: Major Nuclear Power Producers Agree To Widen Exchange of Data on Wastes
description: DENVER, July 13Leaders of seven of the world's largest nuclear power development programs decided here today to widen their exchanges of infomtation about final disposal of radioactive wastes in hopes of speeding each nation's decisions on this tonic.

title: Books of The Times
description: The same power that corrupts its user also corrupts those who are used by itthat is the lesson living hands Trudy Letarpo, nee Ellner, formerly Spieger, in the course of Frederic Morton's novel An Unknown Woman. Trudy is not a crushed victim of totalitarian power, but rather of the more alluring brands on the supermarket shelves of the open society.

title: Issues in Hospital Strike
description: PARTIESDistrict 1199, National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees representing 35,000 workers, most of whom are nonprofessionals. Thirtythree hospitals, 27 belonging to the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes of New York. Fourteen nursing homes, including nine belonging to the league. Ten municipal hospitals that have affiliations to voluntary hospitals.

title: La Boheme Set Thursday in Park
description: Puccini's La Boheme will be presented on the Central Park Mall Thursday, at 8 P.M., by the New York Grand Opera Company, with the artistic director, Vincent La Selva, conducting.

title: July 26 Hearing to Weigh Shifts in Potato Futures
description: PRESQUE ISLE, Me., July 12 (AP)The Commodity Eutures Trading Commission announced today it would hold a public hearing here July 26 on proposed changes in the May futures contracts for Maine potatoes.

title: A Film for Democrats
description: The specially produced 16minute film that was supposed to liven things up last night at the opening of the Democratic National Convention didn't.

title: RESCUE BY ISRAEL ACCLAIMED BY U.S. AT DEBATE IN U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 12 William W. Scranton, the United States chief delegate, told the Security Council today that Israel's recent raid on Uganda to rescue the victims of proPalestinian hijackers was a combination of guts and brains that has seldom if ever been surpassed.

title: Sets Overcome Triangles, 2720
description: UNIONDALE, L. L, July 12 The New York Sets broke a threematch losing streak in World Team Tennis tonight, defeating the Pittsburgh Triangles, 2720, before 3,360 at the Nassau Evonne Goolagong beat Billie Jean King, 75, in women's sinbles.

title: Carey and Beame Charge Ford Administration With Causing National Disunity
description: Basking in the glow of national exposure, Governor Carey and Mayor Beame welcomed the Democratic National Convention last night with blistering attacks on the Republican Administration in Washington with which both have Worked closely to resolve New York City's fiscal crisis.

title: Statues on Grand Central Lighted
description: With the flick of a switch by Jacqueline Onassis, the heroic statue of the Greek god Mercury atop Grand Central Terminal was bathed in a beam of light last night for the first time since the terminal was built in 1913. And the flanking statues of Minerva and Hercules were accented by smaller floodlights.

title: Exxon and Texaco Lift Propane Price
description: Exxon U.S.A., domestic subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation, announced yesterday it had raised the price of propane by a half cent a gallon while Texaco Inc. increased it by 1.3 cents a gallon, effective throughout its marketing area.

title: Carter Maps C.I.A. Policy
description: Jimmy Carter said yesterday that he would take personal responsibility for the actions of the Central Intelligence Agency if he were elected president, United Press International reported. He also indicated that he might reorganize intelligence agencies. I think that we need a good, competent intelligence network, Mr. Carter said. We now have, I think, seven different agencies. I think that's too many to be deriving information from.

title: OLIVER P. ALFORD, 75, EXFOOTBALL COACH
description: MIAMI, July 12 (UPI)Oliver Perry Alford, a former football coach at Princeton University and the University of Kentucky, died yesterday in a suburban Coral Gables hospital. He was 75 years of age.

title: A Lot of Democrats Out There
description: This city is full of smiling Democrats, eating peanuts and trying to guess who'll get the No. 2 spot on the Carter ticket. Unity is thicker than the humidity and almost as oppressive, and no one would be much surprised if the band played Hail to the Chief just before Jimmy Carter's acceptance speech.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2 No Title

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Ford Motor Company announced yesterday that it would begin a multimilliondollar improvement of its vast Rouge industrial complex in Michigan in Septemher. The company, whose headquarters is in Dearborn. Mich. declined to disclose the exact amount that will be spent on the project.

title: CIVIL SUIT FILED IN CURARE CASE
description: The first civil suit growing out of the 13 unusual deaths Riverdell Hospital in Oradell, N.J., a decade ago was filed yesterday against the hospital by the husband of a woman who died two days after giving birth.

title: John H. Forsman, 81. Dies; Retired Printing Executive
description: John H. Forsrnan, a retired printing industry executive and a prominent amateur golfer, died yesterday at Stamford Hospital, Stamford, Conn. He was 81 years old and a resident of the New York Athletic Club, 180 Central Park South.

title: LEBANON RIGHTISTS AT EDGE OF TRIPOLI
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 12Rightwing Christian forces advancing in northern Lebanon were reported today to have reached the southern outskirts of leftistheld Tripoli, the nation's second largest city.

title: Library, Once a Schoolhouse, Then a Jail, Is Given a New Look
description: MONTVILLE TOWNSHIP This Morris County community's library, a former tworoom schoolhouse and onetime jail, has added 2,400 square feet with $45,000 and the use of five connecting trailers.

title: Making a Bed of Thorns
description: Jimmy Carter has gone about the VicePresidential business the wrong way so far. First of all, there was that idea for calling several of the more elegant Democratic Senators to sit for job interviews. It made splashy headlines during an otherwise dull period in the news from Georgia. Too splashy.

title: Search for Quake Dead Goes On in New Guinea
description: BIME, Indonesia, July 12 (Reuters)  Mothers with babies strapped to their backs were hacking away at a bloodstained pile of mud at this settlement in West New Guinea, which bore the full brunt of a devastating earthquake on June 28.

title: Closed Court Weighs Change in Rubin Carter's Bail
description: PATERSON, N.J., July 12A closed court hearing ended here today for Rubin (Hurricane) Carter with a Passaic County judge announcing that he would rule before the end of the week on whether to revoke or increase Mr. Carter's $20,000 bail.

title: Advertising
description: Publishers of magazines for male homosexuals, heartened by steady circulation growth, are looking at national advertisers with varying degrees of optimismor pessimism.

title: Pepsi Extends Challenge to Coke
description: PepsiCola yesterday extended its Pepsi Challenge advertising to New York and Los Angeles, bolstering it with independent national research that alleges to show more CocaCola drinkers prefer the taste of PepsiCola than the taste of CocaCola.

title: The Destroyer From Fosteryille
description: His name is George Foster, a gentle name that shelters the notoriety he deserves. Of all the hitters in tonight's AllStar Game, George Foster of the Cincinnati Reds has been the most productive in the triple crown categories this season. He leads the major leagues with 72 runs batted in. He shares fourth in the major leagues with 17 home runs. He's the National League's sixth leading batter with a 327 average. He's not unappreciated. Except for Greg Luzinski of the Philadelphia Phillies, he received more votes in the fans AllStar ballot than any other National League outfielder. But his name is George Foster, a gentle name for a gentle personality. He's the Reds left fielder but he'll he in center field tonight because Greg Luzinski and Dave Kingman are the other starting outfielders. Greg Luzinskithat's a name that doesn't need a nickname. Greg Luzinski sounds big. So does Dave Kingman, whose 30 homers have inspired such nicknames as Kong and Sky King, nicknames a baseball fan can identify with. But for all his accomplishments this season, George Foster hasn't had a nickname. Until now.

title: Political Satirists Descend On Convention City Clubs; View Leaders With Alarm
description: Just in time to counter the Democratic National Convention, political satirists have descended on New York. While the delegates convene at Madison Square Garden, comedians are practicing their craft in their own arenas clubs and cabarets all over town.

description: BATAVIA, N.Y. July 12 (UPI) William Marquardt set off two months ago on an aroundheworld bicycle trip to show people a gentler form of travel than the automobile. Sunday night, his bike was hit by a Dar and he died instantly.
