title: Head of Harlem Project Resigns in Control Dispute
description: Jack E. Wood Jr., president of the Harlem Urban Development Corporation since it was established five years ago, has submitted his resignation in a dispute over how deeply the board of directors should be involved in the administration of the agency.

title: 8 Attica Guards and One Inmate Hurt In FlareUp Over Routine Cell Search
description: ATTICA, N.Y., July 12 (AP)Attica prison, where the quelling of revolt in 1971 left 43 people dead, was under tight security today following new violence that injured eight guards and one prisoner.

title: Issues in Hospital Strike
description: PARTIESDistrict 1199, National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees representing 35.000 workers, most of whom are nonprofessionals. Thirtythree hospitals, 27 belonging to the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes of New York. Fourteen nursing homes, including nine belonging to the league. Ten municipal hospitals that have affiliations to voluntary hospitals.

title: DORA BURLING ROESCH
description: Dora Burling Roesch, who was active in Methodist affairs, died Saturday at her home in Huntington Bay, L. I. She was 88 years Old.

title: Ford Shifts and Expands Press Staff
description: WASHINGTON, July 12President Ford, reportedly concerned that he is suffering politically because his accomplishments have not been adequately communicated to the public, reshuffled his public information staff today in an effort to strengthen it.

title: Loch Ness Expedition, Switching Tactics, to Try Sonar Gear to Find Monster
description: DRUMNADROCHIT, Scotland. July 7After many weeks of fruit less searching, the scientists here have switched their emphasis from underwater ?? tography to sonar research in an effort to explain the legendary phenomenon known as the Loch Ness monster.

title: Helping New York
description: Joyce Dukes, a 22yearold native of Memphis, is spending her first summer in New York City, teaching creative writing to youths in Harlem at the United Block Association, 68 East 131st Street.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Strong attacks were made on the Republicans at the opening of the 37th Democratic National Convention at Madison Square Garden. Robert S. Strauss, the party's national chairman, called for an end to eight years of NixonFord, eight long years of Kissinger, Simon, Morton and Butz. The keynote speeches were delivered by Senator John Glenn of Ohio and Representative Barbara Jordan of Texas. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: An Assemblyman Accuses Carey of Hiding Surplus
description: ALBANY, July 12The state Assembly's Republican leader on financial issues accused Governor Carey today of manipulating state revenue figures and of trying to conceal a revenue surplus that could reach $140 million by the end of the year.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3 No Title

title: Jane Futures Trading Shows a 62% Climb
description: The Futures Industry Association announced yesterday that trading in commodity futures contracts in June soared 62 percent above the level of June 1975. Last May, the volume was 23.5 percent above the like 1975 month.

title: 10 WIN FELLOWSHIPS IN ECONOMIC NEWS
description: Columbia University named 10 journalists yesterday to be Walter Bagehot fellows in business and economic reporting at its Graduate School of Journalism. They will begin nine months of tuitionfree studies in September and also receive $13,500 each

title: G.M. IN A DISPUTE OVER CAR RADIOS
description: ?? July 12 (AP)The General Motors Corporation and many of its bigcity dealers are engaged in a growing confrontation over whether the manufacturer or the dealer should supply radios for new G.M. cars.

title: Miss Walters in Limbo for Conventions
description: Barbara Walters will be the only member of a network news anchor team not taking part in the coverage of either the Democratic or Republican National Conventions. This is because she is in contractual limbo until her present contract with NBC ends and her new one with ABC begins on Sept. 9. She will, however, be an observer at both convention sites from the A.B.C. News hospitality booth.

title: MARION MAILLER, 69, A VASSAR TRUSTEE
description: Marion MacKenzie Mailler, a former trustee of Vassar College, died on Sunday in the Cornwall (N. Y.) Hospital, of which she was the first woman trustee. The widow of Lee B. Mailler, who was Republican majority leader in the State Assembly, she was 69 years old and lived at 16 Grandview Avenue, CornwallonHudson.

title: Israelis Say Raider Impersonated Amin
description: JERUSALEM, July 12The Israeli units that rescued hijacking hostages from the Entebbe airport a week ago took with them a Mercedes limousine carrying an Israeli officer with blackened face impersonating President Idi Amin of Uganda and two LandRovers full of men dressed as Palestinian bodyguards, according to Israeli sources.

title: Black Woman Keynoter
description: The thunderous reception that Representative Barbara Jordan received last night at the Democratic National Convention was the final proof. She is, no doubt, a hero of the party. Throughout the convention floorin the Ohio section and the Mississippi section and, especially, in the Texas sectionthey rose and cheered when she walked onto the podium.

title: Aid Is Cut, but Tourism Crests at U.S. Parks
description: YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK, Wyo., July 10Old Faithful was right on time at 1:10 P.M. today. But the Michauds of Magrath, Alberta, were late.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The owners of a 51unit a partment house at 8320 Ray Parkway in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn have filed a multimilliondollar lawsuit against Assemblyman Frank J. Barbaro, DemocratLiberal of Brooklyn, and two residents, charging them with sponsoring a rent strike, now 19 months old. In papers submitted in Federal Court in Brooklyn. the plaintiffs, the Tevax Realty Corporation and its president, Edward M. Bassett, charged the Assemblyman with using his position in Albany to get a half dozen adjournments of the rent strike case in Landlord Tenant Court. They also charged Mr. Barbaro with withholding rents, thus imperiling Tevax's continued ownership of the building. The Assemblyman said that the lawsuit was a form of intimidation and that he would continue to fight for decent housing for his constituents.

title: International Paper Lists Record Sales And Net in Quarter
Janet Laib Married To James Byrnes Jr.
description: Janet Laib Amgott, daughter of Mrs. Isadore Levin of Palm Beach Fla., and Fast Hampton, L.I., and the late Walter Laib, was married yesterday afternoon, to James W. Byrnes Jr., son of Mrs. Martin Kinsella of Newport, R.L. and the late Mr. Byrnes.

title: Lake Havasu Land Improprieties Are Denied
description: LOS. ANGELES, July 12The chief executive of a Los Angeles. oil and land development company said today that there had been no improprieties in the company's acquisition of 12,990 acres of land for a new town on the CaliforniaArizona border.

title: Great Quadrennial Cry: Please Clear the Aisles
description: At 8:52 o'clock last night, the Democrats heard for the first time in the 1976 convention what most Americans recognize as the great quadrennial rallying cry of American national politics: Will the delegates please clear the aisles?

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI)Americans earn more and own more than ever before in their 200year history, according to the Department of Commerce.

title: Aid Is Cut, but Tourism Crests at U.S. Parks
description: YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK, Wyo., July 10Old Faithful was right on time at 1:10 P.M. today. But the Michauds of Magrath, Alberta, were late.

title: Market Place
description: In a May prospectus filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and riddled with warnings, Milton Gordon, a 68yearold Boston broker, describes his socalled down  and  out option, a speculation that combines the excitement of a Dutch auction with ?? of the betting window at Belmont.

title: Luke L. Benz, 77, Active In Investment Management
description: Luke L. Benz, president of Bradley Gammons & Company, an investment management concern, and Economic Research Inc., died Sunday at his home. 25 Mead Road, Armonk, N.Y. He was 77 years old.

title: Broken Wrist Won't Stop Olympian
description: PLATTSBURG, N.Y., July 12Miguel (Mike) Roche may not reach the final of the Olympic 3,000 meter steeplechase, but he seems sure to set an Olympic record. He may become the only man ever to run an Olympic steeplechase with a broken wrist.

title: Union Support Foreseen
description: Leonard Woodcock, president of the United Automobile Workers, predicted yesterday that unions would join to support Jimmy Carter with the greatest united labor effort that this country has ever seen. Mr. Woodcock made the prediction at a caucus of some 550 Democratic National Convention delegates, all of them members of nine liberal unions that formed a coalition two years ago to revive labor's process.

title: Chrysler Workers End Strike Over Health. Safety Issues
description: TRENTON, Mich., July 12 (AP)Autoworkers at a Chrysler Corporation engine plant returned to work today, ending a fiveday strike that had curtailed production at three car assembly plants.

title: Stocks Rise to a High
description: The stock market closed yesterday at its highest level in 41 months as the Dow Jones industrial average reached 1,011.21, up 8.10. Analysts attributed the increase to the continuing economic recovery. Page 47.

title: CHARLES J. MOLINARO
description: Charles J. Molinaro, an advertising executive, died of cancer Saturday at Clara Maass. Memorial Hospital, Belleville, N. J. He was 39 years old and a resident of East Orange, N. J.

title: The Cost Is Not Peanuts
description: What may be the most expensive peanuts in the world went on sale here yesterday. They cost a dollar each, in the shell, Reuters reported. Each was attached to a white cardboard square and has billed as the authentic plasticcoated peanut from Georgia. The socalled Carter peanut pin also included a tiny map of Jimmy Carter's home state, with the peanut stuck in the middle.

title: Loses a Free Press
description: President Echeverria's term has only a few more months to go; but his Government has just taken a fateful step whose consequences could be felt long after he is out of office. That step is the silencing of the most important independent journalistic voice of Mexico, the newspaper Excelsior. The paper itself continues to appear; but all that made it fresh, interesting and valuable in a democratic society has vanished to be replaced by conformist attitudes that would never have had a chance in the previous, genuine Excelsior.

title: Despite Strauss's Vow, Convention Opens Late
description: Robert S. Strauss, chairman of the National Democratic Committee, had pledged that the party's 37th national convention would run strictly according to schedule. But like every other part convention, it got started late, United Press International reported.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Englewood Hospital's administrator, James Buffington, said that Ann Twomey, the nurse who refused to wear her nursing cap, remains under suspension. The 26yearold nurse, who had charged the hospital with discrimination, contending that male nurses were not required to wear caps, could not be reached for comment.

title: Political Satirists Descend On Convention City Clubs; View Leaders With Alarm
description: Just in time to counter the Democratic National Convention, political satirists have descended on New York. While the delegates convene at Madison Square Garden, comedians are practicing their craft in their own arenas  clubs and cabarets all over town.

title: MRS. BIRCH DEAD, BRITAIN BELIEVES
description: LONDON, July 12  The British Government said today that there was little doubt that Dora Bloch, the 75yearold hijacking hostage who disap peared in Uganda, was dead.

title: New Baseball Contract Limits Reserve System
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 12Baseball's owners and players reached agreement today on a fouryear pact that for the first time gives the players freedom of movement.

title: Boris Y. Butoma Dies at 69; Soviet Shipbuilding Chief
description: MOSCOW, July 12 (Reuters)  Boris Y. Butoma, Soviet Minister of the Shipbuilding Industry, died yesterday, aged 69.

title: TV: Trying to Pin Tail on the Donkey
description: This month G. P. Putnam will publish a statistical study called The Unseen Eye: The Myth of Television Power in National Elections. During the 1972 campaigns, Thomas E. Patterson and Robert D. McClure, political scientists at Syracuse University, conducted more than 2,000 voter interviews in the Syracuse area. Their key conclusion: Television's only effect on the American voter is to cheapen his conception of the campaign process and to stuff his head full of nonsense and trivia.

title: JOAN MACK DEAD; AIDED CHANNEL 13
description: Joan Mack, principal fund raiser for WNET/Channel 13's public television productions, died of cancer on Sunday at her home in East Hampton, L.I. She was 46 years old.

title: Hanoi Establishes Ties With Manila; Thailand Talks Set
description: HONG KONG, July 12In a major move to improve relations with its Southeast Asian neighbors, newly reunified Vietnam has agreed to establish diplomatic ties with the Philippines and to receive a Thai delegation next month to discuss normalization of relations, it was announced today.

title: Ford Approves Bill Allotting $10 Billion To Energy Projects
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) President Ford signed today a $9.7 billion appropriation bill for energy research and for hundreds of water and power projects across the country.

title: ln Memoriam
description: TAXINRose, Sadly missed, lovingly renumbered. Al, Gerald and Robert.

title: Symbol of Constancy in Changing City
description: Stock markets have soared and crashed, mayors and Wall Street magnates have come and gone, trolley cars have vanished and a forest of great skyscrapers has risen all around.

title: American Landowner Dies In Brazil After Gunfight
description: BELEM, Brazil, July 12 (AP) John Weaver Davis, an American landowner wounded last week in a gunfight with Brazilian farmers, died today in a Belem hospital.

title: The Program for Today
description: Following are highlights from the tentative program for the Democratic National Convention today:

title: 2 Germanys Shift Section of Border Under Lignite Pact
description: HELMSTEDT, West Germany,  Along a short stretch of the border just south of here the East Germans have begun to dismantle the land mines they planted and to remove other border fortifications they had set up to seal off their territory.

title: Israelis Say Raider Impersonated Amin
description: JERUSALEM, July 12The Israeli units that rescued hijacking hostages from the Entebbe airport a week ago took with them a Mercedes limousine carrying an Israeli officer wan macitenea Tate impersonating President Idi Amin of Uganda and two LandRovers full of men dressed as Palestinian bodyguards, according to Israeli sources.

title: Choice of Convention Speaker Often Way For Repaying Debt or Rewarding Friend
description: The speaking program at a national party convention, widely regarded by the uninitiated as haphazard filler that separates occasional news events, actually represents a carefully structured system of paying off old political debts, rewarding friends and creating potential leverage beyond the Presidential election.

title: When the Cold Winds Begin to Blow Hoods Within Hoods
description: Hatsserious hats, that isaren't warming up in the wings, ready to launch a fresh assault on fashion in the fall. Still, there will be little need for cars to get cold. Practically every designer, from the stolid to the wild. has taken to hoods, in one of those rare gestures agreement that sweep the fashion world from time to time.

title: 26 Family Agencies Get a New Home
description: With little fanfare, and almost no publicity, the city yesterday opened a 12story $29 million building that will house the Family Court and various agencies that deal with it.

title: Helping New York
description: Joyce Dukes, a 22yearold native of Memphis, is spending her first summer in New York City, teaching creative writing to youths in Harlem at the United Block Associaion, 68 East 131st Street.

title: DEMOCRATS MEET, STRAUSS ASKS AN END OF YEARS OF NIXONFORD BEAME AND CAREY JOIN IN ATTACK
description: DEMOCRATS MEET

title: Carter Makes Peace With Black Leaders and Renews Pledge of HighLevel Jobs
description: Jimmy Carter made peace yesterday with a group of 30 black Democrats that included several who had bitterly opposed him up to the meeting.

title: Rain, Floods and Landslides Kill 9 in Japan and Isolate Thousands
description: TOKYO, July 12Up to 22 inches of rain in recent hours have caused floods and scores of landslides that have isolated thousands of residents and tourists in the historic Izu Peninsula near here.

title: A Bitter Debate Forecast Over Games Issue
description: MONTREAL, July 12Lastditch efforts to keep Taiwan in the Olympic Games began taking shape today on a broad political front.

title: Women Pilots Come In for a LandingPerhaps the Lastin CoasttoCoast Powder Puff Derby
description: WILMINGTON, Del., July 12You do travel light, said 34yearold Trina Jarish, a bit blearyeyed after 2,929 solo miles at the controls of a Beechcraft Bonanza.

title: West Affirms Oil Import Needs
description: PARIS, July 12 The figures were buried in a recent speech of Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, but they point up a shift in thinking that has already had significant implications

title: U.S. Attorney to Control Crime Force in Newark
description: NEWARK, July 12  The Federal Department of Justice gave the United States Attorney's office to New Jersey today control over the Newark Organized Crime Strike Force, signaling a new direction forl an experiment that began nearIv a decade ago.

title: Jersey to Hear Sinatra Aug. 25, 26
description: Frank Sinatra will sing in two special performances, Aug. 25 and 26, at the Garden State Arts Center in Holmdel, N.J., according to Robert J. Jablonski, vice chairman of the New Jersey Highway Authority, which operates the center. Ticket sales for the performances will be by mail order only.

title: Jeffrey L. Lazarus Sr.; Headed Department Store
description: Jeffrey L. Lazarus Sr., honorary chairman and former president of Shillito's Department Store in Cincinnati, died there on Friday at the age of 82.

title: Mrs. Neff Leads Sail
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 13Mrs. W. Perry Neff of the SeawanhakaCorinthian Yacht Club, Oyster Bay, L.I., won all three races on Long Island Sound off Indian Harbor Yacht Club today to hold a 3point lead in the Syce Cup regatta.

title: Capote Gets $165 Fine, Seat in Driving School
description: k Truman Capote, the writer, was fined $165 yesterday and ordered to attend a rehabilitation program for intoxicated drivers run by the State Department of Motor Vehicles as a result of his arrest May 30 by the state police after a twocar accident near his Bridgehampton, L.I. home. Justice Mercator Kendrick of Southampton tined Mr. Capote $150 for drunken driving and $15 for crossing a double line.

title: 3 Working Welfare Mothers Describe How Red Tape Is Costing Them Pay
description: What happens if a mother on welfare gets a job? Three working welfare clients said yesterday they had to give up many days on the job, losing pay each time, to go the centers to answer questions about their cases, often oily to clear up administrative errors.

title: Indefinite Layoffs Set For 1,100 at A.M.C.
description: DETROIT, July 13 The American Motors Corporation said today it would lay off indefinitely 1,100 of the 13,000 workers now on temporary layoff because of heavy stocks of unsold cars.

title: Militants Lose in Battle To Require Equal Role
description: After two hours of impassioned and often angry debate, the women's caucus voted yesterday to accept the compromise language that would commit the Democratic Party to promote, rather than require, equal representation of women in 1978 and thereafter.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times yesterday about a Federal Trade Commission agreement with three car rental companies incorrectly stated that they had agreed that auto makers would no longer partly pay for rental company advertising. In addition, the commission did not charge that the companies had bid collusively on the percentage of rental revenues to be paid to airport operators.

title: Shadow Stalks Again, This Time for Gillette
description: Fans of dear old Lamont Cranston who know what evil lurks in the hearts of men will instantly get the drift of a new Gillette Trac II commercial by Benton & Bowles that will run on all three networks.

title: Eight Are Arrested by U.S. For Manufacturing Drugs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 13 (UPI)The Federal Drug Enforcement Agency has arrested eight persons it said were part of a multimilliondollar drug ring.

title: Market Basket: City's Food Prices Drop Slightly
description: Food prices dropped slightly last week in New York City, according to a survey of 150 supermarkets and other food stores by the City Department of Consumer Affairs, but substantial seasonal reductions have started in the cost of fruits and vegetables.

title: Woman Is Killed and 24 Are Hurt in Train. Crash in New Canaan
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., July 13One woman was killed, another was critically injured and 23 other commuters were hurt this evening when a crowded rushhour train slammed into the rear of another train standing on the tracks just yards from the railroad station here.

title: Big Board Asks S.E.C. To Keep OffFloor Ban
description: The New York Stock Exchange rules that bar member firms from crossing customers my ana sell orders away from the trading floor should be continued, the exchange has told the Securities and Exchange Commission. In a cross transaction, one brokerage firm handles both ends of the trade.

title: LongHaul Trucker Buys Block For a Terminal in West Village
description: Yellow Freight System Inc., a Kansasbased trucking company, bought a block of land in lower Manhattan for $1.5 million yesterday to establish a new terminal that could make a major contribution toward easing traffic congestion in New York's loft and factory districts.

title: Handbags That Really Aren't
description: Not too long ago, a wellknown designer introduced evening bags that were too attractive to confine to the dark interior of closet or drawer when not in use. They were conceived to double as table ornaments, and a surprising number of them ended up that way.

title: Nearby Golf Results
description: Nearby Golf Results

title: Texans, New Yorkers Hitting It Off at Last
description: Deep in the heart of Manhattan, Texans and New Yorkers are mysteriously saying nice things about one another this week.

title: Big Board Seat Price Off
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday the sale of a seat at $80,000, down 85,000 from the previous sale of June 24. Seats are now quoted at $65,000 bid $88,000 asked.

title: Mars Landing Set For Next Tuesday For Viking Robot
description: PASADENA, Calif., July 13 (AP)  America's unmanned landing on Mars will be attempted next Tuesday in a low, dry basin, the officials of the mission said today after weeks of searching for a safe landing site.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 13Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel is not entitled to be paid for the eight months that he was on leave of absence to be tried on criminal charges in late 1974 and early 1975, State Attorney General William F. Hyland ruled today.

title: TRADING IN WHEAT AND CORN IS SLACK
description: Despite the prospect of a record corn crop and the second biggest wheat crop, futures contracts for both grains showed little activity yesterday.

title: Dome of Florence Cathedral Is in Peril
description: FLORENCE, Italy, July 13, (Reuters)Large cracks have Appeared in the great dome of the cathedral here, one of the architectural masterpieces of the Renaissance. with the flow of tourist traffic around the building being blamed.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: The New York Times/Barton Silverman

title: DOW IS DOWN 5.15 IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: The stock market shrugged off a spate of profit taking yesterday and closed almost unchanged in fairly heavy trading after posting a 41month high on Monday.

title: Recipient of Second Heart Is Dead in South Africa
description: CAPE TOWN, July 13 (AP)A man who had a second heart implanted next to his own two months ago has died at Ornate Schuur Hospital here, hospital officials said.

title: Prices of Stocks Retreat on Amex; OTC Also Down
description: After a strong start, prices ion the American Stock Exchange retreated yesterday and the market value index was 106.94, off 0.11 at the close. At the same time stocks in the overthecounter market dosed at 98.07, off 0.15, as measured

title: Advertising
description: Many people in advertising agree with Norman R. Glenn, publisher of Media Decisions, an advertising trade magazine that the most difficult national advertising program to Plan is one using newspapers.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The New York Times/July 14 1976

title: About New York
description: Like Like any other young conventiongoing couple from the country determined to live it up during five days in the Big Apple, Jack and Judy Carter and several of their friends spent yesterday afternoon steaming around Manhattan Island on a Circle Line boat.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Moray rates for Tuesday.

title: Jersey P. U. C. Disagrees on Rate To Benefit LowIncome Users
description: NEWARK, July 13The State Board of Public Utility Commissioners deadlocked today over the idea of designing electric rates to benefit lowincome users and then compromised by approving a new flatrate structure for residential customers of the Jersey Central Power and Light Company.

title: 12 Countries Conclude Secret Meetin in Paris on Possible Exploitation of Antarctic Minerals After 1989
description: PARIS, July 12Twelve countries have just concluded a secret meeting here on possible exploitation of Antarctica's mineral resources after 1989. The 12 agreed in 1959 to suspend territorial claims for 30 years so the continent could be reserved for scientific research.

title: ExChief of Grain Concern Is Indicted for Conspiracy
description: NEW ORLEANS. July 13A former chief operating executive of an Italianowned grain company was indicted by a Federal grand jury here today on changes of stealing grain from foreign customers for the benefit of the company.

title: Ethyl Antiknock Mix Price Raised 1c to 1.8c a Pound
description: The Ethyl Corporation announced yesterday that it was increasing domestic prices of all standard mixes of antiknock compounds t cent to 1.8 cents a, pound, effective Aug. 13 Prices will range from 63.30 cents to 65.63 cents a pound. ?? increases were made by the Du Pont Company last week.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN BOND MARKETS
Owners To Digest New Pact
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 13Owners approval of the fouryear agreement with the players most likely won't come tomorrow, as expected, a number of baseball club owners indicated today.

title: ETHIOPIAN REGIME PUTS 18 TO DEATH, CHARGES PLOTTING
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 13The Ethiopian radio announced today that 18 military leaders and merchants, including the thirdranking member of the ruling Provisional Military Administrative Council, had been executed for crimes ranging from plotting a coup to food hoarding.

title: Kennecott Pushes. A Deal for Peabody
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation announced yesterday that it was intensifying its efforts to sell 20 percent of its subsidiary, the Peabody Coal Company, and spin off the rest to Kennecott

title: THREESTATE STRIKE HITS WESTINGHOUSE
description: PITTSBURGH. July 13 (AP)Westinghouse Electric Corporation plants in three states were shut down today by locals of two major unions that the company says agreed not to strike while bargaining for a new national contract continues.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Major League Baseball

title: Jet Rookies Are Outplayed In Scrimmage Against Giants
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.L. July 13 It's only a scrimmage boys. Coach Lou Holtz told his eager Jets' rookies today. Don't think of them as Giants. Think of them as your teammates, or as Podunk.

title: U.S. Women's Five Bows to Male Stars
description: PLATTSBURGH, N.Y., July 13 (UPI)Joe Cardnay scored 20 points to lead a male squad of Northern New York State collegiate and high school allstars to victory over the United States Olymple women's basketball team, 9489.

title: Syrian Tank Unit Enters Lebanese Moslem Center
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 13A tank column of the Syrian Army today entered the city of Baalbek, one of the largest Moslem centers in Lebanon and famous as a site of Roman ruins.

title: Hospital Strike in 1973 Different From This One
description: A bitter strike against private nonprofit hospitals in New York City three years ago was brought to an end in its eighth day. Now, with more hospitals organized by District 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees, an even broader strike is passing its eighth day with no settlement in sight and markedly fewer constraints in place to bring about its end.

title: POTATO DEFAULTS DRAW HUGE FINES
description: Penalties of $2.67 million were announced yesterday with regard to the 1,000 defaulted potato futures contracts. The Penalty, $2,665 for each contract, was assessed by the clearing house committee of the New York Mercantile Exchange and must still be approved by the board of the governors of the exchange. The default was the most massive on the exchange and has had wide repercussions.

title: Taiwan Case Still Unsolved; Compromise Plan Is Offered
description: MONTREAL. July 13Taiwanese officials were considering tonight a compromise plan under which their athletes would compete in the Olympic Games as representatives of a nameless country.

title: Monday's Fight
description: SANTO DONINGO, Dominican RepublicAdriano Marrero, Dominican Republic outpointed Carlos Gimincz. Argentina, 10 rounds, junior welterweighis.

title: 3 Missing in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 13 (Reuters)Three South American exiles on a hunger strike here were reported missing today and were believed to have been kidnapped. The two Chileans and a Uruguayan woman had not been seein since they picked up medicine from a United Nations office yesterday for more than 50 fellow hunger strikers. The refugees are demanding that they be flown to another country because they fear for their lives in Argentina.

title: TractorTrailer Kills 4
description: WAYNESVILLE, N.C., July 13 (AP)Four men were killed today when a tractortrailer rig swerved off Interstate 40 and smashed through a group of farm workers standing beside a stalled pickup truck.

title: in Carter's Image
description: The foreign policy and defense planks in the Democratic platform were also fashioned in the cautious, middleoftheroad image of the party's standardbearer.

title: Martin Bear Is Back, With Advice for Carter
description: The name Martin Beer became a household word for nine minutes in August 1975 after the OpEd page learned that a collection of his letters to famous politicians it had published was a hoax. Nineyearold Martin, it turned out, was the fictitious creation of a New York lawyer, Thomas C. Hauser, who termed the letters legitimate political satire. Wondering whether Martin, still nine and a veteran of this year'S Presidential primaries, remained political, we asked his. uncle, Mr. Hauser, if Martin had something new to say. He didin the following open letter.

title: JAPAN, TO AID YEN, IS BUYING DOLLARS
description: TOKYO, July 13 (Reuters)The Bank of Japan today bought between $50 million and $70 million to stem a rise in the yen, banking sources said. One source put the purchases as high as $100 million.

title: Anderson Beaten In Tennis, 64, 64
description: WATERVILLE VALLEY, N.H., July 13 (UPI)Keith Richardson of Rock Hill, S.C., upset topseeded Mal Anderson, 64, 64, in the second round of the American Express Challengers tennis tournament today. Anderson is the former Australian Davis Cup star.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Times yesterday about a Federal Trade Commission agreement with three car rental companies incorrectly stated that they had agreed that auto makers would no longer partly pay for rental company advertising. In addition, the commission did not charge that the companies had bid collusively on the percentage of rental revenues to be paid to airport operators.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LEGACY Most of the 14 features in the David O. Selznick Film Festival beginning today are viewable on television, with the producer's blockbuster, Gone With the Wind, one of the most eagerly anticipated homescreen events this fall.

title: Beame Approves Raises for Officials
description: Brushing aside the possibility; of criticism, Mayor Beame yesterday approved salary increases for his agency heads,; commissioners, toplevel deputies and some 3.600 managementlevel city employees he said might leave their jobs without the raises.

title: Longer Crude Oil Price Freeze Expected
description: WASHINGTON, July 13The Federal Energy Administration expects to extend its JulyAugust freeze on domestic crude oil prices through September and possibly through October, official sources reported today.

title: HOSPITAL TALKS AT A STANDSTILL
description: Talks to end the weekold hospital workers strike remained at a standstill yesterday as added pressure was brought on the League of Voluntary Hospitals to submit the dispute to binding arbitration.

title: Dance: Ballet Theater Gala Awash W ith Novelty and Highlights
description: Over the last few years, American Ballet 7 heater has made a specialty of the gala program, where all manner of glamorous, and sometimes not quite so glamorous, dancers turn up in a program of handsome bits and surprisinn nieces

title: Leslie Takes Lead on 70
description: CHATHAM TOWNSHIP, N.J. July 13Gordon Leslie, a 31yearold Navesink pro, took the firstround lead today with a 70 in the New Jersey State Professional Golfers Association championship at the Fairmount Country Club.

title: Democratic Consensus
description: The platform that the Democratic delegates ?? in Madison Square Garden last night expressed a broad party consensus that has emerged in their eight years of frustration during the Nixon and Ford Administrations. Democrats during this period have had working majorities in both houses of Congress, particularly in the last two years, but they have been effectively stymied on domestic issues by the power of the Presidential veto.

title: HARRIS WITNESS RECALLS SHOOTING
description: LOS ANGELES, July 13The owner of a sporting goods store here led off the prosecution's case in the William and Emily Harris trial today by describing Patricia Hearst as a strange looking person whose wild shooting nearly killed him and the revolutionary couple 26 months ago.

title: O. J. Not Interested In New York Trade
description: Although the New York Jets yesterday told the Buffalo Bills they were interested in O.J. Simpson, the great running back said by telephone from Los Angeles last night, I'm committed to being out here on the West Coast.

title: Convention. Draws Smaller Audience Than Other Shows
description: About 70 million viewers watched all or part of the Democratic National Convention on television Monday night, according to projections by NBC Research from overnight ratings in New York and Los Angeles.

title: A Skilled Cook
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J.May Wong Trent was born in Hong Kong, the daughter of a welltodo eye surgeon who, at the age of 85, still teaches. As a child, Mrs. Trent noted, she  with youthful defiance  spent most of her time in the kitchen.

title: TV: Media Clutter Mars Coverage of Convention
description: There is very little wrong with the average political convention that might not be cured by the removal of an infectious phenomenon called media clutter. The sheer quantity of coverage, the competition for color fillers (the oldest delegate, the kinkiest bystander, and so on), has become staggering. The public may be well served, of course, but in the case of television, what you see is not what you think you are seeing.

title: A BELLY DANCER LOSES LIBEL SUIT
description: A professional belly dancer is a public figure when it comes to trying to collect libel damages, the State Court of Appeals ruled yesterday. In dis missing a libel suit brought by Samantha James against The Rochester Democrat & Chronicle, the court said that by her purposeful activity, she thrust herself into the public spotlight: and sought a continuing public interest in her activities.

title: WIDE SPECULATION Candidate Is Boiling Down in His Mind a Final Selection
description: Jimmy Carter said last night he was obviously in the process of boiling down in my mind his final selection of a running mate, but stressed that he had not told even his closest advisers who is preeminent in my mind.

title: Some Notables Gathered Moss At a Chic Bash
description: Some wags described it as the season's dandiest block party. Others said that it had been like trying to storm the Bastille. Celebrities were left out at the curb, milling around like part of a Cecil B. DeMille mob scene, unable to get inside to attend the bash to which they had been summoned by printed invitation.

title: Tonight's Entries at Roosevelt
description: Tonight's Entries at Roosevelt

title: B52's Begin Surveillance Of Soviet Navy in Atlantic
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) Air Force B52 bombers have started longrange patrols to watch movements of the Soviet Navy in the Atlantic, the Pentagon announced today.

title: Commuter Killed
description: One woman was killed and at least two dozen other commuters were injured last evening when a crowded rushhour train slammed into the rear of another train just outside the station in New Canaan, Conn. Page 73.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS WIN A SUIT ON AIDS
description: ALBANY, July 13 (UPI)Thel state's highest court ruled 4 to 13 today that parochial schools were entitled to receive special I state aid due them before such Laid was ruled unconstitutional in 1972.

title: Mary Lasker Bemoans Mob Scene at Party
description: Mary Lasker lives among her art works in the perfection of a mirrored white apartment. her friends are the kind of people still known as ladies and gentlemen. She is farrows for elegant little parties. Until yesterday, she hadn't the vaguest idea what it was to he hostess at a mob scene.

title: Rock Group Tells of Life In Soviet Underground
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 13 When the four young men started into their first rockandroll song at the smokefilled bar here, something was missingtheir fear of being arrested.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: United Press International

title: The Fable Of Jimmy Carter
description: Once upon a timethis was away back at the start of the third century of the Republicthere was a peanut farmer in the state of Georgia (U.S.A., not U.S.S.R.) named Jimmy Carter, who thought he could be the leader of the most powerful country in the world. He lived in a strange land, where children were taught that the people ruled, and any one of them might dream of leading the nation out of the wilderness.

title: Olympic Preview
description: Teofilo Stevenson, the Cuban heavyweight, towers over the Olympic boxing tournament as the defending champion in his division. But many amateur boxing observers, notably Pat Nappi, the United States coach, doubt that Stevenson will be the champion in Montreal as he was in Munich.

title: Fireflies Brighten Tokyo Again
description: TOKYO. July 13Little Mitsuyo Kitamura saw something full of wonder here the other night.

title: About Education
description: A favorite target of educational reformers over the years has been the American high school, the subject of countless studies leading to innumerable recommendations for change.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The General Dynamics Corporation of St. Louis and FokkerVFW B.V. of the Netherlands signed a $190 million contract yesterday for coproduction of the F16 fighter plane.

title: Communist Space Pact
description: MOSCOW, July 13 (Reuters) Nine Communist countries signed an agreement here today on cooperation in space exploration and in the use of outer space for peaceful purposes, the Tass press agency reported.

title: Pi Tingchun Is Dead at 62; Peking Party Aide Since '73
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, July 14 (UPI)Pi Tingchun, a member of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee since 1973, died July 7 at the age of 62, Peking radio said today.

title: MAN IS FOUND SLAIN IN D'AMATO'S HOME
description: VENTNOR, July 13 (AP)A 26yearold Lindenwold man was found bound with wire and stabbed to death today at the home of Paul (Skinny) D'Amato, a former Atlantic City night club owner, the police said.

title: $10Million TV Drive To Stress Carter Image
description: Jerry Rafshoon, Jimmy Carter's advertising manager says he intends to spend $10 million to make Mr. Carter look like a President to the American people.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Democratic National Convention, after sweeping aside a last potentially divisive issue, adopted early today a platform hearing the clear imprint of Jimmy Carter. Only a few scattered nays were heard as the platform was approved on a ringing voice vote. Earlier, in its first recorded vote, it had defeated a proposal to discuss three issues for 20 minutes each by 1,957 to 735. The Women's caucus had accepted compromise committing the party to promote rather than require equal representation for women. Mr. Carter welcomed the prospect that the names of other candidates would be placed in nomination tonight. The convention responded warmly to speeches by party heroes past and present. [Page 1, Columns 58].

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (Reuters)United States Savings Bond sales rose to a record $1.92 billion in the second quarter, up 9.5 percent from the similar period last year, the Treasury reported today. Sales for the first half of 1976 were at $3.9 billion, the highest firsthalf total since 1946, and 7 percent ahead of 1975.

title: CHILDCARE UNITS FOUND INADEQUATE
description: About onehalf of the severely handicapped and retarded children placed by New York City each year are sent to institutions in other states because they cannot be accommodated in New York State facilities.

title: Injury Ends Career Of Dearly Precious
description: Dearly Precious will be sent to the farm of Richard E. Bailey, her owner, next week, her highly successful racing career ended by an injury. The filly bowed a tendon in her left foreleg while winning the $42,825 Dark Mirage Stakes last Sunday at Aqueduct, her 12th victory in 16 career starts.

title: Jackson Asks Support For Carter Candidacy
description: Senator Henry Jackson threw a thankyou breakfast for about 400 of his delegates yesterday and urged them to work for the candidacy of Jimmy Carter, The Associated Press reported.

title: World Team Tennis
description: World Team Tennis

title: Cosmos Seek Vengeance Against Rowdies Tonight
description: This is the day Pele, Giorgio Chinaglia, Dave Clements and the rest of the Cosmos have been waiting for since June 6, the day New York was humiliated on national television by the Tampa Bay Rowdies.

title: Rockefeller Center Design: A Triumph for 30's and 70's
description: The accumulation of real estate on the blocks west of Fifth Avenue between 49th and 51st Streets began in 1928 not with the aim of constructing a great commercial complex, but with the idea of providing a new home for the Metropolitan Opera, But somewhere along the way things got too expensive and the opera dropped out, John D. Rockefeller Jr. picked up the pieces, and the project became Rockefeller Center. Now Rockefeller Center's main buildings are roughly 40 years old (they were constructed gradually throughout the 1930's), and they remain, far and away, the nation's preeminent urban complex  architecturally, urbanistically and functionally.

title: Views of Parley Shared By 3 New York Delegates
description: It was a long road to Madison Square Garden for three New York delegates. When they got there, they were squeezed into a cramped area at the rear corner of the convention floor. At times, they could not see very much because of socializing politicians who jammed the aisles. And only rarely could they hear the speeches from the convention podium.

title: Reuben, Reuben, Just Look What They've Been Thinking
description: In the beginning, there was the Reuben sandwich, and if its origins are open to heated discussion, its ingredients, at least, are not.

title: Ivory Coast Leader Still in Command, But Questions of Heir Cast a Shadow
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory CoastPresident Felix HouphoutBoigny makes everyone nervous when he says that like George Washington he would prefer to return to his plantation and slip into retirement.

title: AntiDefamation League Urges Two Be Deported
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith has accused two Palestine Liberation Organization observers at the United Nations of violating travel restrictions and has urged their deportation.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: LJUBJANA, Yugoslavia, July 13 (Reuters) A strong eatrh tremor shook the Novo Mesto region of northwestern Yugoslavia today and caused some damage. the Geophysical Observatory here said today. No casualties were reported.

title: 3 Women in Carter's Life Show He'll Have to Share the Spotlight
description: The three most important women in Jimmy Carter's lifehis wife, Rosalynn; his mother, Lillian, and his daughter, Amy made it clear again yesterday that he will have to share the spotlight should be make it to the White House.

title: Market Place
description: The practical application of a recent corporate reporting requirement of the Securities and Exchange Commission promises to be both confusing and enlightening in the years ahead.

title: Caterpillar Profit Down 3.7% in Second Quarter
description: The Caterpillar Tractor Company reported yesterday a profit decline of 3.7 percent in the second quarter but a rise of 15.8 percent in the first half of this year.

title: Woman Cadet Seeks To Leave West Point
description: WEST POINT, N.Y. (UPI) Less than a week after she was admitted, one of the United States Military Academy's first female cadets has expressed a desire to resign, a West Point spokesman said today.

title: $68,355 Triple Is Pimlico Record
description: BALTIMORE, July 13 (AP)Three long shots in the ninth race produced a record triple payoff at Pimlico Race Course of $68,355 to one ticket holder today. The record payoff resulted from the victory of Hurry to Hanover, an 81 shot, the secondplace finish by a 60to1 shot, Fildor and the thirdplace finish by Bangka, whose odds were 172 to 1.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Commuter Killed

title: Ted Mack, Amateur Hour Host On TV for 22 Years, Dies at 72
description: Ted Mack, who presided over the Original Amateur Hour on television for 22 years and gave (Frank Sinatra, Maria Callas and many other noted entertainers their first chance to perform before the footlights, died Monday at Phelps Memorial Hospital in North Tarrytown, N.Y. He was 72 years old.

title: Pro Transactions
description: SEATTLE (NBA)Signed Dennis ?? ?? secondround draft choice.

title: Traveling to the Gardens
description: The New York Botanical Garden. Bronx Park at 200th Street in the Bronx, is open from 10 A.M. to S P.M. The museum and gift shop are open from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. There is no charge for admission, but parking a car will cost you $1.50 unless you're a member.

title: Man o War Was a Hophead
description: It used to be my naive belief that a bettor at a thoroughbred race track had decent shot at finishing in the money, especially if he had an eye for horseflesh or a knowledge of the various jockeys. But after

title: A List of Events For Delegates
description: The following is a tentative schedule of some of today's events of interest to convention delegates:

title: RIFAI STEPS DOWN AS JORDAN PREMIER
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 13 (Reuters)Prime Minister Zaid alRifai resigned today and King Hussein asked Mudar Badran, chief of the Cabinet, to form A new government.

title: Hearings Open Tomorrow On Access to Beachfronts
description: TRENTON, July 13The first of a series of public hearings on the right of access to the 124 miles of Atlantic Ocean beachfront from Sandy Hook to Cape May will begin Thursday.

title: South Africans Use Dogs To Halt Indians Protest
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, July 13 (Reuters)The police used dogs today to break up a demonstration by several hundred Indians protesting eviction from shops in a newly designated white group area.

title: Nuclear Policy Plank
description: PARISThe broad foreign policy theses outlined by Jimmy Carter should attract support from most Democrats, and if they allow reason to outweigh prejudice, from many liberal Republicans who will certainly worry about the international impact of some of Governor Reagan's more extreme stands until (and unless) President Ford is nominated. Mr. Ford has been consistently sensible on Panama and has usefully followed Secretary Kissinger's advice on several other moot topics.

title: Boris Y. Butoma Dies at 69; Soviet Shipbuilding Chief
description: MOSCOW, July 12 (Reuters) Boris Y. Butoma, Soviet Minigter of the Shipbuilding Industry, died yesterday, aged 69.

title: SECTION OF PIPELINE RUPTURES IN TESTING
description: ANCHORAGE. Alaska, July 13 (AP)A sevenfoot section of the Alaska pipeline split apart during water pressure tests on the 48inchdiameter steel tube, the firm building the line disclosed today.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Joseph F. Serozati

title: Finger Lakes Results
description: Finger Lakes Results

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: The United States Food and Drug Administration has made final its ban on drugs and cosmetics that contain chloroform, but because it has ordered no recall, inventories of products that contain the chemical may still be on stores helves.

title: Girl, 8, Found Hanging In Rockville Centre Yard
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., July 13 (AP)An 8yearold girl was found hanging from a tree in a neighbor's yard today in this Long Island community, the Nassau County police reported.

title: Fireflies Brighten Tokyo Again
description: TOKYO, July 13Little Mitsuyo Kitamura saw something full of wonder here the other night.

title: AREA CHIEFS HAIL PLEDGE TO CITIES
description: The Democratic Party's platform pledge of a massive effort to help New York and other older cities and other key planks submitted to the convention yesterday would, if implemented, mean more than $3 billion annually for New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, area officials said yesterday.

title: Rep. Jordan Rejects Bid For Attempt at 2d Spot
description: Petitions to nominate Representative Barbara C. Jordan for Vice President were being circulated yesterday at the Democratic National Convention but Miss Jordan promptly disapproved the move, The Associated Press reported.

title: Poles to Cut Price Rise For Meat to 35 Percent
description: WARSAW, July 13 (Reuters)Poland announced today that it proposed to raise meat prices this year by 35 percent after consultations with the population.

title: Pravda Critical of Carter On Foreign Policy Position
description: MOSCOW, July 13 (UPI)Pravda, the Soviet Communist Party newspaper, described Jimmy Carter today as a moderate but criticized him for his foreign policy statements.

title: Brings Votes of Liberals And Blacks to Georgian
description: When Representative Andrew Young of Atlanta takes the podium in Madison Square Garden tonight to deliver a seconding speech for Jimmy Carter, a fellow Georgian, the Democrats assembled below and the nation tuned in beyond will be looking at the man who probably understands and wields political power more effectively than any other black in the United States.

title: Urban Disintegration
description: Despite the diversions of this glittering summerthe Bicentennial, a visit from the Queen of England, the political conventions and the Olympic GamesAmerica's harsh realities, though out of mind and sight, abide unattended in the darker recesses of the nation's life.

title: MEDICAL PRIVACY SUBJECT OF STUDY
description: The National Commission on Confidentiality of Health Records has appealed for details of incidents in which patients believe the privacy of their medical records has been violated.

title: COMMON MARKET PLANS HIJACK PACT
description: BRUSSELS. July 13 The nine member countries of Western Europe's Common Market decided today to draft an international treaty that would commit them either to prosecute or to extradite hijackers and terrorists.

title: Bank Robber Agrees To 25Year Term In Plea Bargaining
description: A member of a twoman team that allegedly netted more than $650,000 in 22 hank robberies, in the last three years agreed in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday to accept a 25year prison term as part of a plea of guilty to robbing one bank.

title: Issue and Debate
description: Can international sports be conducted without the intense political pressures that have scarred recent competitions?

title: Israel Is Moving to Save Ships Of Financially Ailing Company
description: TEL AVIV, July 13 (AP)The Israeli Government has reached a compromise with the firmdaily ailing Maritime Fruit Carriers Company in an effort to help the company save its Israeliflag merchant ships.

title: Jimmy Stout, Jockey, Dies at 62; Was in a Rare Triple Dead Heat
description: Jimmy Stout, one of the jockeys in the Carter Handicap's threehorse dead heat in 1944 and a Kentucky Derby winner, was found dead of heart attack in a motel in Harrisburg Pa., on Monday. He was 62 years old.

title: Bank Robber Agrees To 25Year Term In Plea Bargaining
description: A member of a twoman team that allegedly netted more than $650,000 in 22 hank robberies in the last three years agreed in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday to accept a 25year prison term as part of a plea of guilty to robbing one bank.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor. The size of government is gradually becoming the leading nonissue of 1976. Spokesmen for both parties are agreed that growth of government spending must be arrested, if not reversed. Since cities and states are already cutting back, the only disagreement is over the size and content of cuts in the Federal budget.

title: Barne Asks Delayin Safe Of Leases for Offshore Oil
description: TRENTON, July 13 (UPI)Governor Byrne wants a delay in the Aug. 17 oil and gas lease sale for offshore drilling until Congress acts on reform legislation.

title: Syrian Tank Unit Enters Lebanese Moslem Center
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 13A tank column of the Syrian Army today entered the city of Baalbek, one of the largest Moslem centers in Lebanon and famous as a site of Roman ruins.

title: Second U.S. Navy Plane Makes Landing in Kenya
description: WASHINGTON, July 13A second Navy patrol plane landed at Nairobi today as the United States continued to demonstrate its support for Kenya in its dispute with Uganda.

title: Reds in Spain Announce Plans for a Trade Union
description: MADRID, July 13Plans to establish a new trade union in which all wage earners would participate were announced today by the Communistinfluenced worker commissions that together form Spain's most powerful though illegal labor organization.

title: People and Business
description: The British market for securities may die unless the Government takes action to ease restrictions on investments from overseas, the chairman of the London stock exchange, Nicholas Goodison, said yesterday in London.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The Now York Times/Mary Ann Hardlman

title: Leyland Lays Off 5,000
description: LONDON, July 13 (Reuters)British Leyland has laid off 5,000 Jaguar workers at Coventry because of an interunion dispute, the company announced today. Progressive layoffs began a week ago when work stopped in the press shop because nine men changed unions.

(516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3147767.

title: MRS. NIXON GAINING; NEEDS LONG THERAPY
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., July 13 (UPI)  Pat Nixon, partially paralyzed by a stroke, is steadily improving and advanced today from simple arm and leg therapy to walking and standing at least once a day.

title: Federal Aid Provides a Mr. Fixit for the Elderly
description: HIGHLAND PARKFor two years I've wanted my porch painted, said Mary Jane Ashbrook. Mr. Gattsek did it in two mornings.

title: About Real Estate
description: Everyone concerned agrees that the large modern ?? market on the Brooklyn waterfront that has been built to replace the rainshackle Fort Greene market off Atlantic Avenue is 95 percent complete. But that last 5 percent.

description: Jimmy Carter's lieutenants and party officials easily squelched last night the first controversy to arise on the floor of the Democratic National Convention.

title: NASSAU TO FIGHT TAX CASE RULING
description: MINEOLA, LI., July 13The Nassau County Attorney said today that the county would seek permission probably within the next 10 days to appeal to the State Court of Appeals a lower court decision in a tax assessment case that Cotinty Executive Ralph G. Casie said is going to wipe us out.

description: Earth Tremor in Yugoslavia

title: Japanese Linked To Lockheed Held
description: TOKYO, July 13 (UPI)Prosecutors today arrested the former chairman of one of Japan's big five trading companies on his alleged involvement in the $12 million Lockheed Aircraft Corporation payoff scandal. Four other businessmen were indicted in the matter.

title: Unions for Professionals Showing Steady Growth
description: The unionization of professional employees is steadily growing, with some 40 percent of all salaried, nonmanagement professionals now covered by collective bargaining, against only 25 percent of the total labor force.

title: TriCounty Favorites Advance
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., July 13All favorites, led by Mrs. Albert B. Bower of Pelham Country Club and Mrs. Robert Young of Aspetuck Valley C.C. of Weston, Conn., the comedalists yesterday, advanced through the first round of the 32d Women's TriCounty golf championship at the wind  swept Hampshire C.C. here today.

title: Status of Towers Home As a Landmark Debated
description: More than a score of archi tects, historians and West Side residents made a spirited appeal yesterday to obtain landmark status for the vacant and vandalized Towers Nursing Home on Central Park West.

title: Hanoi's Mission Leaves Manila With Pact Curbing Use of Bases
description: MANILA, July 13The fiveman mission sent from Hanoi to break friendly ground in Southeast Asia ended its visit today after obtaining a guarantee from the Philippine Government that military bases here would not be used for aggressive purposes in the region.

title: A New Suggestion To End Old Story
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 13John Montefusco. last season's Mark Fidrych. offered a suggestion tonight after the National League made it the same old story in the AllStar game.

title: U.S., Under New Legislation, Cuts Military Advisers Abroad
description: WASHINGTON. July 13The Defense Department, under a Congressional edict, is reducing military advisory teams that started out by administering military aid to foreign countries and ended up serving largely as the foreign service of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

title: Israeli Charges Uganda Tries to Blackmail U.N.
Woman Dies in Collision
description: PENNSAUKEN, N.J., July 13 (UPI)Mary Ellen Bennett, 27 years old, of Blackwood was killed today in a collision on Route 130. The police said her car had swerved into the path of another vehicle.

title: COLOMBIA REVOKES ORDER CLOSING U.P.I.
description: BOGOTA Colombia, July 13 (UPI)  The Government formally lifted an order yesterday that would have shut down United Press International operations in Colombia.

title: Sports Today
description: Robert Douglass Pro League doubleheader, at John Bowne High School gymnasium, 6325 Main Street, Flushing, Queens, 6:30 P.M.

title: Westchester to Change Its Refuse Plan
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 13Westchester County will have to scrap or at least revise substantially its ambitious solidwaste disposal plan because villages and towns objec ted to garbage transfer stations proposed within their boundaries.

title: Con Edison Seeks Right From P.S.C. to Require Landlords to Collect Electric Bills and Read Meters
description: Consolidated Edison has asked the New York State Public Service Commission to require landlords to collect electricity bills and read meters for 1.8 million residential customers in multipledwellings.

title: First Chicago Earnings Down; Other Banks Off in 2d Quarter
description: The First Chicago Corporation, parent of the First National Bank of Chicago, the nation's ninth largest bank, reported yesterday a decline of 11.1 percent in second quarter operating earnings to $25.7 million. or 65 cents a share, from $28.9 million, or 73 cents a share, in the 1975 second quarter.

title: Body of Mrs. Bloch Said to Have Been Seen in a Forest in Uganda
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 13A Ugandan arriving in Nairobi was quoted today as having, said he had seen what he presumed to be the body of the missing hijacking hostage, Dora Bloch, in a forest near Kampala, the Uganda capital.

title: IndianPakistani Trading
description: NEW DELHI, July 13 (Reuters)Private trading between Indian and Pakistani concerns will resume Thursday, it was officially announced here today. Such trading has been suspended since the IndianPakistani war of 1965.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday that he would begin auditing transactions of the Bureau of School Lunches today because of innumerable questions raised during preliminary questioning of officials involved in the program. The Comptroller issued an exchange of letters between his office and Dr. Bernard R. Gifford, the deputy chancellor of schools, in which Dr. Gifford, had questioned. whether Mr. Goldin had the authority to audit the program's books in the absence of legality, fraud o rmanifest mathematical error. Mr. Goldin said, despite Dr. Gifford's letter, that he would begin his audit to look into purchases made by the bureau to determine whether th ebureau had circumvented competitive bidding requirements, as Mr. Goldin had found in an earlier inquiry made public in May.

title: The Program For Today
description: Following are highlights from the tentative program for the Democratic ?? Convention today:

title: PASSMAN LINKED TO NEW COERCION
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Federal agents are investigating allegations that Representative Otto E. Passman used his office to influence the awarding of yet another lucrative shippingagency contract, according to high Government sources.

title: Bridge
description: At a low level, a redouble can have three completely different meanings, depending on the type of double. If the double is for penalties. a redouble is normally an SOS, urging partner to seek a more sheltered spot. if the double is negative, the redouble should show some measure of support: Some experts play that it promises a top honor, and therefore a raise denies one.

title: PASSMAN LINKED TO NEW COERCION
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Federal agents are investigating allegations that Representative Otto E. Passman used his office to influence the awarding of yet another lucrative shippingagency contract, according to high Government sources.

title: Henry Clay Weds Harriet Heussler
description: The marriage of Harriet McLean Heussler to Henry J. Clay, a partner in the New York law firm of Abberley, Kooiman, Marcellino & Clay, took place yesterday. Civil Court Judge Charles E. Whitman Jr. performed the ceremony at the bride's apartment in New York City. The

title: President Bats Breeze With AllStars
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 13In a visit to the clubhouses of both teams before tonight's AllStar game, President Ford chatted with each of the players, coaches and managers and autographed baseballs for many of them. One of his longest conversations was with Mark Fidryoh, the American League starter.

title: Mark Set In Women's 1,000 Meters
description: MONTREAL, July 13In 1968, Madeline Manning Jackson of Cleveland won the women's 800meter gold medal in the Olympic Games at Mexico City. In 1972 at Munich, distracted by personal problems, she was eliminated in the semifinals. Now, fresh from one American record in the United States Olympic track trials, she broke another last night and reaffirmed her position as a strong candidate in the Olympic 800 here in two weeks.

title: Ashe Is Extended
description: KITZBUEHEL, Austria. July 13 (AP)Arthur Ashe started slowly, but recovered to defeat Hungary's Peter Szoeke, 46, 62, 64, in the second round of a $75,000 grand prix tennis tournament today.

title: I Don't Vote
description: When I was young, I was more or less my aunt's daughter. That's why I guess I had it so good, because my aunt used to give me a lot of things and used to talk to me more than my mother did. She told me almost everything I can really think of, and then what I learned in the street. Other than that, it's kind of shaky.

title: Carter Is Little Changed Despite Crowds
description: When he came to New York last spring, hardly anyone noticed

title: COURT BACKS CURB ON CANCER CARE
description: BOSTON, July 13 (UPI)The Massachusetts Supreme Court has ruled that lifeprolonging treatments may be withheld from a severely retarded leukemia patient who is incapable of making such a decision.

title: Deal Is Near Completion On Bingham Drawings
description: ST. LOUIS, July 13Final arrangements are being made for the sale of a collection of 112 drawings by the 19thcentury artist George Caleb Bingham in a way that will preserve it intact and make it available for loan exhibitions around the country.

title: WINE TALK
description: Unbeknownst to most wine drinkers, there is an important and at times quite bitter battle going on behind the scenes over how to label American wine bottles. And, as is so often the case with these issues, the consumer is the one who is considered the least.

title: Heat and Lack of Water Cited in Wild Horse Death
description: DUGWAY, Utah, July 13 (UPI)Thirtyeight wild mustangs found dead on the Army's Dugway Proving Grounds were probably the victims of a heat wave, a lack of water and their own finicky naturenot because of germ warfare experiments, according to a Government source.

title: The Convention on TV: Mixed Impressions
description: In their first installments of the television serial known ass the Democratic National Convention, the three networks each sent their cameras into a suite. at the Americana Hotel to show Jimmy Carter watching their coverage on TV.

title: STRIKE MEDIATED IN WESTCHESTER
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y., July 13Federal and state mediators traveled to Westchester County today to assist in settling a teamsters strike that has shut down construction sites in Westchester an Putnam Counties.

title: Special Awards Presented To 3 Democratic Leaders
description: Three leading DemocratsW. Averell Harriman, Arthur B. Krim and Sheldon Cohenreceived special awards at the Democratic National Convention Monday night for special service.

title: Roosevelt Results
description: Roosevelt Results

title: Convention Artifacts Sought by a Curator
description: Even before the hurrahs of this convention have a chance to echo into history. the Smithsonian Institution has a curator here collecting memorabilia, stocking nostalgia for future Americans who will see what the buttons, pamphlets, banners and hats looked like back now, when it is time to see the Jimmy Carter convention reborn again.

title: People in Sports
description: Although Bill Sharman agreed in principle to a multiyear contract as an executive of the Los Angeles Lakers only minutes before his fiveyear contract as coach expired Monday. his status as coach of the team is still up in the air. In the announcement mace yesterday. a spokesman for the club added that the new agreement does not rule out the possibility that in his executive capacity Sharman will also coach the Lakers next season.

title: COMPANY REPORTS
description: COMPANY REPORTS

title: Portugal Declined To Plead in Angola For Mercenaries
description: LISBON, July 13Concerned about the possible fate of Portuguese prisoners in Angola. the Government here declined to intercede with its former colony on behalf of American and British mercenaries who were executed there last week.

title: Uniroyal and Rubber Union Break Off Talks on Strike
description: Talks between Uniroyal Inc. and the United Rubber Workeis have broken off, ending the latest effort to halt a 12week strike against the Big Four eompanies of the tire industry, the Associated Press reported.

title: A CliffClimber Leads Struck Hospitals
description: Two years ago, when he turned 40 years old, William Joshua Abelow, executive vice president of the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes, spent nine days in a Outward Bound program that he says changed his life.

title: North Sea Oil Discovery
description: BARTLESVILLE, Okla., July 13 (Reuters)The Phillips troleum Company, as operator for a sixcompany group, said oil had been discovered in the British sector of the North Sea. The oil tested at a rate of 6,100 barrels a day.

title: Smith Ousts New Yorker In Tennis
description: CINCINNATI. July 13 (UPI) Stan Smith. seeded fourth, ousted Steve Turner of New York. 61. 75. in the first round of the $100.000 Western tennis championships today.

title: Olympic Flame Begins Journey
description: ANCIENT OLYMPIA, Greece, July 13 (AP)The Olympic torch began its course to Montreal today from this cradle of the original Olympic Games, after being lighted from the rays of the sun in a ceremony beginning with legendary mysticism and scheduled to end with an Olympic record in itself.

title: Carter Is Rebuffed in Unity Bid to New Jersey Caucus
description: Jimmy Carter warned feuding New Jersey Democrats yester day that a divided party in their state could hurt his chances of winning the Presidency this November.

title: Carter's Lawyer and Political Strategist
description: Lyndon B. Johnson and Jimmy Carter both went through ballotfraud and voterecount crises early in their political careers. And both men emerged from the

title: West Indies Beats England in Cricket
description: MANCHESTER, England. July 13 (Reuters)The West Indies took just 20 balls to polish off England's remaining second inning wicket to go 10 in the series on the final day of the third cricket test at Old Trafford today. England, 125 runs for nine wickets overnight, needed rain to save it but the sun was shining when play began. Make Selvey clipped a single off Michael Holding's first ball and that was the end of the scoring.

title: CHARLES H. MARTIN
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., July 13 (AP)  Charles H. Martin, manager of airport operations for the Metropolitan. Transportation Authority, died today of a heart attack in his office at Stewart Airport here. He was 43 years old.

title: ETHIOPIAN REGIME PUTS 18 TO DEATH, CHARGES PLOTTING
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 13The Ethiopian radio announced today that 18 military leaders and merchants, including the thirdranking member of the ruling Provisional Military Administrative Council, had been executed for crimes ranging from plotting a coup to food hoarding.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Ad hoc committee on the world disarmament conference11 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: California Is Optimistic on Resources Despite Worst Drought in 50 Years
description: STINSON BEACH, Calif., July 13State officials in Sacramento say that with proper; water conservation, piecemeal; solutions to local crises, ingenuity and luck. California's. huge farming. timber and cattle businesses can get through the state's worst drought in 50 years without extensive permanent damage.

title: Woman Beaten by Burglar
description: POMONA, N. J., July 13 (UPI)A 63yearold woman was beaten severly by a burglar who stole jewiry and $150 from her home in Galloway Township, the police said. The woman, Harriet Kinsell, who was surprised yesterday while she was upstairs caring for her bedridden 87yearold father, was admitted to the Atlantic City's Mainland Division in critical condition. Samuel Lee McCombs, 30, of Atlantic City was arrested a halfhour later and held as a suspect. The police said he had a knife, the stolen money and the jewelry.

title: Texans, New Yorkers Hitting It Off at Last
description: Deep in the heart of Manhattan, Texans and New Yorkers are mysteriously saying nice things about one another this week.

title: This Time, the Democrats Dress Up
description: The Democrats have cut their hair, powdered their noses and donned Pucci dresses or Countess Mara cravats. They are all dressed up as if they have someplace to go: the White House.

title: 8 Developing Lands to Form a Press Agency Pool
description: NEW DELHI, July 13Fiftyeight developing countries agreed here today to form a pool of their press agencies to fulfill what they described as a need to liberate their information and mass media from the colonial legacy.

title: Music: Ovation for Alicia de Larrocha
description: Alicia de Larrocha came onstage in her characteristically hesitant fashion at Alice Tully Hall on Monday night, acknowledged thunderous applause and sat down at the piano. That did not satisfy her audience, which persisted in its ovation until the Spanish pianist rose and took a bow. Her performance, Miss de Larrocha's tirst in this 10thanniversary season of Mostly Mozart, went ahead to justify the premature enthusiasm, and then some.

title: Plan to Preserve Character of City I. Will Be Debated
description: City Island, probably New York City's most selfcontained community, would be given special zoning protection under a planning proposal to be debated at a public hearing on the island tonight.

title: HUMPHREY HARED
description: The Democratic National Convention early today adopted a platform bearing the clear imprint of Jimmy Carter after sweeping aside last night a last potentially divisive issue.
