title: Youths Harassing Residents of Block in East Flatbush
description: Neither Jim Koltzan nor Millie Jordan nor even George Miller, who is leaving the neighborhood on account of it, is able to pinpoint just when the problem on the block developed.

title: Reagan Sees an Advantage In Carter's Focus on Nixon
description: SALT LAKE CITY, July 16Ronald Reagan returned to friendly Western territory this evening, emptyhanded in his twoday search for delegates in New Jersey and Pennsylvania but still outwardly sanguine in his race against President Ford.

title: Yuma Residents Put Wheat Harvest Before Democratic Parley
description: YUMA, Colo., July 15Farming and politics often go hand in hand on the irrigated plains of eastern Colorado, but this week they were in conflict. A lot of people did not watch the Democratic National Convention because it was televised in the middle of prime harvest time.

title: Dibbs, Stockton Advance in Western Open
description: CINCINNATI, July 16 (UPI) Topseeded Eddie Dibbs of Miami defeated Trey Waltke of ST. Louis, 62, 62, today in the quarterfinal round of the $100,000 Western open tennis championships.

title: Books of The Times
description: Of the ways of writing historyas narrative, as political, as military, as diplomatic, as economic or socialsynoptic history is surely the most difficult, for it requires not only immense learning but also an immense ability to convey the spirit and temper of an era in many countries. E. T. Hobsbawm, who is professor of bistory at Birbeck College of the University of London, is fortunate to have just those qualities and to have combined them with an enviable literary style that gives his books and articles a special distinction.

title: Dividends
description: Dividends

title: Industrial Output Slows Its Advance
description: WASHINGTON, July 16Industrial production continued to advance in June but at a slower pace than in previous months, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Scientists Fear Argon Gas on Mars Could Damage Viking Landing Equipment
description: The first major scientific finding from the Viking 1 spacecraft orbiting Mars was new evidence that the thin Martian atmosphere is apparently rich in the inert gas called argon.

title: DINING OUT
description: BOLOGNA is a culinary mecca where Pappagallo is one of the temples. That the owners of this Pappagallo have named their restaurant for the fabled establishment in the Old Country gives you some idea of their standards. They are trying hard and succeeding rather well.

title: Minnesota Throng Greets Mondales Upon Return Home
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 17Senator Walter F. Mondale returned today to his home state, where he and his wife were greeted for the first time since his becoming the Deinocratic nominee for Vice President.The throng included two major patrons of his political career.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: GARDENING
description: FOR many years, California's giant redwood trees were considered to be the oldest living things on earth. Individual trees that are alive today were growing 25 centuries ago. However, they were dethroned a few years ago when it was discovered that certain bristlecone pine of Arizona and California were more than 4,500 years old. These picturesquely stunted trees of this arid region are the physical opposite of the towering, massive redwoods.

title: ART VIEW
description: It is not in the least unusual for a major exhibition to inspire a great deal of antagonism but it is very unusual nowadays for such an exhibition to inspire a counterexhibition. Yet this is what has now occurred in the show that Robert Metzger has organized under the title, American Salon des Refuses, at the Stamford (Conn.) museum and Nature Center, which, as its subtitle explains, devoted to 36 contemporary American sculptors not included in the Whitney Museum's concurrent 200 Years of American Sculpture exhibition.

title: OFFICER SUSPENDED FOR SHOTS AT WIFE
description: A city police officer whose estranged wife was found shot to death yesterday was suspended from the force without pay last night after he was arrested for allegedly shooting at her on June 8, a department spokesman said.

title: Gold Rush Anticipated by Strong U. S. Swim Team
description: MONTREAL, July 17The Gaines of the XXI Olympiad began today with elaborate opening ceremonies. The games of the Games begin tomorrow with competition in 14 of the 23 Olympic sports.

title: Gail Anderson Fiancee of C. A. Vogt
description: Mr. and Mrs, Frederick N. Anderson Jr. of Charlotte, Vt. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gail Anderson, to Charles Anthony Vogt, son of Evon Z. Vogt Jr., professor of anthropology and master of Kirkland House at Harvard University, and of Mrs. Vogt, comaster of Kirkland House.

title: Soviet Crew Member Aided
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 17 (UPI)A Russian crew member airlifted from the trawler Soyuz 5 by the United States Coast Guard was listed in fair condi tion today at the Federal Public Health Service hospital, where she was treated for internal hemorrhaging. She was identified as Claudia Soksha, 25 years old.

title: Grant Porter Is Fiance Of Christina C. French
description: Christina Chrysler French. a great granddaughter of Walter P. Chrysler, the automobile manufacturer, plans to be married in early winter to Grant Aubrey Porter, a greatgrandson of the Earl of Huntington.

title: Work Schedules Occupy Hospital Officials Now
description: Dorothy Smith was just delighted to return to work at ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center; Norah Ashe was relieved that Mrs. Smith, her nursing aide, was back, but for Bill Duffy yesterday was when the problems really began.

title: Will Yanks Sue? Doubt Is Growing
description: One month after Commissioner Bowie Kuhn voided Charles O. Finley's $1.5 mil. lion sale of Vida Blue to the Yankees and the Yankees promised legal action to void the commissioner's action, the team has taken no such action.

title: U.S. Equestrian 3Day Squad Is Favored
description: When Jack LeGoff arrived in the United States six years ago to become coach of the United States equestrian team's threeday squad, he made some fast calculations.

title: Braves Rout Pirates by 102 As Ruthven Scatters 10 Hits
description: PITTSBURGH, July 17 (AP) Ken Henderson hit a threerun homer and Dick Ruthven scattered 10 hits to lead the Atlanta Braves over the Pittsburgh Pirates, 102, today.

title: The hunting of the
description: People react to Nature's glorious and bewildering display of wonders somewhat as they do to a magic show. Some sit back and enjoy the performance while others are compelled to search for rational explanations. Scientists are those who spend much of their time asking how Nature's tricks work, and among these are an elite and sometimes snobbish few who pursue an ultimate question: What are the most basic constituents of matter, and how are they put together? Today, such scientists are called elementaryparticle or highenergy physicists; at other times, they were known simply as physicists, or as natural philosophers, or even as alchemists.

title: The Bowling Clinic
description: Assuming that you've done the job correctly behind the line, all that remains once the bill hits the pins is for you to achieve carry.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: To most Long Island homeowners, the arrival of warm, sunny days usually signals a general trend toward more outdoor living on backyard terraces or patioseating, relaxing, reading, entertaining or just plain socializing under the open sky.

title: Food
description: 1 fivepound leg of Iamb, boned pound bacon or salt pork 6 cloves garlic, finely minced 3 sprigs fresh parsley 10 fresh basil leaves Salt and freshly ground pepper 1 cup coarsely chopped onions  cup coarsely chopped carrots  cup dry white wine 2 cups chopped, peeled tomatoes (if canned tomatoes are used, use the imported Italian peeled tomatoes).

title: Code Word
description: One word has come to be applied as a code to describe the position of Israel in the debate over law and land in the Middle East. The word was first used sparingly after 1967, then more assertively and frequently, and now has infiltrated the language of diplomacy and politics and journalism to the point where it stands in place of analysis and argument, and, in my opinion, incorrectly and dangerously so. The word is intransigence.

title: Patriotic Dyeing of Clouds Prevented by Rocket Flaw
description: WASHINGTON, July 17 (AP) A research rocket designed to strew East Coast skies with red, white and blue clouds blasted off tonight, but its mission was thwarted by a mechanical failure.

title: Moderate General In Peru Is Named As Prime Minister
description: LIMA, Peru, July 17 (Reuters)President Francisco Morales Bermtldez of Peru brought five new ministers into his Cabinet today after dropping the military Government's most ardent leftists.

title: Paperbacks
description: BEFORE THE FALL, by William Safire. (Belmont Tower, $2.75.) What went on inside the Nixon White House, 19691973: an anecdotefilled memoir by a perceptive speechwriter who was both there and innocent.

title: Design
description: Nobody knows New York. Its streets are a journey of architectural discovery. The city is full of buildings of every style, of which the majority are unrecorded and unsung. In fact, New York City has just been told by the New York Landmarks Conservancy that it is host to over 4,000 public buildings of a surprisingly high level of design, put up by the city, the state and the Federal Government. This revealing inventory destroys the durable belief that except for a few landmark structures New York has little of architectural distinction.

title: BARGAIN WITH TERRORISTS?
description: WASHINGTON. Rockets rip through the United States Embassy in Beirut . An American military adviser is gunned down on a street in Teheran . In Khartoum, two American diplomats held hostage by Palestinian terrorists are riddled with machinegun bullets after demands for political concessions are not met. Caskets containing the bodies an American Ambassador and his economic counselor are received in Washington by President Ford to a 19gun salute.

title: A Good Track Record
description: The odds are that if mornings at OTB, afternoons at Aqueduct or Belmont and evenings at Yonkers or Roosevelt are not enough, horse players and others in search of entertainment will want to know about They're at the Post.

title: Antarctic Study Set
description: MOSCOW, July 17 (Reuters)  Soviet and American researchers will conduct joint studies of the Antarctic Ocean to examine the effect of the icecap on the world climate, the official press agency Tass reported today. Under a memorandum signed yesterday in Leningrad, Tass said, the Soviet research vessel Professor Zubov and the American expedition ship Thomas G. Thompson will each carry a scientific team from the other country.

title: What They Are Saying
description: John Montefusco of the Giants, after the National League AllStar victory, suggests: Split up the National League team and play the game just between us next year.

title: H. Julia Legsdin Bride of Albert Kelley
description: H. Julia Legsdin, daughter of Mrs. Adolph Legsdin of Rolla, Mo., and Albert Thomas Kelley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert F. Kelley of Boston and Plymouth, Mass., were married yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Charles Quinn.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: DART AMERICA (Dart). Antwero July 28, Southampton 30, Copenhagen 31 and Dublin Aug. 1; sails from Global Marine Terminal, N.J.

title: Jean M. Giblin Bride in Jersey
description: In Christ the King Roman Catholic Church in New Vernon, N. J., at noon yesterday, Jean Marie Giblin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. E. Burke Giblin of New Vernon and Marblehead, Mass., became the bride of Alfred D. Haynes 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Haynes Jr. of Allendale, N. J.

title: Charles Metel Weds Miss Downing
description: Deborah Lee Downing, daughter of Shirley M. Downing of Virginia Beach, Va., and Raymond Guthrie Downing of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Charles Conrad Christian Metel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles F. Metel of New York.

title: Rainiers in Wyoming
description: JACKSON, Wyo., July 17 (UPI)Prince Rainier and Princess Grace of Monaco have arrived at Jenny Lake Lodge in Grand Teton National Park for a few days of relaxation in Wyoming's Jackson Hole country.

title: Two Poets
description: Since the military coup d'tat of 1973, rumors of every kind have surrounded the fate of Chile's two bestknown writers, Pablo Neruda and Nicanor Parra. During a recent trip to Santiago, I was able to learn a good deal about both of them.

title: Today's Schedule
description: ROWING  10 A.M., men's preliminaries.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: ONE major uncertainty was lifted In the world of business last week when the Democratic Party selected its Presidential ticket, but there are still a number of political and economic question marks in this country and abroad that will continue to becloud the general outlook.

title: York Ave. Robbers Shoot a Policeman; 2 Suspects Seized
description: An offduty police officer and a patron were shot during a holdup by three men early yesterday in a neighborhood bar on York Avenue near 74th Street.

title: Sally Hinrichs Wed To S. W. Lawrence
description: Sally Hinrichs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stuart W. Hinrichs of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Steven W. Lawrence, son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor J. Lawrence of Fram ingham, Mass. The Rev. Richard Van Wiele performed the ceremony in St. Barnabas Episcopal Church.

title: SETBACK FOR REAGAN IS REPORTED BY POLL
description: Since early June, former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has suffered a substantial loss of support among Republican and independent voters, despite his recent gains in delegate support, according to Gallup Poll.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: THE people down in Cream Ridge and Jackson Township are modest. They are not what would generally be considered welltodo and they prefer to be rural, even calling their community Jackson Town.

title: It's Time For an Overhaul
description: PARIS  Jimmy Carter has now chosen his Vice President and assuming, as he may well do, that he will win a lease on the White House, must soon begin thinking about his Cabinet choices, starting with Secretary of State. Of course he is unlikely to artflounce such decisions until after Election Day. The big question is not whom but what?

title: Lauda Gains Pole Spot in England
description: BRANDS HATCH, England, July 17 (AP)Niki Lauda of Austria edged James Hunt today for the pole position in tomorrow's British Grand Prix Formula One automobile race. Lauda, reigning world champion and leader for this year's grand prix title, turned in a lap of 1 minute 19.35 seconds in his Ferrari during the last practice period. tice period.

title: Fashion
description: Fashion

title: New England Jobless Rate
description: BOSTON, July 17 (AP)Unemployment rates dropped in all six New England states in May, the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics has reported. The number of people looking unsuccessfully for work fell 41,500 to 450,000 in May from 491,500 in April, the agency said.

title: A Correction
description: In an article on selfhelp housing rehabilitation for the poor in the July 11 issue, the source of the Federal funding for the solar energy collectors on the roof at 519 East 11 th Street was incorrectly identified. The funding is from the Community Services Admin istration.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: H. Jack Geiger's review of Ivan Illich's Medical Nemesis New (May 2) calls attention to the book's more obvious weaknesses: that none of it is news, that Illich ignores the caring functions of the medical professions, and that it is obscurantist  Illich proposes vanquishing the Nemesis by turning people away from professional medical care. But there are several other things wrong with Illich's thesis.

title: Mel Brooks Talks Up Silent Movie
description: The studio bosses at 20th Century were thinking about some kind of light noise, a buzz maybe. Because they were afraid there would be just deadly silence, and it can get very uncomfortable sit

title: Home Rule And Reform
description: 0NE reason local property taxes are so crushingly high in New Jersey is painfully obviouslocal government is incredibly inefficient. However, since home rule is a beloved and cherished (and valuable) tradition in the state, any move to reduce the total number of municipalities is doomed to fail, in spite of the clear evidence that fewer governing bodies could easily cope with the service needs of the citizens.

title: Thrust Of Success
description: NEN JERSEY is doing more than its share for fencing in the Olympics, which get under way in Montreal this week. The captain of the fencing team is Jack Keane of East Brunswick, and three of the five women on the team are Jerseyans. They are Benise O'Connor and Shiela Armstrong of Bayonne and Anne O'Donnell of Jersey City.

title: Plane Forced to Land
description: CHICAGO, July 17 (AP)A Condor German International Airline plane carrying 483 passengers made an unscheduled but safe landing at O'Hare International Airport early today with three flat tires and a damaged landing gear. No one was injured as the Boeing 747 touched down and rolled to a halt with firemen standing by. The plane from Frankfurt, was diverted from New York because of heavy fog.

title: Nancy Abbs Is Bride Of Richard C. Rappa
description: Nancy Jane Abbs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome K Abbs of Grosse Pointe, Mich., and Richard C. Rappa, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred C. Rappa of Saginaw, Mich., were married yesterday morning in St. Paul's Roman Catholic Church in Grosse Pointe Farms. Msgr. Edward Canfield performed the ceremony.

title: Partly Cloudy on Mount Olympus
description: YOU can put it down now, Howard Davis Jr. said. I'm gonna win the gold medal in Montreal. This is what I've been waiting for. This is what I've been sacrificing for. Three years. No parties. No women. No fancy foods. Going to bed early. Getting up at six in the morning and running three miles a day, every day, seven days a week. This is it, man. I just put too much into this not to win it. Gotta be mine.

title: Loss by Rangers Is 10th in Row
description: ARLINGTON. Tex., July 17Unable even to recreate in an OldTimers Game tonight, the New York Yankees World Series loss to the Pittsburgh Pirates, the slumpridden Texas Rangers took on the modern Yankees at Arlington Stadium.

title: Letters. On Italy's Currency Controls
description: To the Editor:

title: Let Your Fingers Do the Paying
description: SEATTLEIn this West Coast city, the future is here and if you don't go crazy hitting your touch tone phone 36 times to pay a $15.32 hill, it works.

title: Valerie A. Lewis Is Wed
description: Valerie Anne Lewis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomps Bayard Lewis of Wilmington, Del., was married yesterday in Greenville, Del., to William Aden Cover Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Cover, also of Wilmington. The ceremony was performed in Christ Episcopal Church, Christiana Hundred, by the Rev. Dr. John L. O'Hear, the rector, and Msgr. Henri I. Foltz.

title: Tax Squeeze And the Victim
description: PEOPLE who favored a New Jersey state income tax often presented the argument that the state stood very low on the list of what it spent on one thing or another, particularly elementary and higher education.

title: Ballet Has A Foothold
description: Almost a half century ago when a young Japanese woman named Akiko Tachibane confided to her parents that she wanted to learn ballet, they told her that ballet dancers were freaks who ended up being sold to the circus.

title: FILM VIEW
description: There are currently five sciencefiction films in firstrim release and another dozen or so in various stages of production, including one called Puma for which Anthony Burgess is now writing the original novel so that he can then adapt it for the screen. Sciencefiction, paced by the reruns of Star Trek, is all over television, and if you can believe the Hollywood producer quoted in these pages recently, this renewed Interest in the subject reflects the concern of today's young people for the world of the mind and their search for religiosity.

title: PLAN FOR COURTS SEEN FOUNDERING
description: ALBANY, July 17Governor Carey's court reorganization program to reduce political partisanship In the state judiciary is foundering over political oartisanshio.

title: PremierDesignate of Portugal Urges National Reconciliation
description: LISBON, July 17Prime Ministerdesignate Mario Soares, ignoring attacks against his plan to form a minority Socialist government, today called for national reconciliation.

title: John Hay Whitney. Adviser Was Banker and Trustee
description: Samuel C. Park Jr., chairman of the finance committee of the Whitney Communications Corporation, died yesterday in New York Hospital of heart failure. He was 73 years old and lived at 855 Park Avenue.

title: New Products
description: A water filter that also purifies and removes harmful bacteria from sink water can now be installed in any home or apartment to provide crystal clear, odorfree drinking and cooking water through the cold water tap. Called the Waterco Purifier, and manufactured by Waterco Industries, Inc. 4811 N.E. 12th Avenue, Fort Lauderdale, Fla. 33334, it removes chlorine, rust, sediment, soap, detergent residues and other pollutants so that only pure water flows through. Installed under the sink it treats the water at the rate of two gallons per minute and is maintenancefree because there is no filter to replace and no parts that can corrode. Accepted and registered by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, the unit passes water through a special silver activated carhen medium, then into a second activated Carbon chamber. It is cleaned or reactivated periodically by backflushing as per directions supplied, and is priced at $129.50.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Obituary 6  No Title

title: U.S. and Allies Bar Loans If Reds Join Italy Cabinet
description: WASHINGTON, July 17The United States. West Germany. France and Britain have reached an informal understanding to bar further loans of Italy if Communists hold Cabinet posts in any new Italian government.

title: How Government Is Pushing Up the Cost of Housing
description: SAN DIEGOWhen Jerry Degan, a San Diego builder began selling a threebedroom, twobath home in the Lark Haven housing development here a little more than two years ago, its price tag was $32,990. When his company finished the final section of the 500unit project recently, the price of the similar home was $52,990.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Required stops for theatergoers in London are Britain's two major national companies, the National Theater and the Royal Shakespeare Company. At least for this season, each has taken on a distinct character  the National turning to popular theater and the RSC giving a second look to neglected modern classics.

title: The Case of a Utah Congressman May Help Clear It Up
description: A Congressman's career is at stake this week, as a jury in Salt Lake City faces this vexing question: Was the Congressman an unwary innocent who was ensnared into soliciting two policewomen posing as prostitutes, or was he an unwary criminal who was merely afforded a favorable opportunity by the two decoys to commit the crime?

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Last month's deluges soaked thirsty soils. Where soil drainage was good, water seeped down deeply to tree, shrub and grass roots. Where drainage was not good, there were soggy areas on the lawn, hardpacked puddles in cultivated borders and low wet spots. When soil drainage is poor, plants do not grow as they should. Roots are deprived of air and smother, or they just plain rot.

title: Pageantry Dazzling Amid Controversy
description: MONTREAL. July 17The Olympic Games began in pageantry and protest today and with lastminute gaps in the opening march of nations that passed in front of Queen Elizabeth in the $685 million Olympic Stadium.

title: On Westchester Links, Arnie's Army Marches On
description: HARRISON, N. Y., July 17The secondlargest volunteer army in the United States got many more recruits today as it continued maneuvers on the West Course of the Westchester Country Club The leader was moving, and so were the troops.

title: Headliners
description: Andrei Amalrik, a dissident Russian writer has acceded to pressure from Soviet authorities to emigrate. Mr. Amalrik, who arrived in Amsterdam last week, joins a growing number of Soviet intellectuals who are living in exile in the West. Among his controversial writings was an essay in which he predicted a war between Russia and China and the downfall of the Soviet Government. Imprisoned twice and exiled Siberia several times, Mr. Amalrik said he had finally given in to the authorities wish that he leave the country because of what he called a campaign of police harassment directed at him since 1975.

title: 3 Abductors Sought as 26 Children Rejoin Families
description: CHOWCHILLA, Calif., July 17 Twenty  six schoolchildren and their driver were reunited with their families before dawn today after a 36hour kidnapping ordeal. Their bus had been ambushed by masked gunmen and they were herded into two vans and driven about 100 miles, then imprisoned underground in a makeshift cell.

title: Passengers Fail to Report Robbery in Paris Subway
description: PARIS, July 17 (Reuters)A gang of youths held up a Paris subway train this month and robbed the passengers of their money and valuablesbut no one complained to the police and the engineer took four days to report it to his union.

title: AllStars Through the Tube Darkly
description: Because of my broken leg I was sentenced to another night of television and wondering why I tried to take out a block of concrete playing third base when I was ahead by nine runs and out by 30 feet. This was not going to be a night of Norman Lear whathaveyou's, though. No ordinary week, for that matter. I had the AllStar Game on Channel 7 and the Democratic Convention almost everywhere else.

title: There's Still a Lot of Dirt, But Less Than Before
description: It's so dirty, they complain, making a face and drawing out the last word as if New York City had a chronic case of ringaroundthecollar. They sneer at the graffiti, wade through the litter, and try not to step in the dog dirt.

title: Soft Boxing, Dragon Temples and a Cure for the Common Cold
description: The outsider in San Francisco's China town rarely gets more than a glimpse of anything but the ornate street lanterns and crowded restaurants lining the tourist trapeze on Grant Street. Even natives of San Francisco know almost nothing about their most densely populated district, a city within a city, the largest Chinese community in the Occident.

title: Stacy N. Wardrop Sets Fall Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Wardrop 2d of Sewickley, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Stacy Noble Wardrop, to Ralph C. Roe 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth A. Roe of Greenwich, Conn. A wedding is planned for next fall.

title: BUBONIC PLAGUE HAZARD IN WEST
description: DENVER, July 17Western states from Colorado to California are experiencing what could be the worst outbreak of bubonic plague in recent years.

title: Lieut. G. A. Vassos 3d Weds Valerie J. Allen
description: In the United Methodist Church in Cold Spring Harbor, L. I., yesterday afternoon, Valerie Jean Allen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. William Allen of Huntington, L. I., became the bride of Lieut. George A. Vassos 3d, U.S.N., son of Dr. and Mrs. Vassos Jr. of Springfield, Mass. The Rev. Arthur Barton performed the ceremony.

title: 22 African Countries Boycott Opening Ceremony of Olympic Games
description: MONTREAL, July 17Twentytwo African nations, Taiwan, Iraq and Sri Lanka were absent from the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games today in a growing racial dispute that could extend through this competition and beyond.

title: Congo Is Seeking to Revive Economy
description: BRAZZAVILLE, Congo (Reuters)The leftist military Government has begun a determined effort to pull the economy out of stagnation and revise the state enterprises that proliferated in earlier attempts to control economic life.

title: Brazil Will Try a RightWing Writer
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 17The Brazilian Government announced this week that it would prosecute one of the nation's leading political columnists for offending a Cabinet minister in violation of national security laws.

title: GARDENING
description: DESIGN is of everincreasing importance in New Jersey's way of life. We see it expressed in gardens and in improved plant materials. The key to new and better plant materials is, of course, the practical plant breeder, usually an amateur dedicated to the production of superior characteristics in ornamental plants.

title: TWO U.S. AGENCIES SCORED BY U.M.W.
description: WASHINGTON, July 17The Interior and Justice Departments have been accused of not strictly enforcing the Federal Coal Mine Safety Program, which Congress has made more strineent in the last six years.

title: Taiwan Athletes Willing
description: MONTREAL, July 17  Members of the Nationalist China delegation were willing to compete in the Olympics with the unwanted name of Taiwan rather than drop out, one of the two American members of the International Olympic Committee disclosed today.

title: PEOPLE
description: IF you don't see what you want, just ask for It. That seems to be the philosophy followed by John W. Gray Jr., the superintendent of recreation and parks for the Town of Huntington. He encourages local residents to donate items to the town that might be beneficial to the public at large. So, in past years, his department has received such things as 50 trees for the Crab Meadow Golf Course in Northport, from a local nursery; a set of gym lockers from the Huntington Crescent Club and some cherry trees for the Huntington Village Green from a local women's organization.

title: EARL YOUNG LEADS TRAMMPS ASTRAY
description: The Trammps, who are enjoying considerable success as a leading purveyor of disco music, are a driving, jubilant band with a single problem. Unfortunately, the problem happens to be their leader, Earl Young.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1COURTESY NATHAN'S FAMOUS COLLECTION

title: 7 Die, Including 5 Siblings, In Suspicious Chicago Fire
description: CHICAGO, July 17 (UPI)An apartment building fire that the authorities said was set by arsonists trapped and fatally burned seven persons today, including five young brothers and sisters.

title: Notes: Getting Burned By Cigarette Taxes
description: In March, 1975, New York businessman Pierre Wilkins returned home from a trip to Bermuda. In June, 1976 15 months laterMr. Wilkins received a letter from the Department of Taxation and Finance of the State of New York, notifying him that he owed $11.25 on five cartons of cigar ettes he'd brought in from Bermuda$7.50 in tax and a $3.75 penalty. He had run afoul of a law that he and many thousands of other travelers have never heard ofa law that is more honored in the breach and that relies for its enforcement on the exchange of information among three separate governmental units.

title: Guys and Dolls Comes Back
description: Billy Wilson, director/ choreographer of the new black version of Guys and Dolls that opens at the Broadway Theater on Wednesday, reclined on his beige chaise in his Riverside Drive apartment the other night and tried to explain how he went about transforming the 26 year old Frank Loesser musical with a strongly Jewish flavor into a black show that he thinks is updated, soulful and hip.

title: Mary Lou Fuerst Affianced to Lawyer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Louis J. Fuerst Jr. of Garden City, L. I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Mary Lou Patricia Fuerst, to Michael Gerard Dolan, son of Charles Chertiza of Hicks ville, L. I., and the late Daniel J. Dolan.

title: Before Breakfast at Belmont, a Quick Course in Daylighting
description: The stubby figure of Fat Thacker moves with practiced ease through the silent, wintry darkness that envelops the training track at Belmont Park. With one hand barely holding the leather reins and the other pressed inside an insulated jacket, he lets Buck, a fleshy old horse, choose a path over the long, straight part of the track.

title: Ace Drag Racer Prudhomme Plans to Hold His Top Spot
description: Don (the Snake) Prudhomme is to drag racing what A. J. Foyt is to Indycar racing and Richard Petty is to stockcar racing. And, like Foyt and Petty, he is willing to devote a lot of time to staying on top.

title: A Business of Reservations
description: When George W. George first thought of setting up a system of computerized remote box offices seven years ago, the theater world thought his idea was no more feasible than the confusing inventions his father, the late Rube Goldberg, used to draw.

title: Decay Is Consuming a Park in Harlem Where Basketball StarstoBe Played
description: The park is not Old, but it is going slightly to seed. Grass pushes through the concrete in some places, there's grafitti on the handball courts and benches have boards missing. By the basketball court, some of the slats are broken on the bleachers, and the bolts on one of the baskets have been yankea loose, probably by a future pro practicing his skyhook slamdunk. It looks like a lot of neighborhood parks in this city.

title: Cline
description: LouisFerdinand Cline was a great and a unique French novelist whose finest booksJourney to the End of the Night, Death on the Installment Plan and Castle to Castledo not easily quit the mind. He belonged to no school, unless Villon and Rabelais are schools, and left no disciples except a few minor authors who, as a rule, share some fragment of his bitterness or his obsessions about Jews but no part whatever of his talent (What a lot of racist, miserly, backbiting Frenchmen such as Cline have been glorious writers! The seed of genius is blind.) Celine, at odds with himself, was never comfortable with any party or following, but it is undeniable that both upper and lowercase fascists have always felt comfortable with him.

title: Wagner's Dream 100 Years Later
description: BAYREUTH The Bayreuth Festival opens this Friday with a special performance of Die Meistersinger. That is because this summer marks a special occasion. It is centenary of the famous festival devoted to the operas of Richard Wagner. Die Meistersinger will be receiving only this one performance. Then the festival gets down to basics with a complete Ring cycle, Tristan kind of opera. Pierre Boulez, who will conduct the Ring cycle, has never directed any of the four operas that make up the tetraldgy. The only Wagner opera with which he has had direct experience is Parsifal, which he is not conducting this summer. Patrice Chereau, who will stage the Ring, is a 30yearold director whose operatic experience is limited to two productions.

title: The World
description: The newly reunified nation of Vietnam, whose leaders until a month ago were denouncing neighboring countries for neocolonialist policies, has suddenly moved to establish normal diplomatic ties with the Philippines and Thailand.

title: Andujar Triumphs On Cedeno Clout
description: Tom Seaver barely looked up when Mickey Lolich pul the black plaster cobrathe Mets award for outstanding bad luckabove his locker after yesterday's game with the Houston Astros.

title: More Students Looking For Higher Education
description: ALBANY, July 17 (UPI)sThe number of New York State high school graduates who continued with some form of secondary education in 1975 rose for the first time in three years, according to the State Education Department.

title: Olympics Names Standby Teams
description: MONTREAL, July 17 (UPI) Five teams for field hockey were named today to take the place of countries droppins out of the Olympic competition starting tomorrow.

title: Richard Bolitho, Midshipman
description: The sea story is one of the most enduring and enjoyable staples in popular literature. Tales of stout men under sail, hurling iron across the water at one anotner were absolute dynamite when Frederick Marryat held a huge readership wired to their seats in the early 19th century with his stories about Midshipman Easy. The Horatio Hornblower novels of C. S. Forester were among the most genuinely satisfying novels, of the last forty years, and now that Alexander Kent is patrolling the same sea lanes the stories are as good as ever. That these stories are all pretty much the same hardly matters to those of us who love them. The first Forester novel I read was Ship of the Line. If airyone had told me then that from that moment on I could read only one book but it would be an endless Hornblower adventure stretching out to the end of my days, 1 would have been content. Little has been published since then to change my mind.

title: Jet Veterans Sport Lean, Hungry Look
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., July 17 Lean, hungry and perhaps a little scared, the dwindling contingent of New York Jets veterans turned out today for the annual ritual of being photographed.

title: The Region
description: The strike against 57 New York City hospitals and nursing homes has ended, With both sides agreeing to resolve the dispute through binding arbitration.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Of all forms of the mystery genre, the suspense novel seems to be the one that often most closely approaches literature. It is not the puzzle that is of primary importance, as in the straight mystery. It is not action, or espionage, or romance. Rather it is, in the hands of its best practitioners, a delicate investigation into character: into the workings of the mind, into relationships between people. To do this well, a deft and understanding literary style is a prerequisite.

title: Kingsley, State Czar Of Movies, Stars Again
description: ANARROW dirt road, overhung with trees, winds along the banks of the Ramapo River to a 250yearold white clapboard house and a saltwater swimming pool. Two empty lawn chairs sit beneath leafy tree.

title: Public Links Golf Is Taken by Mudd
description: COON RAPIDS, Minn,. July 17 (AP)Eddie Mudd of Louisville, Ky., won the United States Public Links golf tournament today with a 37hole, matchplay victory over Archie Dadian of Milwaukee.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The Atlanta Braves are in Shea Stadium today at 2:05 P.M. and tomorrow night at 8:05 for games against the Mets. On Wednesday night at 8 and Thursday afternoon at 2, the Oakland A's play the Yankees in Yankee Stadium. The Yankees play host to the Boston Red Sox Friday night at 8 and Saturday and Sunday afternoons at 2.

title: President Signs Bill Revising the Rules On Use of the Flag
description: WASHINGTON, July 17President Ford has signed legislation that for the first time in 34 years revises the rules governing the use of the American flag.

title: U.S. WITHDRAWAL UPSEETS LEBANESE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 17Tension increased sharply in Moslemcontrolled west Beirut today, at least partly as a result of an announcement by the American Embassy that it was organizing another evacuation of foreign citizens and was strongly urging all American citizens to leave.

title: Miss Licandro Is Bride
description: Josephine Licandro, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rudolph A. Licandro of Muttontown, L. I., was married yesterday in Brookville, L. I., to Arthur Adams Rouse, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert K. Rouse of Daytona Beach, Fla. The Rev. Lawrence Chadwick performed the ceremony in St. Paul the Apostle Roman Catholic Church.

title: Spanish Amnesty Expected in Days; Opposition Pleased
description: MADRID, July 17King Juan Carlos is expected to put into effect in the next few days a partial political amnesty promised early this morning by the new Government.

title: Karen A. Tully Married
description: Karen A. Tully and Patrick E. Duffy, graduates of Marist College in Poughkeepsie, N. Y., were married yesterday morning in St. Peter of Alcantara Roman Catholic Church in Port Washington, L. I., by the Rev. Gerard Fagan. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Gerard P. Tully of Sands Point, L. 1., and Mr. and Mrs. Gerald H. Duffy of Philadelphia.

title: Group Is Seeking to Buy Mrs. Roosevelt's Home
description: HYDE PARKThe peace of it is divine, Eleanor Roosevelt wrote to her husband on April 12, 1926, from ValKill, her hideaway here from her imperious motherinlaw, Sara Delano Roosevelt, and what she considered the oppressive atmosphere at the Roosevelt mansion overlooking the Hudson River.

title: Spacecraft Voyages Alter Man's Concept of Planets
description: PASADENA, Calif., July 17Twice in history a series of great voyages, compressed within a few decades, have vastly extended the horizons of knowledge. The first began with the 1492 voyage of Columbus. The second may reach its climax on Tuesday when a Viking lander descends to the surface of Mars.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Three new tenants and one that is expanding at One Dag Hammarskjold Plaza, have signed leases for 89,220 square feet of office space at an aggregate rent of more than $13 million. The leases range from 10 to 15 years.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The widow of Alexander Brailowsky, the concert pianist, has told the police that three antique clocks worth $75,000 were stolen from her East Side town house while she was shopping for groceries. The woman, Felicia Brailowsky, said she was puzzled by the theft, which occurred between 5:15 P.M. and 5:30 P.M. Friday. She said she could not understand why expensive paintings and other valuables were ignored by the burglars.

title: For the L.I.R.R., a Question of Culpability
description: THE Metropolitan Transportation Authority has started a review of the controversial case of Roy W. Tate, a Long Island Rail Road engineer who was dismissed in 1973 after the passenger train he was operating collided with a standing freight train at the Ronkonkoma station.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A MORE ON GINKGO TREE FRUITS (June 13) L.B.S., Kingston, N.Y., lived on a campus that has two 100yearold ginkgo trees and an old male tree. The female bears odoriferous fruits and he asked if there was any way to prevent fruit formation. We have received a letter from Eric Christensen, a retired professor of biology, who has worked with ginkgo trees for many years. He explains that the tiny newlyemerged ovules of the female ginkgo trees have been made to drop off by spraying with maleic hydrazide, an herbicide. The treatment can be made only during a very few days in early April when the buds are just opening. Or the trees can be pollarded,. by cutting back all wood that bears spur shoots since the fruits form only on oldgrowth wood on the peglike spur shoots. Cutting back will have to be repeated through the years.

title: Edgar P. Baker. 69. Dead; Lawyer and Vassar Trustee
description: Edgar Park Baker, senior partner in the law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy, died yesterday at Inglewood (N. J.) Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived in Inglewood.

title: (But Then, at the Olympics, It's Just Politics as Usual)
description: Olympic mythology tells us that the international sporting process involves the moral as well as physical development of amateur athletes who celebrate their joy and skill in the Olympic Games.

title: Two More Unions Join National Strike At Westinghouse
description: PITTSBURGH, Sunday, July 18 (UPI)Two major unions, dissatisfied with the latest contract offer, struck the Westinghouse Electric Corporation at midnight last night, closing nearly all of the company's 165 plants and repair shops across the nation.

description: MONTREAL, July 17Mike Boit, who usually runs every day, rain or shine, scratched his morning workout today because I didn't feel like running with all the confusion,

title: Atlantic City Bets on Casinos

description: AMAGANSETTPaintings and graphics by Ronald Julius Christensen through July 26, daily except Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10:30 A.M. to 5:30 P.M., Gallery East Hampton, Main St.

description: Michael Kane is a study in composurea cool gaze from behind rimless glasses, a firm handshake, lips compressed into a straight line. He is trying hard to forget his 18

title: David Graham, 201, Leads by 4 Strokes
description: HARRISON. N.Y., July 17 It rained hard and long last night, the wind came up today in vigorous gusts, and the course played longer. All this shook up the field in the third round of the Westchester Classic, but when all the shaking was done David Graham had weathered it and was still in front by four strokes.

title: CAPTOR OF CHIANG IS STILL CAPTIVE
description: PEITOU. TaiwanIn a carefully guarded house set in a spacious wooded grove on a mountain above Taipei lives a 78yearold whitehaired man who 40 years ago kidnapped Chiang Kaishek and brought him together with Chou Enlai.

title: The World
description: Israel's successful raid at Uganda's Entebbe Airport to rescue 103 hostages, has, as was expectable, greatly benefited Israel, both internally and externally. But the event has produced no agreement on a procedure to be followed in future acts of international terrorism.

description: Candidate's Progress

title: Margaret C. Howell, a Student, Is Married to Rev. Renny Scott
description: Margaret Carr Howell was married in Atlanta last evening at the home of her mother, Frances Richardson Howell, to the Rev. Henry Lawrence Scott Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Scott of Charles ton, S. C. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Everett L. Fullam, rector of St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Darien, Conn., of which the bridegroom is associate rector.

title: STAMPS
description: A commemorative for Clara Maass, a young nurse who at the turn of the century gave her life in the struggle to overcome yellow fever, is being issued by the United States In a tribute that comes within days of the 100th anniversary of her birth.

title: Owner Looks to Rich Harness Event
description: At a press conference last week to announce the fields for the trials of next Sunday's MonticelloNew York City OTH ClasSic, Helen Boehm, widow of the noted porcelain sculptor, Edward Marshall Boehm, attracted a small group of people with talk of dining with President Ford, of meeting Queen Elizabeth and of presenting the last of a grouping of a Swans of Peace sculpture to Pope Paul VI at the Vatican.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today  Century, Old Field Club, Stony Brook, L.I. Green, amateurowner, special, junior, nonthoroughbred, young and children's workers hunters; open, preliminary, amateurowner and junior jumpers; green conformation hunters, pleasure, adult horsemanship, ponies, equitation. 8:30 A.M.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: You will hardly be surprised to be told, if you did not already know, that societies exist to perpetuate the art of Beethoven, Bach and Toscanini. But did you know, or could you even  guess, that there are people out there somewhere working to direct the world's attention to the art of Nelson Eddy? Or bir ??? ??? Or Michael William Balfe? There are. I also have it on the authority of John R. Douglas of San Jose, Calif., that there are at least three Mario Lanza societies: the Mario Lanza Institute of New Castle, Del., the International Mario and Betty Lanza Society of Banbury, Oxon., England, and the Kreis der Mario Lanza Freunde of Berlin. Mr. Douglas, who is a librarian and coordinator for the performing arts at the California State University of San Jose, has been collecting information about such musical and nearmusical associations for several years and recently published scans of his findings in the Bulletin of Bibliography (spring issue, 1976).

title: Opening of Olympics Is Hailed in Montreal
description: MONTREAL, July 17  For the first time since the ancient Olympic Games were revived 80 years ago to encourage brotherhood among nations, country after country quit the global carnival in anger today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. arriving in Sacramento, Calif., on Friday.

title: Priscilla Jane Feagles Is Married
description: Priscilla Jane Feagles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert West Feagles of West Hartford, Conn., and Fisher's Island, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to William Theodore Koch Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Koch of Little Silver, N. J.

title: Aussies Find Pace Too Fast to Believe
description: MONTREAL, July 17 Imagine the surprise of the Australian team when instructions were posted for the oneningday parade:

title: In and out of asylums and through the therapies
description: Kenneth Donaldson spent 15 years in a state mental hospital struggling for his release from the doctors and administrators appointed by the state as his protectors. Suddenly subjected to an involuntary hospitalization initiated by his parents without explanation, Donaldson found the medical and legal bureaucracies arrayed against him with the implacability of Kafka's castle against Joseph K. Insanity Inside Out is his powerful story of the injustices that are done in the name of caring for the mentally ill.

title: Abel's Island
description: Abelard, or Abel as he is known to his intimates, is a mouse of means, newly married to the gently raised, sweetly loving Amanda. It is the occasion of their nuptial picnica tender pastoral celebration of their union, with hardboiled eggs, caviar, and all of life before them. Suddenly a violent storm breaks over them and they run for cover. Amanda looses her dainty scarf and Abelard, in a characteristic courtly gesture, attempts to recover it and is swept away. Battered, blown and nearly drowned, he is washed up on an island in the middle of a swollen river. Abel's survival, rescue and reunion with his loved one the stuff of all legends and high adventureare the principal ingredients of Abel's story.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The XXI Olympic Games were opened in Montreal yesterday by Queen Elizabeth II of Britain, despite political and social disputes and the withdrawal of protesting nations that sharply reduced he number of competitors. When the teams from 94 nations had marched in to martial music and cheers25 nations defected at the last hour the Queen spoke the prescribed 16 words: I declare open the Olympic Games of Montreal celebrating the XXI Olympiad of the modern era. About 70,000 spectators had paid up to $40 a seatif they did not get the tickets from scalpers and paid moreto sit in the vast threetiered Olympic oval. [Page 1, Columns 14.]

title: Miss Sherman Wed in Darien
description: Susan Kay Sherman and Richard Samuel Karplus, doctoral candidates at the University of Chicago were married yesterday afternoon in Darien, Conn. The Rev. Dr. James Annand performed the ceremony in St. Luke's Episcopal Church. The Revs. Donald and Elizabeth Frazier, Congregational ministers and uncle and aunt of the bridegroom, took part in the ceremony.

title: CORRECTION
description: The June 27 article in tide section about contact lenses stated incorrectly that the Rynco Scientific Corporation sued Danker & Wohlk Inc. for patent infringement. Actually, Danker & Wohlk having been advised by Rynco of an alleged patent infringement by Danker & Wohlkinstituted a suit in Federal court last April 2. against Rynco, challenging the validity of Rynco's patent.

title: LETTERS
description: To The Editor: Is it really possible that Arthur Ballet, Arvin Brown, Gordon Davidson, Karl Eigsti, Alvin Epstein, Michael Feingold, Thomas Fichandler, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Earle Gister, Michael Kahn, Robert Kalfin, Woodie King, Edith Markson, Robert Moss, Sara O'Connor, Lloyd Richards, Duncan Ross and Joan Sandler would plan a fourday national theater conference merely to discuss imagebuilding, as Robert Brustein stated in his article ['Art Versus Arts Advocacy in the Non  Commercial Theater, July 4]? Is it really possible that the other 223 participants representing America's nonprofit professional theater would also waste their time and money to do so?

title: Ideas &
description: Scientific and diplomatic representatives of 12 countries, including the United States and the Soviet Union, have concluded a twoweek meeting in Paris on the possible future exploitation of the considerable mineral resources Antarctica is likely to contain.

title: Stalking the Biggest Trophy of All
description: LATTINGTOWN WALTER COOK, who began huntas a child with a bow and arrow in a city park, says he is just five animals away from his goal of shooting all 27 species of North American big game.

title: Ethnic Chinese Flee Malay Pressure
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Jin Nam, a 74yearold farmer in a village 10 miles from Ipoh, in northern Malaysia, has never been allowed to own his land.

title: FRESH AIR GROUP OFF TO OLYMPICS
description: Billy Carr is going to the Olympic Games in Montreal. The 14yearold plays basket ball and wants to watch the stars in action. It is his first trio away from home.

title: For the Arts, Aid Isn't Enough
description: IREAD with great interest the article entitled One Big Plan for the Arts by John W. Maerhofer in the Long Island Weekly [Opinion Page] on June 20. The contents of this long dissertation can be expressed simply with Give me more and assure me for at least five years that I'll get more, more and more.

title: WAGE FREEZE URGED ON NEW YORK CITY
description: A wage freeze for 11,000 generalmaintenance workers employed by the city was proposed yesterday in a study issued by the New York Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

title: Jailed Yugoslav Writer Ends His Hunger Strike
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 17 (Reuters)A jailed Yugoslav writer, Mihajlo Mihajlov said today he had ended a hunger strike begun in May. But he threatened to repeat the protest.

title: The LoveIn
description: The congenial proceedings of the Democratic convention in New York City have reinforced the impression that the respective conditions of the two major parties, four months before the election, are at polar extremes: The Democrats have rarely looked so strong and the Republicans so weak.

title: On Stage: Benedict Arnold
description: WAY, way offoff Broadway, in a luxury apartment complex on the Hudson, an unusual troupe of New Jerseyans is looking for glory in one of the darkest espisodes of the American Revolution.

title: Miss Buzash Bride of F. B. Pollert
description: Elizabeth Ann Buzash, holder of a Ph.D. in genetics and cell biology, was married yesterday afternoon to Frederick Bruce Pollert, a senior management analyst with the Suffolk County Executive's office in Riverhead, L. I.

title: Tickets to Unity
description: NEW JERSEY'S delegates to the Democratic National Convention spent a good part of last week milling about in the lobby of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, plotting ways to get tickets to the convention from State Senator James P. Dugan, the party's state chairman and the delegation's floor manager.

title: Cooper Triumphs in Etchells22 Class At Opening of Larchmont Race Week
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 17Larchmont Race Week began today on an auspicious note as one of those wonderful northwest winds arrived to clear out the haze and humidity and delight about 1,000 sailors who staffed the 267 competing yachts.

title: Vote on GuineaBissau Unity With Cape Verde Planned
description: PRAIA, Cape Verde, July 17 (Agence FrancePresse)President Aristides Pereira said today that a referendum would be held by the peoples of Cape Verde Islands and GuineaBissau on a merger of the two countries.

title: Computer Theft
description: Every day, oceans of data flow over the nation's telephone wires as computers talk to computers. These conversations form part of the process of both government and private organizations in developing centralized control over dispersed national and regional operations.

title: COURT OVERRULES WIRETAP DECISION
description: A Federal appeals court has reversed a ruling that required the New York Telephone Company to help Government agents install and operate a device to record the numbers dialed on the telephone of a gambling suspect.

title: The Realignment In Southeast Asia
description: WASHINGTON  During the period of dissent against the war in Vietnam, critics of American intervention often argued that if the United States had left Ho Chi Minh alone, he would have become the Tito of Southeast Asia and therefore no threat.

description: SAN JUAN, P.R.When Rafael Hernandez Colon, the Governor of Puerto Rico, was rushing to the airport to meet President Ford last month, his limousine blew a tire.

description: WASHINGTON. July 17The mystery surrounding the abrupt dismissal of the secondranking Official of the Federal Bureau of Investigation deepened today amid suggestions from several Justice Department sources that the action was unrelated to either of the two criminal investigations of the bureau now under way.

description: PARIS, July 17Nationwide attention has been focused this week on whether the charred body of a man found in the ruins of a burnedout house in eastern France was that of a Nazi war criminal.
