title: Alaskan Pipeline Official Says Flow Will Begin by Mid1977
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (Reuters) The transAlaska pipeline Is only four weeks behind schedule despite welding problems that could cost up to S55 million, the head of the company in charge of its construction said today.

title: Egypt and Sudan Conclude Accord On Mutual Defense
description: CAIRO, July 19 Egypt has signed a mutual defense agreement with the Sudan, the Egyptian Government press agency said here tonight.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The International Olympic Committee said yesterday that 17 nations and 465 delegates had officially left Olympic Village in Montreal or made final plans to do so. The withdrawal, led by predominantly black African countries, resulted from New Zealand's approval of a rugby team's tour of South Africa despite that country's apartheid policy. Among the departing countries were Kenya, Nigeria and Ethiopia. [Page 1, Column 4.]

title: Tax Bills Pass in Senate With Contents Unknown
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 Senator Lloyd Bentsen is responsible for inserting into the current tax bill at least 10 provisions that benefit just a few companies each. Precisely how many Bantsen proposais the bill contains is not easily determined.

title: Destroying the Olympics
description: The abrupt withdrawal of over a dozen national teams from the Montreal Olympicsand, more fundamentally, the farreaching political attitudes thus displayedbrings explosively to the fore the longsimmering issue of whether the Olympic Games, as presently organized, are worth holding. We think they are not.

title: Ricochet Wins Mackinac Yacht Race
description: MACKINAC ISLAND, Mich., July 19 (AP) Ricochet. the world Two Ton champion owned by Henry Burkard of the host Bayview Yacht Club, was declared the winner of the 52d annual Port HurontoMackinac Island yacht race today. Her corrected time in Class A was 36 hours 41.01 minutes.

title: PAUL BALSER
description: Paul Balser, a retired high school principal, died July 12 of a heart atack while playing golf at Heritage Village Golf Club, Southbury, Conn. He was 67 years old and lived in Holliswood, Queens.

title: Helping New York
description: It was Jerry Barnwell's birthday, and since he had not spoken except for an occasional monosyllable since he entered the Broadjump summer program nine days ago, the director thought a surprise party might help

title: OVERSEAS FUNDS WEIGH U.S, SALES
description: WASHINGTON, July 19At least five foreign mutual funds have made preliminary approaches to the Securities and Exchange Commission for permission to sell their shares in this country, officials of the agency's investment management division said today.

title: 3,000 COAL MINERS STRIKE IN PROTEST
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., July 19 (AP)  Thousands of coal miners went on strike today in West Virginia, angered by what they called unfair Federal court intervention in union affairs.

title: PRESIDENT CALLS FOR A PROSECUTOR OF U.S. OFFICIALS
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 President Ford called today for the creation of a permanent special prosecutor's office to investigate wrongdoing by Government officials. He also said that it would be up to the American people to decide whether his pardon of President Nixon would be a campaign issue.

title: Soviet Fencer Disqualified for Cheating
description: MONTREAL July 19 The long history of Olympic controversy took a bizarre turn today when a star Soviet athlete was disqualified after he had been caught using an illegal electronic device in his pe in the fencing event of the modern pentathlon.

title: Decline of Water Quality Laid to Sewage Plant Program
description: The water quality in the rivers and bays surrounding New York City declined steadily between 1969 and 1975 because of what city officials have described as a temporary increase in rawsewage discharges.

title: NEIGHBOR IS GUILTY IN KILLING OF FAMILY
description: DOYLESTOWN, Pa., July 19 (AP) George Geschwendt was convicted of six counts of firstdegree murder today in the killing of a suburban Philadelphia family last March. The verdicts were returned by the Bucks County Common Pleas Court. He faces a sentence of either death or life in prison.

title: Sam Shain, 75, Publisher Of Motion Picture Journal
description: Sam Shain, founder in 1957 of the International Motion Picture Exhibitor, a trade journal that ceased publishing two years ago, died Saturday at, Doctors Hospital in Miami. He was 75 years old.

title: TV Coverage Planned For Landing on Mars
description: The three television networks said yesterday that they would provide spot coverage this morning of the Viking I landing attempt on Mars according to the Associated Press.

title: Suffolk Panel Calls for a Moratorium On the Controversial Sewer Project
description: A special committee appointed by the Suffolk County Legislature recommended yesterday that work be halted quickly on the county's controversial $1.5 billion Southwest Sewer District project and that no new contracts be awarded until the project could be redesigned and pared down.

title: Soares Outlines His Foreign Policy Aims
description: LISBON, July 19 Mario Soares, Portugal's Prime Ministerdesignate, said today that his Government would seek a more active role in the Atlantic alliance and integration into all of the European institutions.

title: Tax Bills Pass in Senate With Contents Unknown
description: WASHINGTON, July 19Senator Lloyd Bentsen is responsible for inserting into the current tax bill at least 10 provisions that benefit just a few companies each. Precisely how many Bentsen proposals the bill contains is not easily determined.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An earlymorning joy ride in a stolen 1968 Dodge ended in a fiery crash and death for one of the six boys riding it.

title: Suspect in Slaying Of 2 Hell's Angels Killed With Shotgun
description: TRUNIBULL, Conn., July 19 (UPI)A Trumbull man whose life was threatened after he killed two members of the Hell's Angels motorcycle club during a barroom shootout was killed early today by a shotgun blast, the police said.

title: CARBIDE WILL BUY RORER SUBSIDIARY
description: RorerAmchem Inc., of Fort Washington, Pa., announced yesterday that it had entered into an agreement in principle to merge a subsidiary into the Union Carbide Corporation through an exMerger change of stock valued at $140 million. Under the News proposed plan, Rorer  Amchem would distribute to its shareholders all of the stock of Amchem Products, which is A wholly owned subsidiary.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: BIG SPRING, Tex., July 19 (UPI)  City officials said at least eight persons were injured last night in an explosion and fire at an oil and chemical refinery. Most of the injured were treated ant released from a hospital.

title: Talking Tough on Terrorism
description: One of the biggest roars of applause of the entire Democratic convention went to Walter Mondale when in his acceptance speech he declared that we reject . . . the idea that this nation must sit by passively while terrorists maim and murder innocent men, women and children.

title: Pirates Slay Two On Crippled Sloop, Coast Guard Says
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, July 19 (UPI) Two Americans were slain yesterday by four Spanishspeaking pirates who hoarded their crippled sailing sloop off the coast of Colombia, according to the Coast Guard. Two other Americans survived the early morning attack.

title: ADULTERER SEEKS HIS OLD POLICE JOB
description: Declaring that adultery is rather commonplace, a Nassau County police sergeant who said he had been dismissed because he had had an affair filed suit yesterday to regain his $18,000ayear job and asked $1.5 million in damages.

title: Europe's TV News Stars Begin to Shine
description: PARIS, July 19 European television, after decades of staid if not stodgy presentation of the news, is rapidly developingwith a smile here and a smirk there and a nuance of inflectionits own newscasting personalities.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: Con Ed Repairman Rescues Swimmer From East River
description: A 39yearold Consolidated Edison repairman who nearly drowned a few days ago during a swim off Orchard Beach in the Bronx yesterday rescuod a 64yearold man from the strong currents of the East River off the utility's plant in Astoria, Oucens.

title: EDNA CAREY SELBY
description: Edna Carey Selby, who retired 10 years ago as a purchasing agent for the W. J. Barney, Corporation, a New York building contractor, died Saturday in Community Medical Center, Morristown, N. J., at the age of 76, She lived at 2 Page Street, Madison, N. J., and had previously lived in Manhattan.

title: TV: Olympics Are Battered by Commercialism
description: As television coverage of the summer Olympics began Saturday afternoon, the picture was stunning. Montreal was seen from the air in wide panoramic shots while an announcer delivered a thumbnail history of the city. Attractive graphics were used to present the logos of the Games and ABC Snorts. Then, without missing a beat, the graphics continued with the logos of Sears, Schlitz, Kodak and Brut, some of the major television sponsors. Already clobbered by politics, the games were being visibly battered by commercialism.

title: U.S. Seeks Curbs On Bankers Fees In Loan Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (UPI) The Comptroller of the Currency proposed a regulation today that would prevent hank presidents and other highranking bank officials from making commissions on the sale of credit life insurance.

title: U.S. Is Prepared to Offer Singapore 21 Jet Fighters
description: U.S. Is Prepared to Offer Singapore 21 Jet Fighters

title: New York Opens a Study Of Hospital Strike Deaths
description: A study was begun yesterday by the New York City Health Department to find out how many deaths, if any, might have been caused by the 11day hospital strike that ended last Saturday.

title: Books of The Times
description: Is Charles O. Finley, the egregious owner of the Oakland A's baseball team, of any ultimate moral consequence? I doubt it, though he is every sportswriter's favorite pig's bladder to kick around, and though Alvin Dark, Finley's 6th and 12th manager (in 15 years), preached to a Baptist congregation last year that if [Finley] doesn't accept Jesus Christ as his personal savior, he's going to hell'for which prognostication Finley promptly dismissed Dark, thinking no doubt like some Greek of old that if he couldn't dismiss the bad news he could at least dispose of the messenger. I would imagine that by the time the year 2000 rolls around, the impact of Finley on the 20th century will seem to signify about as much as the amount of alcohol drunk during the 1939 season by Cletus Elwood Poffenberger.

title: Cuevas Wins Welterweight Title
description: MEXICALI, Mexico, July 19 (AP) Jose (Pipino) Cuevas of Mexico has become the new welterweight champion of the World Boxing Association. He scored a technical knockout in the second round of a scheduled 15round bout with Angel Espada, the defending champion, of Puerto Rico.

title: The C.I.A. Cloud Over the Press
description: ASPEN, Colo.One of William E. Colby's less exhilarating moments as Director of Central Intelligence was having to call a news conference to demand deletion from the Senate report on assassination plots of a dozen names, including such underworld figures as Sam Giancana and John Russelli.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: United Press International

title: Angola Leader to Visit Cuba At the Invitation of Castro
description: HAVANA, July 19 (Reuters) President Agostinho Neto of Angola will visit Cuba soon at the invitation of Prime Minister Fidel Castro; it was announced here today.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Reds, at Cincinnati, (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadioWNEW, 8 P.M.) Yankees vs. White Sox, at Chicago. (TelevisionChannel 11, 9 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 9 P.M.)

title: Con Ed Repairman Rescues Swimmer From East River
description: A 39yearold Consolidated Edison repairman who nearly drowned a few days ago during a swim off Orchard beach in the Bronx yesterday ??? a 64yearold man from the strong currents of the East River off the utility's plant in Astoria, queens.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: kickback case, including specially selected agents of the F.B.T. and the Internal Revenue Service, made inquiries about the use of the recreational fund.

title: MONMOUTH URGED FOR SOLAR ENERGY
description: TRENTON, July 19  New Jersey's Congressional delegation will be briefed Thursday on the state's proposal for locating the National Solar Energy Research Institute in vacant office and laboratory space at Fort Monmouth.

title: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers

title: Zachry and Reds Stop Pirates, 4 to 2
description: Pat Zachry, who spent six seasons in the minor leagues before he made the Cincinnati trainingcamp roster this spring, held the hardhitting Pirates to five hits last night as the Reds scored a 42 victory in Pittsburgh's Three Rivers Stadium.

title: Stassen Seeks Support Of Republican Delegates
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 19 (UPI) Harold E. Stassen, running for the Republican Presidential nomination for the sixth time, sent a letter today to party delegates seeking their support.

title: Soviet Fencer Disqualified for Cheating
description: MONTREAL, July 19The long history of Olympic controversy took a bizarre turn today when a star Soviet athlete was disqualified after he had been caught using an illegal electronic device in his pe in the fencing event of the modern pentathlon.

title: The Test at Coop City
description: The residents of the mammoth Coop City housing project in the Bronx, most of whom have long and bitterly resisted a sharp increase in their apartmentmaintenance charges, are now in a new position: Put up or shut up. They have, in effect, been given six months to prove their contention that the disputed 25 percent rise in maintenance charges, which New York State housing officials called necessary because of sharply rising costs, is, in fact, not needed and can be avoided with more efficient and creative management.

title: Westinghouse Reaches Salaried Worker Pact
description: PITTSBURGH, July 19 (UPI)  The Westinghouse Electric Corporation reached a contract agreement today with a union representing 12,500 nonstriking salaried employees and held aroundtheclock negotiations with bargainers for 41,000 striking electrical workers.

title: Torre Draws With Karpov, Leading Manila Tourney
description: MANILA, July 19 (Reuter) Eugene Torre of the Philippines today clinched an unexpected victory in a double roundrobin chess tournament here by drawing his fifthround match with the world champion, Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union, in 22 moves.

title: Ferrari Protests Hunt's Victory
description: BRANDS HATCH, England, July 19 (AP) Bitter controversy arose today over the Ferrari team's decision to appeal the victory by James Hunt of Britain in the British Grand Prix here yesterday. Ferrari's protest was turned down by race officials of the Royal Automobile Club, but Ferrari said it intended to take the appeal to the sport's governing body, the International Sporting Commission.

title: Wall Posters in Nanking Accuse Provincial Leaders
description: PEKING, July 19 (Reuters) wall posters have been pasted up in Nanking strongly attacking provincial leaders, travelers arriving here reported today.

title: Future King Sampled U.S. Life in 1797
description: PARIS, July 19 The future King of France, Louis Philippe, Duke of Orleans, was 24 years old when he and his two younger brothers, the Duke of Montpensier and the Count of Beaujolais, with their manservant Beaudoin, visited the United States in 1797.

title: City Offers to Shift 85 Staten Is. Acres To State for Park
description: An offer to transfer up to 85 acres of cityowned land on Staten Island to the state for the development of a 200acre state park in the Clay Pit Pond Wetlands to preserve wildlife and plant life there was announced yesterday.

title: Johnson Dismissed By Red Sox
description: BOSTON, July 19 (UPI) Darrell Johnson, who led the Boston Red Sox to the American League pennant last year, was dismissed as manthirdbase today. Don Zimmer, thirdbase coach, was named to, take over for the rest of the season.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: SUNDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES.

title: Levi Seeks Basis for F.B.I. To ReEnter Abduction Case
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (UPI) Attorney General Edward H. Levi said today that he was seeking additional facts that would enable the Federal Bureau of Investigation to reenter the investigation of the kidnapping of 26 children and a bus driver at Chowchilla, Calif.

title: EARNINGS AT G.T.E. ROSE IN HALF YEAR
description: The General Telephone & Electronics Corporation, the second largest telephone company, reported yesterday that its earnings in the six months ended June 30 rose to $180.9 ended June 30 rose to $194.1 million from $168.7 million on a sales increase of 13 percent to $3.2 billion from $2.8 billion.

title: Woman Dies in Car Crash
description: BELMAR, N. J., July 19 (AP) A Pearl River, N. Y., woman died and a Belmar man was injured yesterday in a twocar crash here. The woman, Susan Cozewith, 19 years old, was pronounced dead at the Jersey Shore Medical Center, authorities said. Robert P. Callanan, 21, who was in the car with Miss Cozewith, was listed in satisfactory condition at the Neptune hospital with multiple injuries. The driver of the second car, Robert Jacobsen, 22, of Jersey City was treated at the hospital and released.

title: 2 Held on StolenGoods
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., July 19 (AP)  Two New York City men were arraigned here today in United States District Court on charges of interstate transportation or stolen property. The men, Albert Sarkis, 32 years old, and John Rodriguez, 31, were arrested yesterday in Rock Island, Que., by Royal Canadian Mounted Police, who said the men had been carrying more than $5,100 in stolen securities.

title: Note to Readers
description: Stocks traded on the New York and American exchanges and over the counter are listed in today's editions under the old system of alphabetizing companies whose legal names consist of capital letters within the list rather than all at the beginning. The overthecounter list also is being printed with separate industrial, bank and insurance lists instead of a single list.

title: Midwest Exchange's Board Backs Option Trading Plan
description: CHICAGO, July 19 (Reuters) The Midwest Stock Exchange said today its board of governors had approved a plan to create 200 new options trading memberships and give each of its 435 members the right to purchase options trading privileges.

title: A Taiwan Protest
description: A group calling itself the Ad Hoc Committee for Keeping Politics Out of the Olympics showed up at the offices of the Canadian Consulate in the Exxon Building at. 50th Street and Avenue of the Americas yesterday to protest the exclusion of Taiwan from the Olympics.

title: People and Business
description: Walter W. Heller, a former economic adviser to President John F. Kennedy and President Lyndon B. Johnson, predicted yesterday a long sustained economic recovery in the United States without a serious resurgence of inflation.

title: Multinational Job Impact Studied
description: ASPEN, Colo.Multinational corporations provide only a handful of jobs in the developing countries and possibly displace more worker; than they hire, according to Constantine V. Vaitsos, chief of the Science and Technology, Policy Group of the Andean, Pact.

title: TRIBAL FIGHTS KILL 6 IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, July 19 (AP) Six blacks have been killed in tribal clashes in the eastern Transvaal, and a South African soldier and two black guerrillas died in weekend clashes in SouthWest Africa. Government officials said today.

title: $10 Million Haul Reported at Riviera Bank
description: NICE, France, Tuesday, July $20 (Agence FrancePresse) A minutely planned, twoandahalfday operation neeted weekend robbers of an unguarded Nice bank at least $10 million, possibly history's largest crime haul, a police source said early today.

title: Soviet Names Shipyard Aide
description: MOSCOW, July 19 (AP) Mikhail V. Ycgorov has been named Minister of Shipbuilding, replacing Boris Y. Buloma, who died July 11, it was announced today.

title: SIBERIA NAVY YARD IS REPORTED BUILT
description: To have recently completed a fourth naval shipyard in Far Eastern Siberia.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CLOUDLAND Tonight through Aug. 1, high on the 65th floor at Rockefeller Center, the sophisticated splendor of the Rainbow Room will house dance music by Bobby Rosengarden and his band, with vocals by Maxine Sullivan of latterday Loch Lomond fame. A reviewer for The New York Times has written that the music by Mr. Rosengarden, the maestro drummer, represents the ultimate polishing of the Swing Era ideal.

title: F.D.A. CHIEF CITES TEST DATA PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (AP) Deficiencies in animal test data for drugs and other products have turned out to be more widespread than I would have guessed, the head of the Food and Drug Administration said today at a Senate hearing.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: The New York Times/Bob Glass

title: Two More Japanese Held In Lockheed Payoff Inquiry
description: TOKYO, July 19 (AP) Prosecutors investigating the Lockheed payoffs arrested an executive and a driver for Lockheed's former sales agent in Japan today on charges of destroying evidence.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: American Eel
description: The American eel, Anguilla rostrata, largely shunned by residents of the United States, is reaching the dining tables of Europe, where its cousin, Anguilla anguilla, has been a gourmet food for centuries.

title: Leaders Optimistic as Auto Union and G.M. Open Contract Talks
description: DETROIT, July 19  The United Automobile Workers And tne General Motors Corporation opened bargaining here today in an atmosphere of restraint and conciliation.

title: Russians Grow Plants In Space Experiment
description: MOSCOW, July 19 (UPI) Two Soviet astronauts who have been orbiting earth in a space laboratory for nearly two weeks have turned from rearing guppies to growing plants, the press agency Tass said today.

title: FOREIGN INVESTING IN U.S. PLANTS IS UP
description: Foreign investment in United States manufacturing plants in the first half of 1976 jumped by 60 percent over last year's levels, according to a survey by the Conference Board.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLUMHarold L., Forever remembered; always with deep love.

title: Bridge
description: Three Cavendish Club experts, Mike Moss, Amos Kaminski and Tom Smith, teamed with a Philadelphian star, Ken Cohen, and captured the Fun City regional knockout team title at the New York Hilton Hotel Sunday night.

title: Savings May Revive Convention Center
description: The chairman of the Municipal Assistance Corporation proposed yesterday that savings realized from the latest plan to stretch out city debt obligations be used to help finance New York City's proposed new convention center.

title: Mediator Seeks to Avert Rockettes Strike
description: The chairman of the State Mediation Board intervened yesterday in the contract dispute between Radio City Music Hall and its Rockettes in an effort to avert a threatened strike by the performers that could shut the famed theater. No strike deadline has been set.

title: Chess
description: BIEL, Switzerland, July 17  Robert Huebner of West Germany and Vasily Smyslov of the Soviet Union, a former world champion, shared the lead with 3 points each after five rounds of the Interzonal Tournament. However, they are sure to be overtaken by four other contenders upon the completion of adjourned games.

title: Ford Hopeful on Solving Flu Vaccine Impasse
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (AP) The Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, T. David Mathews, said that an impasse continued over potential liability to manufacturers of vaccine for the proposed nationwide immunization program against swine flu.

title: Thai Foreign Minister Is Invited to Visit Laos
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 19 (Agence France Presse)  The Government has invited the Thai Foreign Minister, Pichai Rattakul, to visit Laos, a move that is expected to help bring about the normalization of relations that have been frozen for nearly a year.

title: OLYMPIC GAMES LOSE 17 NATIONS
description: MONTREAL, July 19The five interlocking Olympic rings symbolizing world brotherhood suffered another major blow today when 17 nations with 465 athletes officially left the Olympic Village or made final plans to do so.

title: 2 South Jersey Poultry Farms Accused Of Housing Workers in Chicken Coops
description: TRENTON, July 19  The State Department of Labor and Industry sued two South Jersey poultry farmers today, charging. them with exploitation of nine workers by housing them in converted chicken coops and illegally deducting excessive rent from their Day.

title: Jamaican Political Party Admits Getting Alcoa Gift
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, July 19 (UPI) The ruling People's National Party, which last week accused the opposition Labor Party of accepting a $25,000 payment from the Aluminum Company of America, acknowledged today that Alcoa contributed $20,000 to its own 1972 campaign. However, it denied any link with alleged payments made by Alcoa through a United States ambassador.

title: Fed's Action Blunts BondPrice Drop
description: After a weak morning, the credit markets staged a partial recovery yesterday afternoon, largely on the strength of intervention by the Federal Reserve.

title: Miss Comaneci Is Awarded Her 2d, 3d Perfect Scores
description: MONTREAL, July 19 How does an Olympic gymnast improve on a perfect score?

title: Price of Gold Abroad Drops to a 31Month Low
description: BRUSSELS, July 19 (UPI) Lack of interest in gold pushed its price down almost $4 an ounce today to its lowest level in 31 months. Dealers forecast it would drop even further by the end of the month.

title: RENATO MARELLI
description: Renato Marelli, who retired recently after spending 40 years as a textile industrialist in Sao Paulo, Brazil, died Sunday in Norwalk Hospital, Norwalk, Conn., after a short illness. Mr. Marelli, who had recently moved to Point Road, Wilson Point, South Norwalk, was 70 years old. He was born at Lake Como, Italy. Survivors include his wife, the former Dorothy Benjamin; a stepson, Kinny McQuade, and a brother.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor. I am amazed at your uncalledfor lecture to Prime Minister Trudeau in the July 7 Times, the editorial Olympian Politics.

title: Abercrombie & Fitch Put Up for Sale; 6 Years of Losses Reported by Chain
description: Abercrombie & Fitch, the mecca of affluent sportsmen for 83 years, has been offered for sale.

title: The People Beeper: It's Peace of Mind To Some, Electronic Leash to Others
description: What is to be made of the people beeperthe electronic paging device housed in a little black box that hangs on a person's belt or nestles in a purse?

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: Soviet Whalers Foiled By Canada Protesters
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, July 19 (UPI) Three members of a Canadian antiwhaling protest mission, Greenpeace confronted Soviet harpoonists 1,400 miles southwest of San Francisco today and won.

title: Italy Condemns Reported Step To Deny Aid if Reds Win Role
description: ROME, July 19 (AP) The outgoing Italian Prime Minister, Aldo Moro, today accused the United States, West Germany, France and Britain of acting in an improper way when they reportedly agreed to deny aid to any Italian cabinet that included Communist members.

title: New Books
description: A Book of Faith, by Elizabeth Goudge (Coward, McCann & Geohagan, $8.95). Poets and writers reflect upon their faith. Hamilton 17571789, by Robert Hendrickson (Mason/Charier, $19.95).

title: Open Interest
description: (In bushels. 000 omitted) Open

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Pledges Support to Cartel
description: WASHINGTON, July 19Pledging allout support, the A.F.L.C.I.O. abandoned its neutral political posture today and endorsed the Democratic ticket of Jimmy Carter for President and Walter F. Mondale for Vice President.

title: Thousands Flee Flooding In Mexico's Tampico Area
description: TAMPICO, Mexico, July 19 (UPI) Thousands of persons today fled the flooding Panuco and Tamesi rivers, swollen by more than 13 days of rain that has taken a heavy toll of life and property.

title: Dr. Jose Gallardo, 78, Is Dead; Leading Puerto Rican Educator
description: SAN JUAN. P.R., July 19 (AP) Dr. Jose M. Gallardo, Acting Governor of Puerto Rico for 10 months during World War II died last night at his home after a brief illness. He was 78 years old.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A dividend of 30 cents a common share, an increase of 5 cents, or 20 percent, over the previous quarterly rate, was declared yesterday by the directors of the Xerox Corporation. The disbursement is payable Oct. 1 to holders of record Sept. 3. It will be the 115th consecutive quarterly dividend declared by Xerox.

title: Suspicious Fire in Hospital
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I. July 19 (UPI) A suspicious fire Oils afternoon damaged the closet of a 14thfloor room in the psychiatric ward of the Nasfau County Medical Center here The police said the blaze scorched the ceiling, damage sonic clothing and burned through some electrical wiring.

title: Paris Publishes Novelist Rumania Silenced
description: BUCHAREST. RumaniaWe are stifling in silence. said one of Rumania's bestknown novelists. I have no means of making my living.

title: 10 Food Spots Are Called New York Code Violators
description: The New York Health Department has named 10 more food businesses for failing a health code inspection and warned that closing orders could result if violations persisted upon a final visit by its inspectors. The names of the establishments and the actions cited follow:

title: ExU.S. Aide Accuses the Government Of Neglecting SeaLaw Negotiations
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 A former top United States representative to the United Nations Conference on the Law of the Sea has charged the Ford Administration with a failure of leadership in those negotiations and with having violated American treaty obligations.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 19 The Mt. Hope iron mine in Morris County, one of the oldest iron mines in the nation may be reopened soon.

title: Walker Smith Meets the Queen
description: MONTREAL, July 19 The royal courier had delivered a royal envelope that had a royal mistake. It was addressed to Mr. Walker Smith, The New York Times but Red Smith's real name is Walter, not Walkerclose but one letter away from royal accuracy. Inside, the goldedge invitation with an embossed gold crown announced an added Olympic event. The Master of the Household, the invitation declared, is commanded by her Majesty to invite Mr. Walker Smith to a Reception to be given by The Queen and The Duke of Edinburgh on board H.M. Yacht Sports Britannia at Montreal on Sunday, 18th July, of 1976, at 5.00 p.m. In sports, Walker Smith The Times remembered as the baptismal name of the boxer known as Sugar Ray Robinson, a fivetime middleweight champion but never a Pulitzer Prize winner. Walter Smith was not offended, merely curious as to whether the invitation included Phyllis Smith, his Olympic roommate. He telephoned a royal number for the protocol coordinator of the royal visit and inquired about her royal eligibility.

title: William J. Heiser, Designer Of Many Newspaper Plants
description: William J. Heiser, who retired in 1972 as president and chairman of Lockwood Greene Engineers Inc., consulting engineers and architects, died Sunday at his home, 46 Wellington Road, Garden City, L.I. He was 88 years old.

title: CARTER CRITICIZES PARDON OF NIXON
description: PLAINS, Ga. July 20Jimmy Carter sharply disagreed today with President Ford's 1974 pardon of President Nixon before what the Democratic nominee termed Mr. Nixon's inevitable conviction in an open trial.

title: A Scottish Chorus Of 250 Performs On First U.S. Tour
description: The Scottish National Orchestra Chorus, which is making its first United States tour as a contribution to our Bicentennial observance, gave a concert at St. Bartholomew's Church on Monday night. This was the group's only solo appearance. Otherwise, it is devoting itself to concerts with orchestras, including the Los Angeles Philharmonic, the Cleveland Orchestra and the Chicago Symphony.

title: Broadcaster Finds Rights Endangered
description: MONTEREY, Calif., July 20 (AP)Broadcasters should fight to preserve freedom of the press not for themselves, but for the people we serve, the chairman of the National Association of Broadcasters said yesterday.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Amax Inc. announced yesterday the purchase of more than 100,000 acres of Southeastern timberland and a sawmill as a first step into the forest products industry.

title: Rao Indictments Obtained By Nadjari Are Reinstated
Six Killed on Cape Cod
description: YARMOUTH, Mass., July 20 (A)Six teenagers vacationing on Cape Cod were killed when their car went out of control on a turn and slammed into a tree last night, the police said. The victims, all from Boston area were identified as Leo J. Hurley, the driver, 17 years old; Patrice A. Vigneau, 16; Richard J. Vorderer, 15; James D. Plunkett, 15: Bernard Leonard, 15, and Renee Signori, 16.

title: Solving Problems Cuisinart Created
description: While the Cuisinart food processor with its wonderworking blades that chop, mince and puree with lightning speed, has solved a number of heretofore tedious food preparation chores, it has also created a few problems of its own. Considering the overwhelming popularity of this French import, it's no wonder that a subindustry is developing around it to overcome the minor problems it initiates.

title: Long Offers 2d Vote In TaxAid Dispute
description: Long Offers 2d Vote In TaxAid Dispute

title: A Colt by Secretariat Sold for $1.5 Million
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., July 20 (UPI)A chestnut colt sired by the 1973 Triple Crown winner. Secretariat, sold for $1.5 million tonight at the Keeneland race course summer yearling sale, setting a world record. The colt, out of Charming Alibi, was purchased by Canadians from the consignment of Nelson Bunker Hunt's Bluegrass Farm.

title: Crowd Attacks Policemen
description: CHICAGO, July 20 (UPI)Eight persons, including six policemen, were injured late yesterday when a crowd of several hundred persons attacked police with rocks and bottles on the near Northwest Side. Capt. Daniel Gleason said the disturbance was sparked when Moses Martinez. 21 years old, was stopped for a driving violation and yelled to the crowd that he was being mistreated by policemen.

title: Syracuse Mayor in Hospital
description: SYRACUSE, July 20 (AP)Mayor Lee Alexander of this city was admitted to CrouseIrving Memorial Hospital today and was expected to undergo surgery for an inguinal hernia tomorrow. A spokesman for the Mayor said that Mr. Alexander would leave on Monday for Sun Valley, Idaho, where he will recuperate and attend a Mayors conference.

title: Riviera Thieves Pull Giant FricFrac
description: PARIS, July 20When a clerk tried to open the vault of the Socit Gnrale bank in Nice yesterday, he found that the door was welded shutfrom the inside.

title: VIKING ROBOT SETS DOWN SAFELY ON MARS AND SENDS BACK PICTURES OF ROCKY PLAIN
description: PASADENA, Calif., July 20An explorer from Earth, the robot craft Viking 1, made the first successful landing on Mars today and transmitted spectacular photographs of a rocky, windscoured desert plain, the site for the first direct search for life on another

title: It All Started With a Dog
description: CHAPPAQUA. N. Y.For Melissa, 20, Sarah, 18, and Andy Young, 16, home is not just a neat, smallish white house in suburban Westchester with a cat that can open the refrigerator door. It is a combination of Noah's Ark, the Bronx Zoo and Jungle World and a serious, continuing education in animal behavior and the sanctity of living things.

title: CITY HELD UNREADY FOR EMERGENCIES
description: A federally financed mayoral task force has found that New York City is not adequately prepared to deal with fire, police and natural emergencies.

title: Show in Flushing Meadows Lets the World Know Who Is Bossie
description: Cows, in truth, are not beasts of beauty. But that has not deterred the Queens Museum from gathering a herd of themin pigment, porcelain, wood and stonefor a show called Cows.

title: Girl 3, Survives Five Days In Home After Mother Dies
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind.. July 20 (AP)  A 3yearold girl survived five days locked in a mobile home after her mother died. She tried to feed her 4monthold sister, but the infant died of dehydration, the police say.

title: Senator Baker Pushing Reagan For No. 2 SpotBut Not Hard
description: WASHINGTON, July 20Senator Howard H. Baker Jr. is pushing Ronald Reagan for the Republican VicePresidential nominationbut not too hard.

title: Strike Worsens Surplus of Fruit on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, July 20A toobountiful sun has generated a huge surplus of fruit and other crops in California this summer, and the glut of fruit was aggravated today when the Teamsters Union struck the state's 78 canneries. California produces more than half of the nation's canned fruits and vegetables, according to industry estimates.

title: Ford Gains 10 Delegates And Needs Only 18 More
description: WASHINGTON, July 20President Ford gained substantial delegate strength today to pull within 18 votes of the total needed to gain a firstballot nomination at the Repub lican Natio'ml Convention.

title: U.S. Pullout of G.I.'s In Thailand Complete.
POLAND JAILS 13 FOR FOOD RIOTING
description: WARSAW, July 20 (AP)Thirteen workers have been sentenced to prison terms ranging from three to ten years for their part in riots last month that forced the Polish Government to withdraw foodprice increases.

title: U.S. AGENCY FINDS DRUG TESTING LAX
description: WASHINGTON, July 20Congressional investigators have issued a blistering indictment of the Food and Drug Administration, pharmaceutical makers, doctors and research scientists, charging them with exposing humans to unnecessary risks in testing new drugs.

title: Nitrogen, Key to Life, Is Found
Tonight's Entries at Yonkers
description: Tonight's Entries at Yonkers

title: High Tides Around New York
description: High Tides Around New York

title: Union Carbide Net Up; Polaroid Lifts Earnings
description: Earnings of the Union Carbide Corporation rebounded in the second quarter with a 19.8 percent increase from the yearearlier level, following an 11 percent decline in the first quarter.

title: Bicentennial Concert Staged by the Fords
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (UPI)President and Mrs. Ford staged their main Bicentennial event tonight with an American music concert under a tent in the Rose Garden.

title: Britons Acclaim Graham Dancers
description: LONDON, July 20 (Reuters) Martha Graham and her dancers were acclaimed last night at the Royal Opera House, home of the Royal Ballet, where her 50yearold company is making its first appearance for a twoweek season.

title: CANNERY WORKERS STRIKE ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 20About 20,000 cannery workers in northern California walked off their jobs today in a contract dispute in the middle of the state's fruit and vegetable harvesting season.

title: Latin Parley Ready To Back Proposal For News Service
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, July 20A proposed Latin American and Caribbean news agency, or group of agencies, was approved today by a committee at a regional communications conference here sponsored by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization.

title: Abduction Prison Taken From Quarry; Hope Expressed on Solving Kidnapping
description: MADERA, Calif., July 20The 25foot tractor trailer in which 26 pupils and their bus driver were held captive after their kidnapping last Thursday was extracted today from the Alameda County quarry, 100 miles northwest of here. and taken to the country crime laboratory.

title: Connors, Ashe Score Victories
description: WASHINGTON. July 20 (AP)Jimmy Connors and Arthur Ashe scored firstround victories tonight in the $125,000 Washington Star international tennis tournament. Vijay Arnitraj of India was beaten by Mike Cahill of Wisconsin, 64. 76.

title: DayCare Centers At 49 Locations Lose Public Funds
description: Citing its fiscal situation, New York City yesterday cut off public funds for 49 daycare centers serving more than 3,000 children.

title: Ways to Spend a Hot City Day
description: Ways to Spend a Hot City Day

title: Attica Is Termed as Bad As Before 1971 Rebellion
Finger Lakes Results
description: By The Associated Press

title: Lebanese Disintegration
description: Something about civil unrest in Lebanon has always seemed to bring out a distortion in Washington's perspective. The Marines dispatched by President Eisenhower in 1958 landed on the Beirut beaches, guns at the ready, to be greeted only by cheerful and eager hawkers of trinkets and soft drinks. President Ford grabbed for the headlines at an important moment his primary election campaign last month by ordering an official evacuation, while in Beirut, relatively few resident Americans bothered to accept the departure facilities and went on fending for themselves.

title: About Real Estate
description: Precisely bisected by the line between Brooklyn and Queens there is a piece of land that used to show on city maps as Eldert Street. The street was mapped but never built. Instead it is a nondescript no man's land of 20,000 square feet alongside the 86,000squarefoot whitebrick home of Lahm Knitting Mill Inc.

title: Show in Flushing Meadows Lets the World Know Who Is Bossie
description: Cows, in truth, are not beasts of beauty. But that has not deterred the Queens Museum from gathering a herd of themin pigment, porcelain, wood and stonefor a show called Cows.

title: U.S. Blacks Won't Join Exodus
description: MONTREAL. July 20Black athletes on the United States Olympic team expressed sympathy today for the African countries pulling out of the Games but indicated that they would not join the exodus or otherwise rock the boat.

title: ALBIN A. BARTHELSON
description: Albin A. Barthelson, a graphic arts designer, died Saturday of injuries received in an automobile accident. He was 51 years old and lived in Englewood, N.J.

title: Nureyev Leads Canadian Ballet Into Met
description: The Canadians are coming Indeed they have come, The Natinnal Ballet of Canada, with its resident guru, Rudolf Nureyev, arrived at the Metropolitan Opera House last night for a threeweek stay.

title: U.S. Shooter Wins; 8Man Crew Ousted
description: MONTREAL, July 20 (AP) The United States picked up another gold medal in the Olympics today when 29yearold Don Haldeman of Souderton, Pa., won the trap shooting championship. But a United States eightoared crew failed for the first time in Olympic history to reach the rowing final.

title: Pro Transactions
description: NEW YORK (NL)Placed Dave Kingman. outfielder, first baseman, on 21day disabled list. Traced Wayne Garrett, infielder, and Del Unser, outfielder, to Montreal for Angel Mangal and Jim Dwyer, outfielders.

title: Advertising
description: Playgirl magazine, the publication that offers male nudity to its women readers, is doing something else that is unusual. It is going after subscribers through daily newspaper ads and, according to Ira E. Ritter, its 27yearold executive vice president, it is doing extremely well, even in such places as Des Moines, Denver, Sacramento, and Kansas City.

title: DELANEY NAMED TO S.E.C. BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, July 20President Ford, apparently yielding to intense political pressure, nominated today Patrick J. Delaney, the son of a powerful New York Congressman, to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Business Briefs
description: Eight additional paperboard companies yesterday changed their pleas to no contest from innocent in the Government's largest pricfixing case n more than 10 years. Unitd States District Court Judg James Parsons ?? each plea change as he had indicated he would on the previous day when he accepted identical plea changes from 12 other defendants in the case. On both days he ?? each corporation guilty and fined each of the companies the maximum penalty of $50,000.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A New Jersey man is in critical condition with injuries suffered when the light plane he was flying collided in midair near the Rehoboth Airport with a biplane flown by a crop duster. The critically injured pilot, John J. Rambo, 57 years old, of Wading River, was flying a singleengine Grumman, and is in Delaware Division Hospital in Wilmington with extensive internal injuries. The other pilot, Gary E. Emeigh, 28, of Magnolia, was listed in fair condition at Beebe Hospital with back injuries. One plane hit a vacant mobile home and the other crashed on a private road.

title: Realty Agents Curbed in Two Boroughs
description: In its most sweeping attack against blockbusting New York State issued an order yesterday prohibiting real estate brokers and sales people from virtually all methods of solicit ing homes for sale throughout Brooklyn and Oueens.

title: MELLON IN A DEAL FOR LOCAL LOAN CO.
description: MELLON IN A DEAL FOR LOCAL LOAN CO. The Mellon National Corporation of Pittsburgh said yesterday that it had acquired the Local Loan Company of Chicago. The value of the transaction was not disclosed, but a spokesman for the company said the consideration was well over $10 million. Mellon National, the holding company for the Mellon Bank reported that the Local Loan Company with 124 offices in 12 states had 1975 earnings of $23.85 a share on a loan volume in excess of $100 million. Most of the shares are owned by Fred B. Snite, chairman, and his immediate family.

title: O. J. Is Squeezed From Bills' Book
description: The Buffalo Bills, at least, are taking O. J. Simpson at his wordthey have dropped him and the four pages he took up from their yearbook.

title: 2 Republicans File a Challenge To Peyser's Primary Petitions
description: Two Republicans, acting separately, have challenged the petitions filed by Representative Peter A. Peyser for a place on the Sept. 14 primary ballot in an effort to bar him from opposing Senator James L. Buckley, ConservativeRepublican, for the Republican nomination for Senator.

title: Treatment of Cancer Aided by Accelerator
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, July 20 St. Peter's Hospital here has made a substantial commitment to advance radiation therapy for cancer patients by purchasipg a linear accelerator, which emits highenergy electron and X  ray beams for treating tumors.

title: NET AND SALES RISE AT BRISTOLMYERS
description: The BristolMyers Company reported yesterday record sales and earnings for the second quarter and first half of 1976.

title: THOMAS J. BRADY
description: Thomas J. Brady, who retired in 1961 as a New York City stock broker, died Monday in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 81 years old, and had moved to Scottsdale on his retirement.

title: DECLINE IN FRANC AROUSES CONCERN
description: PARIS, July 19During the economic crisis of the last three years, France has been the only major industrial Democracy where wage rises have outpaced price increases.

title: DR. MAURICE HERZMARK
description: Dr. Maurice H. Hdrzmark, a Washington orthopedic surgeon, died yesterday at George Washington University Hospital in the capital, where he lived. He was 70 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Dr. John Errol Asher, a Manhattan internist, was sentenced yesterday to one year in prison for submitting false Medicaid claims. The 33yearold doctor, who agreed make restitution of $35,000, was sentenced by Judge Robert L. Carter in Federal District Court. Dr. Asher pleaded guilty last month to submitting fraudulent claims while working at clinics that Federal prosecutors characterized as Medicaid mills. He was the 20th defendant to be sentenced in the Medicaid investigation, which has resulted sentences ranging from probation to one year in prison.

title: Yanks Top White Sox By 14 to 9
description: CHICAGO, July 20 The. Chicago White Sox played Scott Joplin's ragtime music and gave away copies of E. L. Doctorow's novel Ragtime, tonight. Their opponents, the Nev: York Yankees, quickiy caught, the spirit of the Bill Veeck promotion and enjoyed a raggedy time.

title: U.S. Five Tops Puerto Rico By 9594 Despite Lee's 35
description: MONTREAL, July 20The United States men's basketball team survived a 35point performance from a New Yorker, Butch Lee, and outlasted Puerto Rico, 9594, today in a furious game that was not settled until the final seconds.

title: KENNETH L. BRODY, CITY AIDE, 45, DIES
description: Kenneth L. Brody, assistant administrator of the city's Human Resources Administration, died yesterday of cancer at his home in Teaneck, N.J. He was 45 years old.

title: $11 Million in State Aid to Businesses Includes Loan to Revitalize Passaic
description: TRENTON, July 20 The State Economic Development Authority approved today $11 million in business expansion loans, including one that Governor Byrne said could revitalize the city of Passaic.

title: South African Black Is Reported Killed In Renewed Rioting
description: JOHANNESBURG, July 20At least one black man was reported killed tonight when police reinforcements were rushed to the coalmining center of Witbank, 75 miles east. of here, which was in the grip of the most serious rioting since the widespread antiGovernment upheavals last month.

title: BOND PRICES SUP IN DULL TRADING
description: Prices on the credit markets fell slightly yesterday in trading so light that a number of new issues offered in the morning remained unsold at the end of the day, not because they were overpricea, but because the predominant mood in the markets was in the markets was apathy. There was very little activity, said one trader. It's the dead of summer and it's boring. If I sound lackluster, that's the way I feel.

title: WINE TALK
description: One of the most unusual events in the wine world is taking place in the Virginia countryside south of Washington these days and has gone largely unnoticed. An Italian group has purchased about 800 acres at Barboursville, near Charlottesville, and has begun planting the property in cabernet sauvignon, pivot noir, riesling and pinot chardonnay wine grapes.

title: PARISIANS UPSET BY SUBWAY CRIME
description: PARIS, July 20Paris is getting nervous about crime in its subway system.

title: Companies Report Their Sales and Earning Figures
description: Companies Report Their Sales and Earning Figures

title: Rumanian Gymnasts to Tour U. S.
description: MONTREAL, July 20Even if Nadia Comaneci of Rumania fails to produce a fourth perfect score in the remaining two days of the women's Olympic gynamastics competition, her performance here is certain to carry considerable impact, particularly in the United States.

title: 3 Views on Economy
description: Although the Democratic Presidential candidate, Jimmy Carter, intends to attack the Republicans hard on unemployment, inflation, and the slowness of the recovery, President Ford believes that the nation's economic performance is one of his strongest cards in his campaign first against Ronald Reagan and then, he hopes, against

title: 2 BIGGEST BANKS EXPAND EARNINGS
description: The BankAmerica Corporation in San Francisco and Citicorp in New York, the nation's two largest bank holding companies, reported yesterday that their secondquarter operationg earnings climbed to record levels.

title: Stocks Drop for Sixth Day; Dow Off by 2.54 to 988.29
description: Stock prices moved lower yesterday for the sixth session in a row as most precious metal issueswhich generally climb when the rest of the market slumpsjoined the downtrend.

title: Viking Lands 7 Years After Moon Landing
description: HOUSTON, July 20 (AP)America's Viking I space robot landed on Mars today seven years to the day after two Apollo astronauts stepped from their spacecraft and put man's footprints on the moon.

title: Expos Get Mets Unser And Garrett
description: CINCINNATI, July 20The New York Mets traded Del Unser and Wayne Garrett to the Montreal Expos tonight for Pepe Mangual, an outfielder, and Jim Dwyer, a lefthandedhitting outfielder.

title: Major League Box Scores and Standings
description: Major League Box Scores and Standings

title: MARINE CONVICTED IN RECRUIT DEATH
description: SAN DIEGO, July 20 (UPI)A Marine drill sergeant was found guilty yesterday of dereliction of duty in the pugilstick death of Pvt. Lynn McClure, a 20yearold recruit fatally beaten in training.

title: Other Highlights
description: SHOOTING Don Haldeman, 29yearold Army Reserve sergeant from Souderton, Pa., won gold medal in trapshooting. His score was 190 of a possible 200.

title: Books of The Times
description: JAWAHARLAL NEHRU. A BIOGRAPHY. By Sarvepalli Gopal. Volume I. 400 pages. Harvard University Press. $17.50.

title: SIX ARE ARRESTED IN SUBWAY CRIME
description: A subway token clerk, a conductor and four other men were accused yesterday of stealing hundreds of thousands of dollars in cash and tokens in subway station robberies over the last six years.

title: Westchester Planning to Leave Con Ed
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 20Westchester County responding to increasing utility costs, moved today to withdraw as a whole from the Consolidated Edison system as soon as an adequate alternatve source of power can be found.

title: Powerboats Race Today In Jersey
description: POINT PLEASANT, N.J., July 20It costs as much as $80,000 to acquire and prepare a powerboat for the Benihana Grand Prix offshore race, which will be run here tomorrow in the waters between Asbury Park and Barnegat Light for prizes totaling nearly $16,000. However, in affluent America this Bicentennial summer there is no lack of enthusiasm for this expensive, esoteric sport as 60 boats, a record for any offshore powerboat race, are ready, 19 for the 200mile course in the inlimited class, 41 in production class to run 119 miles.

title: Myer Marcus, 68, Food Chain Head, Market Innovator
description: Myer B. Marcus, chairman of the board of Food Fair Stores and an innovator in food merchandising, died yesterday at the Albert Einstein Medical Center in Philadelphia, Pa. He was 68 and lived in BalaCynwyd, Pa.

title: Ocean Sail Is Won By Race Passage
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia, July 20 (AP)Race Passage, a 44foot sloop, was declared overall winner to. day of the 2,308mile VictoriatoMaui yacht race.

title: GOLD PLUNGES 12% IN WEEK TO $107.75
description: LONDON, July 20  The turmoil that has been swirling through many nations currencies has now swept into gold, long a major component, along with the dollar, of the world's monetary reserves.

title: Uganda Minister Named
description: NAIROBI, July 20 (Reuters)President Idi Amin today appointed a new Ugandan Finance Minister, Brig. Moses Ali the first army officer to hold the finance portfolio, Uganda Radio reported. Brigadier All has been Minister of Provincial Administration. The former Finance Minister, Emmanuel Wakhweya, fled from Uganda last year.

title: Apathetic Reaction Disgusts a Scientist
description: LOUISVILLE. Ky. July 20 (AP)It's downright ctisgusting. scientist J. ?? kecfe said after Viking I began sending back vivid photographs from the planet Mars. i'm rather steamed about it.

title: Stretchout for What?
description: The doubts expressed in Washington yesterday that New York City will be able to survive fiscally after expiration of the Federal loan program in June 1978, plus persisting uncertainties about the financial plan that is supposed to produce a balanced municipal budget by that time, more than justify Municipal Assistance Corporation Chairman Felix G. Rohatyn's efforts stretch out $1.8 billion in M.A.C. bonds.

title: About Education
description: What is the relationship between mathematics and sex? Why is there a lower enrollment and a higher attrition rate for female mathematics students? Are men better than women in mathematics, and if so, why?

title: McAlpin Hotel Is Sold and Is to Be Converted Into 700 Apartments
description: The 1,200  room McAlpin Hotel on Herald Square was sold yesterday to a group of builderdevelopers and a member concern of the New York Stack Exchange for conversion to rental apartments.

title: Flight Offers Clue to Air of Mars
description: PASADENA, Calif., July 20The first definitive analysis of the Martian atmosphere has provldad longsought clues to the planet's history, including the possibility that enough water is hidden beneath its surface to cover the planet one mile deep.

title: Davis Cup Future Imperiled By Politics, Malless Cautions
description: Stan Malless. president of the United States Tennis Association, voiced pessimism yesterday about the future of international Davis Cup competition.

title: Riviera Thieves Pull Giant RricFrac
description: PARIS, July 20When a clerk tried to open the vault of the Societe Generale bank in Nice yesterday, he found that the door was welded shutfrog the inside.

title: Market Place
description: When the Consolidated Edison Company omitted its customary 45  cent  a  share quarterly dividend in April 1974, it dropped a bombshell in the investment community and jarred the utility stocks, generally. It marked the first dividend omission by Con Ed since 1885.

title: Five Ways to Reform The Olympics
description: The Olympic Games are scheduled for Moscow. It is 1980. The political disputes of previous yearsthe North Korean pullout in 1964, the racial protests of 1968, the terrorist attack of 1972, and the ChinaTaiwan dispute of 1976are part of the Olympic legacy as much as the spirit of sportsmanship of Pierre de Coubertin, founder of the modern Olympic Games. The Russians have spent $2 billion on the stadiums, aonnitories and various other monuments. ABC has contributed $100 million for United States television rights. The Soviet commissars of sport expect their athletes to win all the medals except five, which will go to East Germany. Although the United States team, amateurs (high school students largely), has trained hard, it is no match for the Soviet Army professionals. The Kremlin's propaganda machine prepares story after story about the prospect of nationalistic triumphs and how they will represent the superiority of the Soviet system.

title: A Tap Dancer Who Taps People
description: MONTREAL, July 20Charles Dexter Walker Jr. one month past his 19th birthday. He nas been a tap dancer for 14 years and for the last five he has been punching people as a hobby. Starting with a young malt from Poland next Sunday afternoon, he will enthavor to keep on punching people in a nice way until he wins the Olympic gold medal in the light middleweight division (156 pounds) on the night of Saturday, July 31. Then if all goes according to plan he will go back to dancing, making faces and speaking pieces. Officials of the United States boxing team consider Chuck Walker one of their likeliest candidates for a championship but he has no intention of turning pro if he wins. like Floyd Patterson. Muhammad Ali, Joe Frazier.

title: Carter's Cool Professional Aide
description: Ten years ago, Jody Powell was walking through a south Georgia shopping center when a smiling man thrust a hand toward him and said, Hi! I'm Jimmy Carter and I'm running for Governor. Mr. Powell took the hand and thereby began a political and personal

title: Crafts for Children: Imaginative Ideas For Busier Summer
description: It must have been a parent who coined the phrase endless summer, after a particularly discouraging bout of trying to think up things for underfoot children to do. However, there are a number of recent books filled with imaginative ideas that deal with that problem nicely.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: WASHINGTON, July 20The Aviation Consumer Action Project, one of Ralph Nader's many offspring, has opened a campaign to cut ticket prices on the Eastern Air Lines shuttle linking Boston, New York and Washington.

title: DayCare Centers At 49 Locations Lose Public Funds
description: Citing its fiscal situation. New York City yesterday cut off public funds for 49 daycare centers serving more than 3,000 children.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, July 20 Governor Byrne reemphasized today his interest in the process by which electricity is generated with previously wasted steam.

title: COMO, AT 64, BACK WITH STAGE SHOW
description: Perry Como, who does not expend his energies rashly, is making his first public appearance in the metropolitan area in 32 years this week at the Westbury (L. L) Music Fair. At 64, and despite a pepperandsalt graying of his hair, Mr. Como still looks very much as he did on his weekly television shows 15 or 20 years ago. His voice has retained the soft, easy, inviting qualities that it had at that time and before that, on his radio series that started in 1944.

title: Long Offers Second Vote In Dispute Over Tax AidLong Offers Second Vote In Dispute Over Tax Aid
description: WASHINGTON, July 20Bussell B. Long, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, promised today to give the panel a new opportunity to vote for or against each of 73 provisions of the pending tax bill, most of which benefit just one company or industry.

title: The Sun Sets on Kipling's Domain
Arrest in Lockheed Case
description: TOKYO, July 20 (AP)Prosecutors investigating Lockheed payoffs in Japan arrested another officer of the aircraft concern's former sales agent here today on charges of destroying evidence. Tatsuya Nakai, a section chief at Marubeni Corporation, was the third Marubeni employee arrested on Lockheedrelated charges in two days and the 14th person arrested in Japan's investigation. One of the 14 has been released.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Times says that the nation's criminaljustice systems are capable of incarcerating murderers and rapists for several decades as an alternative to the death penalty [editorial July 15]. There is no evidence to support this assertion.

title: SARAH C. GROSS, 69, EDITOR, REVIEWER
description: Sarah Chokla Gross, an editor and reviewer of children's books, died yesterday at South Nassau Communities Hospital in Oceanside, L. I. She was 69 years old and lived in East Rockaway, L. I.

title: New Books
description: A Welfare Mother, by Susan sheehart (Houghton Mifflin, $6.95). Puerto Rican woman and her family living amidst poverty in New York City.

title: Mourner Leaves a Wake And Is Shot Dead in Bar
description: A Manhattan man was shot and killed last night in a Lexington Avenue bar half an hour after he and six other mourners had attended a wake for a friend at a funeral home across the street.

title: GRENADES HURLED IN SALISBURY RAID
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, July 20 (Reuters)A nightclub and a restaurant in Salisbury's city center were attacked with hand grenades tonight.

title: Neighborhood Gardens May Yield Prizes
description: May Mora, who is 75 years old, gets up at 6 to water the plants. She says. Good morning, darlings how beautiful you look! and, occasionally: What's the matter? Everyone's blooming and you're not.

title: VIKING ROBOT SETS DOWN SAFELY ON MARS AND SENDS BACK PICTURES OF ROCKY PLAIN
CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times on Monday reported incorrectly that Costa Rica and Honduras had been involved in the 1969 conflict known as the soccer war. The two nations in that conflict were Honduras and El Salvador.

title: No one Expected This God to Fail
description: Dear Pensioner: This is to advise you that as of January 1, 1976, pensioners will no longer be covered for all Welfare benefits; this includes hospitalization, medical, surgical, major medical, dental, optical and mortuary coverages. This decision was regretfully reached by the Trustees because of the excessive unemployment and the severe depression in the construction industry. Sincerely yours Administrator, Local No. 1

title: G.N.P. Growth Slows to 4.4% From Prior Quarter's 9.2%
description: WASHINGTON, July 20The nation's economy grew in this year's second quarter at less than half the rapid pace of the first quarter, the Commerce Department estimated today.

title: Egypt, Morocco Join Olympic Walkout
description: MONTREAL, July 20Egypt and Morocco withdrew from the strifetorn Olympic Games today, joining a boycott that now encompasses virtually the entire African continent.

title: Audience Reports Robberies At Concert in Central Park
description: The police yesterday were investigating the complaints of 25 people who said they had been the victims of robberies and assaults during a jazzrock concert Monday night at the Schaefer Music Festival in Central Park's Wollman arena.

title: Most of State's Republican Delegates to Meet With Ford Today
description: More than 100 New York Republican delegates are scheduled for a session of light elbow bending and gentle arm twisting at the White House tomorrow as President Ford stepup pressure on the New York delegation, which is largely, but not completely, committed to him.

title: Joblessness in Britain Up; Cabinet Meets Urgently
description: LONDON, July 20 Unfavorable economic news, political warfare on the Government's left and right, and trade union anger at proposed cuts in public spending drove the British Cabinet into a series of emergency meetings today and caused turmoil in Parliament.

title: Notes on People
description: Dr. J. Robert Buchanan, dean of Cornell University Medical College here since 1969, was named yesterday to be president of Chicago's Michael Reese Hospital and Medical Center beginning Jan. 1. The hospital has a teaching relationship to the University of Chicago medical school similar to that of New York Hospital to Cornell.

title: The Glories of Fine American Cooking
description: EAST HAMPTON, N.Y.One of the most bizarre questions to greet our earsand it is asked on an astonishing number of occasionsis whether there is such a thing as traditional American cooking. The answer is, of course, a resounding yes, although, for the most part and in its pure state, it is both regional and intraregional in character.

title: Palestinians Balk at Terms for Talks to End Rift With Syria
Viking Cameras Light in Weight, Use Little Power, Work Slowly
description: PASADENA, CALIF., July 20When President Ford telephoned today to congratulate the Viking flight team, just as the Viking 1 landing craft was transmitting its first panoramic view of the landscape at Chryse, he asked the Project Manager, James Martin. what type of camera had sent hack the first photographs from the surface of Mars.

title: CARLOS MANTILLA
description: QUITO, Ecuador, July 20 (AP) Carlos Mantilla Ortega, publisher of the newspaper El Comercio, died today in Miami. family sources reported here. He was 73 years old. He was a former president of the InterAmerican Press Association and was one of the recipients of the Maria Moors Cabot prizes awarded by Columbia University.

title: PRICES OF WHEAT AND CORN ADVANCE
description: Heavy volume and sharp price changes marked trading on most of the nation's commodity futures exchanges yesterday.

title: Love's Labor Lost
description: Jimmy Carter, like Senator George McGovern four years ago, won the Democratic Party's Presidential nomination with no help from George Meany and most of his colleagues in the organized labor movement. But there the similarity ends.

title: First Portuguese Envoy In 20 Years Is in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI, July 20 (UPI)A Portuguese ambassador joined New Delhi's diplomatic community yesterday for the first time in two decades.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Today's Entries at Aqueduct

title: POSTAL UNION PLAN MAILCUT PROTEST
description: The presidents of 53 postal unions voted here today for a nationwide job action by Aug. 20 unless the United States Postal Service declared a moratorium on service cutbacks that the union leaders said were crippling mail service, United Press International reported.

title: Army in Argentina Achieves Key Goal As Rebel Is Killed
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 20The Argentine Army announced today that security forces had killed the leader of the principal leftist guerrilla group in the country and several of his aides.

title: First Encephalitis Cases
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 20 (UPI)  State Health Department officials confirmed today that the season's first two cases of deadly St. Louis encephalitis had been found in Mississippi and seven more suspected cases were under investigation. The disease, transmitted from birds to humans by mosquitoes, claimed 25 lives in a summer epidemic in Mississippi last year.

title: $21,820,000 Granted for Carter Ticket In First Subsidized Presidential Vote
description: WASHINGTON, July 20The first publicly financed Presidential election in American history was formally set in motion today with approval of a Treasury Department grant of $21,820,000 to the Democratic candidates, Jimmy Carter and Walter F. Mondale.

title: Met Museum Purchases Two Buildings on 82d St.
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art has purchased two buildings from the New Lincoln School on 82d Street off Fifth Avenue to house administrative and curatorial offices while it completes its building program in Central Park.

title: How Much Meat? How Much Filler?
description: WASHINGTON, (UPI)The United State Department of Agriculture says meat processors who sell combinations of products such as ham and soy protein must now tell consumers how much meat the foods contain.

title: F.B.I.'s Chief Names Associate Director To Replace Callahan
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (AP) The Director of the F.B.I., Clarence M. Kelley, today appointed Richard G. Held as associate director, the secondhighest position in the bureau. He will replace Nicholas P. Callahan, who was dismissed last Friday in the course of a Justice Department investigation of alleged financial improprieties and other misdeeds involving bureau officials.

title: Salesman on L. I. Pleads Guilty In Silver Options Swindle of 20
description: MINEOLA, LI., July 20A securities salesman who al1 legedly swindled 20 investors out of more than $103,000 through the sale of bogus silver future options was charged with grand larceny today.

title: U.S. AGENCY FINDS DRUG TESTING LAX
description: WASHINGTON, July 20Congressional investigators have issued a blistering indictment of the Food and Drug Administration, pharmaceutical makers, doctors and research scientists, charging them with exposing humans to unnecessary risks in testing new drugs.

title: QUARTERLY PROFIT REPORTEDBYT.W.A.
description: Trans World Airlines Inc. reported yesterday a preliminary corporate net profit of $24.4 million for June, a profit of $30.2 million for the second quarter and a loss of $15.6 million for the first half of the year.

title: Connally Might Accept the No. 2 Spot if
description: HOUSTON, July 20John B. Connally says that he would consider accepting the Republican VicePresidentiat nomination only if he was assured that he could play a large role in the administration.

title: ASPIN TESTIFIES ON SPY REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (UPI)  Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, told the House Ethics Committee today that he had lent a copy of a Congressional report critical of intelligence activities to the Central Intelligence Agency and had let a news agency reporter look at a few pages of the report.

title: Serious Problems Seen In New York's Recovery
description: WASHINGTON, July 20The chairman of a House economic subcommittee warned today that he foresaw serious problems affecting New York City's economic recovery, after the Federal loan program ended in July 1978.

title: ALBANY STALLED ON COURT CHANGES
description: The leadership of the Assembly and Senate failed again yesterday, at a lengthy meeting in Goveror Carey's office in New York City, to agree on a package of court reorganization amendments.

title: Prices on Amex Continue to Drop, Index Falls 0.78
description: Prices once again moved lower on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market. The Amex market value index closed at 104.42, down 0.78, while the NASDAQ industrial index ended at 97.08. off 0.51.

title: Some Gems in Tut Tomb Are Glass
description: CAIRO, July 15Experts from New York and Cairo musuems, examining the jewelry of the ancient Egyptian King Tutankhamen, have found that many stones that were earlier reported to be costly lapis lazuli and turquoise are in fact pieces of colored glass.

title: 2 Move to Bar Badillo From Ballot in Primary
description: The petitions to put Representative Herman Badillo on the primary election ballot have been challenged by two other candidates, at least one of whom, Mr. Badillo suggested yesterday, was supported by his main opponent, City Councilman Ramon S. Velez.

title: Rao Indictments Obtained By Nadjari Are Reinstated
description: The Appellate Division in Brooklyn yesterday reinstated perjury indictments obtained by Maurice H. Nadjari against Judge Paul P. Rao Sr. of United States Customs Court; his son, Paul Jr., and another lawyer, Salvatore Nigrone.

title: New Uranium Shipments to India Meet Opposition in U. S Hearing
description: WASHINGTON. July 20The Nuclear Regulatory Commission was urged today to block further shipments of uranium fuel to India to combat the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: Goodell and Hencken Take Gold Medals In Swim,. Miss Chandler Diving Victor
description: MONTREAL, July 20It was a day like all other days today at the Olympic swimming pool. The American men and East German women won all the gold medals and all in worldrecord time.

title: Suffolk Rejects a Moratorium on Sewer
description: The Suffolk County Legislature unexpectedly rejected late, yesterday a proposal under which work would have been halted on the county's controversial $1.5 billion Southwest Sewer District so that it could be redesigned in scope.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Key Senators Back Plan for a Special Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON. July 20Key members of the Senate Government Operations Committee agreed informally today to go along with President Ford's proposal for creation of a permanent special prosecutor's office to investigate wrongdoing by Federal officials.

title: U.S. Offers Visitors Aidin Own Tongue
description: A Spanish couple traveling in the upper Middle West whose child was bitten by an animal dialed a tollfree number and within minutes were able to speak in their own language to a doctor who could treat the child.

title: South African Black Is Reported Killed In Renewed Rioting
Prostitutes in Manhattan Area Get More and Longer Sentences
description: More New York City prostitutes were sentenced to jail terms in the last 30 days than in any comparable period so far this year, according to Police Department statistics released yesterday.

title: Jones Blanks Phils 3d Time for No. 17
description: Randy Jones of the San Diego Padres admits he does not have much of a ?? But he does have two devious pitches, a slider and a sinker. He also works fast., a rarity in these days of baseball players who are conscious of television ?? Last night ?? San Diego the lefthander gained his 17th victory, a fourhit ?? that required Just 1 hour ?? minutes. The victims were th slugging Philadelphia Phillies, a difficul steam to blank. But not for Jones. He had previously beaten them by 40 and 50. This time it was 30.

title: Yugoslavia Plans To Free U.S. Citizen Imprisoned as Spy
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 20Yugoslav authorities made it known today they planned to release on Friday an American citizen imprisoned a year ago on espionage charges.

title: Tokyo Court Reverses Acquittal Of Reporter Who Got Secrets
description: TOKYO, July 20The Tokyo High Court reversed a lower court verdict today and gave a former reporter of a major Japanese newspaper a suspended fourmonth prison sentence on charges of illegally obtaining secret Foreign Ministry documents.

title: Cuban Breaks Leg
description: MONTREAL, July 20 (UPI)  Roberto Richards, a 22yearold member of the Cuban gymnastics team, broke his left leg below the knee today when he fell from the horizontal bar while warming up. Richards overthrew a practice dismount, his leg slipping from beneath him as he hit the mat.

title: News Summary and Index
description: At least one black man was reported killed in the South African coalmining center of Witbank, 75 miles east of Johannesburg, when police reinforcements were rushed to the scene of serious rioting. Reports said about 3,000 black youths had poured out of black townships and attacked people and buildings in areas occupied by Indians and people of mixed descent. [Page 1, Col. 3.]

title: Protesters Halt Long SitIn At School Board in Harlem
description: Faced with a court injunction, protesting parents and community representatives yesterday left the offices of Community School Board 5 in Harlem, where they had conducted a sitin since June 7.

title: $1 Million Fire Hits Church
description: NASHUA, N.H., July 20 (AP) An early morning fire heavily damaged the 105yearold St. Louis De Gonzague Church in downtown Nashua this morning, causing damage estimated at $1 million.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MUSIC IN THE AIR Summer in New York means music in the streets. PreWorld War II jazz will be performed by Richard Sudhalter, cornetist; Bucky Pizzarelli guitarist; Major Holley, bassist, and Bobby Rosengarden, drummer, today from 4:30 to 6 P.M. in Exxon Park. The park is really the little plaza behind the Exxon Building, which is on the Avenue of the Americas between 49th and 50th Streets. The rain date is tomorrow.

title: Hempstead Is Suing City Over Sewage on Beaches
description: Charging that untreated sewage from New York City has endangered Long Island's beaches and residential communities, the Town of Hempstead filed suit in State Supreme Court in Mineola, L. I., yesterday to as for an end to the alleged dumping of effluents and to demand $10 million in damages reportedly resulting from sludge that coated nearly 90 miles of South Shore beaches last month.

title: Connecticut Democrats Choose Six in Races for the U.S. House
description: After ?? debate and seven ballots, Democrats in Connecticut's Fourth Congressional District early this morning selected Charles B. Tisdale of Bridgeport to oppose the Republican incumbent, Representative Stewart B. McKinney, United Press International reported.

title: Bridge:
description: Britain has sent a powerful foursome to challenge the United States in a Bicentennial match in Philadelphia this week.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Tuesday.

title: Rural Crime on Rise In State, F.B.I. Says
