description: TUESDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES

title: Gain Is Modest
description: The Eastman Kodak Company, the world' s largest producer of photographic products, reported yesterday a 7.8 percent increase in its secondquarter earnings.

title: Yankees Trounce A's, 101
description: The Yankees, weary of traveling but not of winning, began a brief stay at Yankee Stadium last night and kept right on winning.

title: Twas a Foul Day At the Racetrack
description: Five foul claims, an unusually large number, were lodged at Aqueduct yesterday. Three were against firstplace finishers. A winner who survived possible disqualification was William Hicks's $22.60for$2 Turn of Coin, victor in the featured $37,650 Tremont.

title: Prices Stage Recovery on Amex And Decline for Counter Issues
description: After several days of declining prices, the American Stock Exchange market value index showed a gain yesterday, closing at 104.80, up 0.38. At the same time the NASDAQ industrial index, a measurement for stock prices in the overthecounter market, closed at 96.97, off 0.11.

title: Davis, a Top Back, Leaves Jet Camp
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.T., July 21 The New York Jets found themselves today without a running back who had played a full game with the team. Steve Davis unexpectedly left training camp last night.

title: Rains Kill 121 Nepalese
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, July 21 (AP)  Rainprovoked floods and landslides have killed 121 people in western Nepal, the Nepalese press agency said to day. Last month, 150 people were buried in Pahiregaon, about 50 miles west of Katmandu, when landslides struck the village.

title: Sadat Demands That Syrian Troops Quit Lebanon
description: CAIRO, July 22President. Anwar elSadat resumed his criticism of Syria tonight and demanded that Syrian troops withdraw from Lebanon.

title: Management
description: Hilton International, which was spun off from the Hilton Hotels Corporation in 1964 and later became a subsidiary of Trans World Airlines, is essentially a management company.

title: Pan Am Loss In 2d Period Is $6 Million
description: Pan American World Airways reported yesterday that secondquarter business had improved sharply over the previous year but complained that revenues were depressed by Government refusal to allow sufficient fare increases.

title: PUBLIC JOBS BILL ENACTED AS HOUSE ALSO UPSETS VETO
description: WASHINGTON, July 22The House of Representatives overrode President Ford's veto and enacted into law today a $4 billion public works bill that has the primary aim of creating jobs. The Senate overrode the veto yesterday.

title: Mt. Vernon Bank Is Robbed Suspect Is Quickly Seized
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., July 22 (AP)A man with a toy gun took more than $5,000 from a bank here late this morning, but was captured a short time later behind a nearby apartment building, the police said, adding that all the money was recovered.

title: Camping Out Just Next Door
description: Camping just beyond the sprawl of metropolitan areas can take many forms. For example, at the Ward Pound Ridge Reservation in northern Westchester, an hour and a half from midtown Manhattan, the emphasis is on a variety of servicescamping in leantos, picnics, hiking, nature studyin an unusually spacious environment.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Mayor William S. Hart of East Orange was acquitted of charges that he had paid a $1,000 bribe to influence the appointment of a municipal judge. An Essex County jury returned the verdict of not guilty after deliberating for two hours on charges that Mr. Hart had paid an Essex County Freeholder to influence the appointment of a Municipal Court judge, Stanley Silverman.

title: Carey Signs Bill Providing Limit on Health Spa Pacts
description: ALBANY, July 22Governor Carey today signed a bill that attempts, he said, to provide consumers with safeguards in dealing with health spas, dancing schools and other selfimprovement merchandisers.

title: Nelli Kim Also Wins Twice in Gymnastics
description: MONTREAL, July 22Nadia Comaneci of Rumania and Nelli Kim of the Soviet Union split the four individual gold medals in women's gymnastics tonight, but Olga Korbut proved she still was first in the hearts of most fans at these Olympics.

title: Market Place
description: Dramatic delines in the price of gold and gold stocks have not shaken the confidence of all gold enthusiasts, especially John C. Van Eck.

description: It is entirely possibleindeed it is quite likelythat most New Yorkers who visit the liamptons for a weekend or for a longer inspection of its locales and their natural and manmade marvels, manage to miss the chic of the place.

title: Soviet Sabermen Sweep Event
description: MONTREAL, July 22 (AP) The Soviet Union became tonight the first country in 24 years to sweep the Olympic sabre fencing competition when Viktot Krovopouskov won the gold medal, Vladimir Nazlymov the silver and Viktor Sidink the bronze.

title: Ballet: New BridetoBe In Jardin
description: No matter what the provocation, none of the party guests in Jardin Aux Lilas are supposed to make a fuss. One vaguely had the suspicion that Hilda Morales, the bridetobe,just might.

title: Walker to Be Honored
description: John Walker of New Zealand, the only man to run the mile in less than 3 minutes 50 seconds, will be honored at a luncheon in New York Aug. 2. He set the mark of 3:49.4 in 1975, and was the unanimous selection to become the ninth recipient of the Tanqueray Award for excellence in amateur athletics.

title: Renoir Stolen in '74 Returned to Museum In Brooklyn by Mail
description: A small Renoir painting that was stolen from the Brooklyn Museum 19 months ago was returned undamaged to the museum in the afternoon mail on Wednesday.

description: A modest rally in the last hour of trading on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday turned the popular Dow Jones average of :30 blue chips from a minus of 0.57 to close at 991.08 for a gain of 1.64 points.

description: MONTREAL, July 22Organized sports imposed stiff new sanctions on South Africa today because of that country's racial policies.

The councilman, Richard Suisman, was opposed in some of this city's suburbs because of the city's policies urging the opening of the suburbs to the poor and elderly.

title: Jail to Open Aug. 4
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N.J., July 22 (UPI)Burlington County will open a $1.2 million minimumsecurity jail Aug. 4 at New Lisbon. The County Freeholders said yesterday that the jail, for those eligible for work releases programs, would have facilities) for 80 men and 16 women.

title: 13 Policemen Are Injured Quelling Brawl Near Bar
description: MEDFORD LAKES, N. J., July 22 (AP)Thirteen policemen and 12 other persons were injured and 10 persons were arTested early today when a melee broke out in the parking lot of a bar here.

description: TRENTON, July 22Even before the final tally of the Congressional votes to override President Ford's veto of the publicworks bill today, New Jersey was busy putting together applications for $310 million of the money.

description: SRINAGAR, July 20The Vale of Kashmir, for the first time in nearly three decades of Indian and Pakistani independence, presents a surface as calm as that of its mirrorlike Himalayan lakes.

description: SHINHOPPLE, N. Y., July 22 Al Carpenter, who rents and sells canoes for a living, looked sadly at the East Branch of the Delaware River and the two fishermen who were struggling to carry their canoe over some rocks peeking out of low water.

description: GUM PASS, Sinai, July 19 Gracious living has come to Sinai.

title: APlant in V ermont Ordered to Return Operating License
description: VERNON, Vt., July 22 (AP)A Federal court has ruled that the order granting the Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power plant its operating license must be returned to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.

title: Soviet Forfeit Adds to Woes
description: MONTREAL, July 22The Soviet Union suffered another in a series of embarrassments at the Olympic Games today. Its worldchampionship water polo team forfeited a game, indicated it might withdraw from the competition, then decided not to when threatened with disciplinary action.

title: Aerosol Packer to Appeal Case Against Ruder & Finn
description: ATI Inc., a contract packager of aerosol products, said yesterday it planned to appeal to the Appelate Division of the New York Supreme Court the decision dismissing its complaint against Ruder & Finn, a public relations firm, for failure to state a cause of action.

description: NEW LONDON, Conn.The score here stands at Preservationists 1, Demolitionists 0, in a hardfought inning that took 15 years to play and now looks like the beginning of a whole new ball game for the nation's oncegrand railroad stations.

description: MONTREAL, July 22For the moment, the International Olympic Committee is not prepared to accept a man without a country.

description: The Kennecott Copper Corpo ration, the leading domestic copper producer, had a 57 percent decline in secondquarter earnings despite a 15.1 percent sales rise to $453.7 million, the company reported.

title: France Raises Discount Rate To Bolster Weakened Franc
description: PARIS, July 22  France sought today to prevent a further withering in the international value of the franc by raising the discount rate of the Bank of France from 8 percent to 9 percent, a move intended to make it dramatically more attractive to keep money in France.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JULY 23, 1976

title: Restaurants
description: NEW YORK, where you used to have to scratch around assiduously to find acceptable Indian food, by now must have even more good Indian restauraunts than London, ranging from elaborate to humble and including a wider and wider range of regional dishes. The newest is Calcutta, at 77 West 46th Streetfairly large, moderately fancy, very good, and getting better. On our first visit three weeks ago there was no bar or wine list, a very limited menu, and shaky service. Last Saturday night there were good wines, an expanded menu, and a lot more confidence on the part of the waiters. They are being trained on the job and with a few there is a slight language barrier. Two stars plus a third in parenthesis pending a final polishing up seem in order for Calcutta.

title: U.S. Men Swim to 9th Gold in 9 Races; Nadia Comaneci Takes 2d, 3d Titles
description: MONTREAL, July 22You wouldn't believe what happened tonight in Olympic swimming.

title: TELEVISION TODAY
description: Morning

title: RADIO STATION AIDE INDICTED IN NEWARK
description: Frankie Crocker, program director of radio station WBLSFM, was indicted in Newark yesterday for allegedly making false statements before a Federal grand jury last September when it was investigating allegations of criminal conduct in the recording industry.

title: A Month After the Italian Elections, Forming of a Cabinet Seems Near End
description: ROME, July 22A month after elections Italy remains without a government but with a host of economic problems, a Communist Party growing in influence and a national mood of deep uncertainty.

title: Wrong Version of a Bill Is Made Law by Carey
description: A bill that both houses of the New York State Legislature passed in a mistaken version in the final hours of the legislative session was signed into law yesterday by Governor Carey, to the relief of those who feared that the inadvertent error might have prompted a veto.

title: Board Approves S.I. Amusement Park
description: The Board of Estimate last night approved a proposed $40 million, 146acre amusement park for Staten Island after six contentious hours of public hearings in which residents' objections were pitted against the city administration's need to stir new economic activity.

title: Major Terrorist Bands
description: The Mohammed Boudia Commando, also known as the Carlos group and, more recently, the Arm of the Arab Revolution, is a radical left, antiZionist organization with about 40 members, according to some accounts. It began in the early 1970's as part of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine. Carlos is believed to be the pseudonym of Ilich RamirezSnchez, a 25yearold Venezuelan, who led the seizure of government officials as hostages during a meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in Vienna last December.

title: LEANORA GOODMAN
description: Leanora Blossom Goodman, chairman of the I. B. Goodman Company, a jewelry manufacturing company of New York and Cincinnati, died Wednesday while visiting relatives in Indianapolis, Mrs. Goodman, who lived in New York City, was 65 years old.

title: Saigon Officer in Thailand TeIIs of a Long Road Back
description: THA BO, Thailand, July 22A group of former officers of the South Vietnamese Army who had been in Vientiane, Laos, for seven months, awaiting Hanoi's permission to return to Saigon, fled secretly to Thailand early today because they felt they had nowhere else to go.

title: 3 Big Stores in New York Plan to Open on Sundays
description: Three of New York City's largest retailersMacy's, Korvette and Alexander'swhich collectively transact a billion dollars in annual sales in the areaare mapping plans for the first largescale Sunday openings of department stores in the city and in the metropolitan area, starting possibly as early as Aug. 29.

title: Art: Arp The Enchanter
description: TEN years ago this summer, Jean Arpperhaps the gentlest of all the founders of Dadadied in Basel, Switzerland, at the age of 79. The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum has had the good idea of marking this anniversary with an exhibition of Arp's work. It is, as Arp exhibitions go, a small oneconsisting of 25 itemsyet there is more than enough here to provide us with that special sensation of pleasure we always feel on encountering his work.

description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: TREASURY FIGHTS SPECIAL TAX AIDS
description: WASHINGTON. July 22The Treasury Department added its, weight today to the forces that are putting pressure on the Senate Finance Committee to eliminate many of the narrowinterest provisions from the pending tax bill.

title: London Asks for Curbs On Diplomatic Scofflaws
description: LONDON, July 22 (Reuters) The British Foreign Office was pressed today to deal With diplomats who park illegally in London and then claim diplomatic immunity to avoid paying fines.

title: FAIRFIELD FACES A PRIMARY HOT
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 22The Democratic Party's designation of a black man to run for Congress from Fairfield County's affluent Gold Coast was challenged here today by a young white liberal in what promises to be a bitter primary fight.

title: Hospital Arbitrator
description: ROCHESTER, July 22When Margery F. Gootnick started practicing law here in 1952, being a woman lawyer was not considered socially acceptable, she recalled today. If you won, you were a pushy woman, she said, and if you lost, you were a dumb lawyer. But as a neutral arbitrator, I don't have to win or lose. I find it a very comfortable role. The uses of arbitration are growing enormously. There's a great need in our complicated world for peacemakers, and I can't imagine anything I'd rather be doing with my life. I love it.

title: Flu Vaccine Drive Meets Snags That Could Limit It
description: The program of mass immunization against swine flu announced by President Ford nearly four months ago has been meeting an increasing barrage of scientific and medical criticism and technical obstacles.

title: U.S. Technicians in Sinai Find Life Boring Despite Comforts
description: GIDI PASS, Sinai, July 19 Gracious living has come to Sinai.

title: Birth Defect Peril From Tranquilizers Is Feared by F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration warned doctors today that the nation's most widely used tranquilizers  Valium, Librium, Miltown and othersmay cause cleft lip and other birth defects if taken in early. pregnancy.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Other Highlights
description: CYCLINGGregor Braun, a 20yearold West German, captured the gold medal in 4,000meter pursuit cycling with a time of 4 minutes 47.61 seconds.

title: What to Take to the Woods
description: The stone fireplaces in each shelter should have grills, but many are missing. Bring your own if you plan to cook over a fire. Campers are encouraged to scrounge for dead wood in the surrounding area, but in many places the forest appears to have been picked clean. Artificial fuel, such as brickettes, your own small logs are therefore recommended.

title: Mieuli Buying 49ers
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 22 (AP)Franklin Mieuli, owner of the Golden State Warriors, said today that he and Joseph Alioto, former San Francisco Mayor, were purchasing controlling interest in the San Francisco 49ers of the National Football League. The price was not disclosed.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank announced yesterday the formation of a new investment bank in Saudi Arabia to be called the Saudi Investment Banking Corporation. It will be situated in Riyadh, the Saudi capital, and is scheduled to start operations early next year.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, July 22, 1976

title: New Face
description: Sometimes it really does happen. Sometimes the fairy tale comes true. You're standing in the wings; you come out for a number, and the audience responds; it chuckles, it gurgles, thenwith a kind of lemming magicit stands up and applauds. You may not know what you have done, but you know you have done it right.

title: Phils Beat Pirates on 3 Runs in First Collegiates
description: The Philadelphia Phillies widened their lead in the National League's Eastern Division to 11 games last night, beating the Pittsburgh Pirates, 30, in the first game of a fivegame series. Tom Underwood and Ron Reed combined for a sevenhit pitching effort for the winners.

title: Oregon Signs Kelch
description: EUGENE, Ore., July 22The University of Oregon announced today the signing of Jim Kelch, 1975 national Amateur Athletic Union junior champion in allround gymnastics competition.

title: Weekend Baedeker
description: Cape May, N. J., is a Victorianera seashore resort where families can spend a relatively inexpensive but busy weekend and even find quartz diamonds lying on the beach in the bargain.

title: No Rush For New Tap Law
description: Six months from now either a new Administration will take office in Washington or the Ford Administration will at last have its own mandate from the people. Among the legislative actions that might well be delayed until then is the FordLevi bill ostensibly requiring judicial warrants for wiretaps intended to gather foreign intelligence and national security information.

title: Quakers Returning From Laos Report Shortages of Food
description: A Quaker couple who have been doing relief work in Laos for the last year and a half said yesterday that the small warravaged country was hungry and that the new Communist Government was not overly popular with many inhabitants.

title: Rep. Howe Rests Case in Sex Trial; Calls No Witness
description: SALT LAKE CITY. July 22 (UPI)Representative Allan T. Howe rested his defense on sex solicitation charges today without calling a witness to rebut two policewomen's testimony that he had offered to pay $20 for two sexual acts.

title: Books of The Times
description: MISS HERBERT, THE SUBURBAN WIFE. By Christina Stead. 308 pages. Random House. $8.95.

title: Georgia Diner Owner Finds. 21 a Fuss
description: If you dine at Faye's BarBQ Villa in Americus, Ga., 9 7 miles from Jimmy Carter's front door, you may not meet anyone who has been famous for very long, unless you count television journalists.

title: Ruth Weisinger, Professor At Mt, Sinai Medical School
description: Dr. Ruth Weisinger, associate professor of pediatrics at Mount Sinai Medical School died yesterday at her home in Creskill, N. J., after a long illness. She was 49 years old.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: For those who approach televised sports with seinething nearing religious fervor, the weekend schedule carries indications of ultimate nirvana. Dominating the picture, of course, is ABC's coverage of the summer Olympics in Montreal.

title: At the Movies
description: IT'S POOR. MANNERS to make a fuss about physical imperfections. Yet the question must be asked. Where did you get those eyes?

title: Money
